Everyone that works here is so incredibly helpful! When my computer needed a hardware repair Apple gave me the option of taking it to the Genius Bar, or iCreative. I chose iCreative and I am so glad I did! They were able to get me in right away, there was no wait and the staff was helpful and knowledgeable. My computer needed a small atypical repair and even though it was a challenge to fix, I was only charged a diagnostic fee. I will come here from now on with any of my computer issues, because the staff is knowledgeable, helpful, and seem to really enjoy working where they work. Their positivity is contagious!

Update**
I had another computer repair that needed to be done and Matthew went above and beyond to help me replace my computer after a repair was not possible. He's an awesome tech person he took the time to give me exceptional service as well as go over options. Plus he's a cool dude that seems like he would be a fun person to hang out with!

review.author: LaToyah J.
review.description:
This school is the WORSTTTTTTTTT school in the Bronx. DO NOT send any of your children here, they would not learn anything but how to be rude and disrespectful. However, I'm not sure how this site rate this as a top 2 school near 10466 because it should never even be on this list to think about it. The staff are not friendly, the surroundings are dirty. 
This school is a failing school, it is near the shutdown date. Most of the students come from edenwald, all they know how to do is fight and bully people kids. I repeat, DO NOT SEND YOUR KIDS TO BRONXWOOD PREP ACADEMY! YOU WILL REGRET THIS IF YOU DON'T TAKE MY ADVICE.

Thanks for reading :)

review.author: Justice Y.
review.description:
We are so lucky to have found Jean Benson! We are a military family who recently moved to the area. I was lucky enough to find Jean Benson with a google search and the staff there got my daughter started right away. The staff is very conscientious of illnesses and always looking out for the best interest of the child. They use an app to stay in contact with parents about their children, including pictures and important messages. My daughter fell in love with all of the teachers she would even ask to see them over the weekends. She has since moved onto elementary school and to this day still asks for the staff at Jean Benson. That alone shows how much love they put into what they do. Not a day went by that any of the staff looked unhappy. 
I met f families there who have had all of their children attend this program, which is great to hear about a school. 

We miss Jean Benson!! You will definitely not regret sending your child to this school. 

I know that every review can't be all peachy. The only negative thing I can say about this daycare is the parking isn't the best. There are times during the busy drop-off and pick-up blocks there is no parking available. Nothing a little patience won't fix. 

I recommend them 100% to any parents looking for quality care for their little ones.

review.author: Mariana T.
review.description:
We love Jean Benson! This school is amazing!! My son is greeted every morning with a smile from the Director, Ms. Cristy! My son absolutely adores his teacher Ms. Cintia, and her assistants. She truly cares about her students and really shows!! He's learned so much since he started school in August 2021. We get daily updates, pictures, reminders in a phone app. I love getting daily pictures of what he's doing in class. Ms. Maria is always kind and willing to answer any of your questions at the front desk. Ms. Judy always makes delicious, healthy meals that are provided everyday. 

Along with the day-to-day activities, they are always doing special things around holidays for the kids/parents (virtual Halloween parade, Christmas singing program, etc) I absolutely love it and I truly appreciate Ms. Cinita, Ms. Melissa, Ms. Victoria, Ms. Cristy, and all the teachers for making memories for the students, especially with these difficult social distancing restrictions. 

I honestly could go on and on, but most importantly. I don't have to question what type of care my son is getting. I know he's being loved, nurtured and cared for by the wonderful teachers and staff here at Jean
 Benson YMCA.

review.author: Dianna C.
review.description: This daycare is very good and the hours are great for parents that work. I was lucky to find this daycare.

review.author: Andrea H.
review.description: I've been using the YMCA for over 10 years for all of my children. My youngest attends this preschool and we love it! We are really treated like family. The staff truly cares about the children, concerned in all areas of development. Not only did my son receive a great educational experience, they helped him socially, encouraging him to speak up and participate. My son had health issues this past school year and they were very attentive, working with me on the special needs he developed. This preschool is committed to providing the children with a caring, engaging and positive experience. I have recommended this preschool to friends and co-workers and I will continue to do so.

review.author: B M.
review.description: Where do I start? Ok I absolutely love this place! I mean teachers are awesome! Location is perfect as I feel is very private, it's a smaller YMCA compared to other locations but I love the atmosphere when I walk in every morning to drop off my son, Monique is super sweet at the entrance, Ms Alyssa is so adorable and nice, so is Ms Rose! I feel so comfortable every morning dropping off my son as they always hold him, or hug him in a very loving way on days where he doesn't want to stay.Such an inviting atmosphere makes me want to be a kid again just to be able to stay, seriously! Thank you girls for being so sweet all the time! I almost don't want my son to grow up because I wish teachers would remain as sweet as all of you! Your job is the hardest yet you all always manage to keep a huge smile on your face, I absolutely love this place, I highly highly recommend it to any parent out there that's looking for a child care development, I have three kids and I must say this is by far the best one, and I am so glad I found it, Or I should say I'm glad LQ YMCA recommended me to this location it's just perfect! Not to mention classrooms smell so good every morning! I've yet to figure out what they use. Thank you Jean Benson team! Your work is highly appreciated.

review.author: Martin S.
review.description: It was a beautiful day and we spent it here. Love that the vendors are back and it seems to be growing.

review.author: Ed V.
review.description: Went there on a weekend and parked where there were no cars parking around me and parked a little over on one of the lines where I parked and a Barney five security came up and told me he can give me a ticket for parking over the line like I told him that no one is around and I am not that far over the line. Very rude security definitely a Barney five situation. Maybe the security should be trained on how to talk and treat people on their campus. And not act so gung ho. Mellow out security.

review.author: Jessica M.
review.description: This place should be more professional, trying to deliver and the security asking personal questions, and when I asked him why I had to give that info he gets defensive, this place is a joke!!!

review.author: Leon S.
review.description: If you have had a problem with COD's nursing program please contact Candace036@aol.com. As a former student there are questions I can answer for you.

review.author: Michelle M.
review.description: I give it a 5 star because instructors at least the ones I have had have been very attentive and caring for students. Instructors give support at all times

review.author: Jennifer B.
review.description: The people that run this college are absolutely clueless. Official transcripts get lost, they have no idea how to maintain and update student records, it's like they've never learned how to do their job. Admissions and Records is a joke; get your act together and learn how to do your job properly! So glad to be done with this school. It's like trying to communicate with 5 year olds (even though 5 year olds would probably be more competent honestly)

review.author: Hannah Y.
review.description:
1. I wish I could give negative stars
2. I wish I could curse on here because COD Counseling Services is a F@#%&$ joke!!!! 

If this review was about the professors it would be 5 stars, so please keep that in mind. 

I was a student here for one year and my sister has been a student there for about 2 years. I am not even exaggerating, every single time I or my sister have had to refer to counseling to resolve an issue, we end up going back and forth talking to multiple counselors because most of them have absolutely no idea what the F$@& they are talking about!! 

If you are thinking of attending this school, know this: you will get a good education (I took mostly science classes and an English course and I had wonderful teachers and wonderful resources). But be warned, counseling will most likely screw you over. Not intentionally, just because they don't know what they are doing. 

Good luck!!

review.author: Sum D.
review.description: Worst staff on the planet.  Feels like the DMV.  They obviously don't realize the students pay their salaries.  Liberal training camp.  Emotionless.  Could care less.  THE ONLINE SYSTEM IS A JOKE!!!! If anyone tells you to go ahead and do it online, call them a lair.  Their system is the worst.  Nothing works.  I'm in the office every single time I need something done.  Fire em all.  Start over.  The experiment  didn't work!!!!!!!

review.author: Joseph S.
review.description: I have been taking classes at CoD on and off for years. I have never really had a particular AS as my goal. The campus is well maintained, the classroom are usually clean and neat. I have had many wonderful professors that are engaged, and do their best to keep things interesting. Certainly, I have had a class or two where the professor should reevaluate their classroom demeanor.\nWhat I see most of is that many of the students are just out of high school, and are not used to the college environment. At the college level teachers/professors are not going to hold their hand, and keep reminding students to get their reading and assignments done. Most 'failures' are caused by unprepared or unwilling students.

review.author: Xila Z.
review.description: College of the desert...  \nI can't say enough bad things about this college. \nNot student friendly. Not willing to help students out. Not willing to bend some rules on programs in EOPS, not helpful in the aid process of anything financial, cart food is too too expensive. Parking is outrageous, the campus is NOT LIVELY AT ALL. I mean yes it's the desert, but shit, it's so dead on campus. Math teachers giving ill info in regards to book policies and returns. Book store is horrible at explaining return. Attempted to return a sealed passcode and was denied. WITH receipt! First meeting with a counselor was a blow. He told me he was brand new to this school. Had to double check on everything he told me. And was wrong. Seriously, if you can, PLEASE stay away from this college.

review.author: Makoa's M.
review.description: Not sure if this college actually exists. My son enrolled and then the pandemic hit. Understandably campus was closed and classes are online. Then their website was hacked. Despite the site coming back up I have called and left numerous messages and emailed to no avail. My son's scholarship was sent there and we can't even get it because no one answers emails or returns calls. They cancelled a class he enrolled for because it was no longer being offered but they haven't credited him for the overpayment and when he logs in it doesn't show up in his account. I'm fed up but live in another state so continuing the calls and leaving messages is all I can do.

review.author: Jenny A.
review.description:
My background: I graduated this May 2015 with an Associate's in Liberal Arts with an emphasis on Math & Science and will be starting nursing school at a 4 year university. I

98% of people told me I would get stuck here at COD. I was one of the few people that actually graduated and will be transferring out. 

CAMPUS: Out of all the campuses I have been to, this is one of the most prettiest and modern community college campus in Southern California. There is tons of parking. 

PROFESSORS: There are good AND bad professors. You have to ask around and see who are the good professor. 

CLASSES: If you are/will be a science major like me, it will be very difficult to get classes. My advice is to be persistent with enrolling for classes and always make sure you're on top with studying. 

COUNSELORS: I'll be honest. You can't expect them to know everything. You must do your research before meeting with them. 

ASSESSMENT TEST: STUDY! You must take this assessment test seriously because if you do not do well, you will be place in non-credit remedial math/English courses which will take you awhile. 

STUDENT LIFE: There is no student life. Most students there are there to come to class and leave. 

CAFE FOOD: It's disgusting. After my first year, I stopped buying food regularly from the cafe. I only purchased packaged snacks and drinks from there. 

Just stay on top of things and remember to not give up on your dream. It's a community college that is packed just like any other community college.

review.author: Barbara Y.
review.description: While it's a beautiful campus, the ad min is terrible. Not only are the required courses not available, forcing you to take them else where, they have repeatedly lost the transcripts denying credit. Even with proof, of submission dates, some one invariably forgot to log them. It happened that they even withheld the diploma even though they had all transcripts on file! This caused a delay in college entrance.

review.author: Chris T.
review.description: In 2020 the COD ADN Nursing  program is not what it used to be. They had an opportunity to hire top notch professors when a mass retirement  occurred a few years ago but instead, due to politics, friends and friends-of-friends got hired by the Dean who makes the final decisions and the program is now disorganized and stressful with teachers who  don't understand what they are trying to teach. Some of the professors behave in an extremely unprofessional manner toward students and sooner or later enough students will have the courage to report these incidents.

review.author: Pauline A.
review.description:
I took the time and effort to drive from Orange County to COD. I have to commence by stating the admission department needs a roadmap to blow their nose; I was told that since I did not have an on-line account I would have to drive to come and get my transcripts. The lady who answers the phone failed to tell me 1) There is NO visitor parking 2) I would have to have cash to pay for an all day parking pass 3) There is a $6.50 library hold that would delay getting my transcripts 4) It will take 24 hours to release my transcripts 5) Finally, to top all this off that it will cost me $25 to get my transcripts contingent on getting the library hold released. 

This all was per "Blanca." This individual stated I would have to go to the library and resolve, come back & get my transcripts. When I finally got back from the library the lady there a 2nd lady who after 30 minutes, a different & equally difficult lady sent me back downstairs for the 3rd time to pay. I came back up & she was unsure Ido was going to be able to get my transcripts today until I told "Blanca" said I would. When I enquired with the 2nd lady she was extremely persnickety & said "well, did you ask if there was visitor parking?" I asked if there wasn't a policy & procedures in place to properly inform people who called. I explained that I was clear about the fact I was coming from Orange County & why would I not be properly informed. 2nd lady said well generally a student answers the phone, so I take that as her passing the buck and absolving herself of any responsibility. 

Thankfully, Roger at the student library was able to clear the hold, man has the patience of a saint.

In summation this whole ordeal has left me with an inset on a migraine. I am going to have to go have lunch because it's going to take another hour to get the official transcripts.

review.author: Frankie A.
review.description: The education here is sub par compared to other SoCal schools. The professors are not interested in what they are doing and they basically don't care. Good luck getting your transcripts in a timely matter for a reasonable cost. Be prepared to pay for your transcripts from this lowly institution. I recommend MSJC down the road.

review.author: Issel G.
review.description:
I hate it... it's so crowed. It's hard to get the important classes (Math) and (English). 

I dropped out because I've had bad experiences there. 
My first year there was very miserable for me. 
I took a architect class. This professor wasn't even prepared. She would bring guest speakers and the guest speakers wouldn't show or they would be a hour late. Everyone would be on their phones. Or staring at the landscaping class next door. I felt very uncomfortable because there was a lot of people who worked in that business field and I felt like I was lost. It was awkward for me.

review.author: Karlaa S.
review.description: Counseling office is a JOKE!!! Front desk staff is filled with kids that don't know jack s$&%. They can't schedule appointments right, have no sense of customer service, and can't even answer questions correctly. I absolutely hate having to go to the counselors office because of this.

review.author: Austin S.
review.description: Parking sucks! They have the money or can atleast get the money to have a parking garage built by the new gym and in other areas where one level parking lots are. there is more parking for staff than students. $20 for a permit to park every semester and there is never any spots near my classes. I have to get to class at least 45 minutes early if I don't want to walk from one end of campus to the other in 100 degree weather. the staff is snobby in every single department and sometimes they do not know how to answer my questions. \n\nbut this is the only college in the area. please build the palm springs satellite campus ASAP. we have all been waiting.

review.author: Yazmin H.
review.description: Cod has grown a bit nicer from when I first started I wish they added more holistic medicine classes or some special education programs that are different different. Other than that I'm proud of them for expanding and branching out to Indio now.

review.author: Mike S.
review.description:
My three youngest sons, all five year-olds, are currently attending Palm Valley School.  We moved to the desert from Orange County last summer; prior to the move, I spent a lot of time researching every school in the valley (I'll save you the effort).  My gut said Palm Valley School, so scheduled a visit.

The first person I met was Abby Sturgeon, Director of Admissions.  Absolutely wonderful person!  Abby stayed late after our meeting to answer questions, and gave me a tour of the Transitional Kindergarten building and classrooms.  During my meeting with Abby, Dr. Steve Sherman, Palm Valley Head of School, came in to say hi.  Another wonderful person!  I left that afternoon certain this is where I want my kids to learn.

A few days later, I was back at Palm Valley filling out all the admissions paperwork for my three little boys.  As a single dad, my kids are with me almost all the time when not in school.  They joined me this time as well.  It was a bit overwhelming filling out paperwork with three curious and active little guys bouncing around me.  I was going to take it home, but before I had a chance to pack up, in walks Dr. Steve Sherman.  Steve, instead of assisting me out the door, voluntarily took my kids for an impromptu puppet show, raced them in the halls of the empty building, and entertained them in a way that would have made Mary Poppins jealous.  I was able to complete the remaining paperwork without distraction.

Over this past year I have gotten to know Steve much better.  He is often out in the front entry driveway greeting vehicles in the morning, many times with costumes coinciding with holidays.  Steve is almost always outside the school buildings saying goodbye to the kids and parents in the afternoon as well.  He is a super high-character guy who truly cares about every student at his school... and apparently builds elaborate five-star treehouses for his grandkids in his spare time.

My sons originally started transitional kindergarten this past August.  First day... met more amazing staff and teachers!...  Becky Chaffins (Assistant Director of Preschool/ Lead Teacher) and Kaira Beach (Head of Preschool).  Class sizes of about 12 students.  Lots of love and a passion for teaching is what you can expect from Becky and Kaira.  My little guys ran into their classroom every day without looking back.  They left school each day excitedly talking over each other about what they had learned.

By October, my three sons were doing well enough to be moved up to kindergarten, at age four.

Could it get any better?... apparently, yes.  Now I have the pleasure of meeting Francene Fisher (Head of Lower School), Jeanne Anguiano (Lower School Operations), and Annette Van Vliet (Kindergarten Teacher).  If there is a better group of people to leave my kids with, I'm yet to meet them.  Class size again is about 12 students.

My three sons and their classmates bonded quickly, and I mean all their classmates.  They love each other.  My kids write beautiful notes and draw pictures for other students and Annette many evenings after we get home, so they can bring them the following day.  They run to other students at drop off to hold hands as they walk to class.

The parents are great too.  We meet at the zoo, meet for birthdays, and do play dates often.  I have never seen or heard of a school that has an environment like this.  I'm grateful every day they are at Palm Valley, especially during these critical early years of learning.

Now, academics.  My kids just turned five, and they are reading, writing, understand concepts of time, measurement, estimation, math, speak rudimentary Spanish, know basic sign language, sing songs they learn in music class, practice art using depth perception, count in the thousands, etc, etc, etc.  The person primarily responsible:  Annette Van Vliet.  Annette has been teaching kindergarten at Palm Valley School for nearly 20 years, and inspires a deep passion for learning in such a kind and loving way.  My kids are confident in their abilities and, most importantly, have a strong foundation for the future.  I could never thank Annette enough for everything she has done for my kids.

Usually, I try to balance out an evaluation with pros and cons.  This is a rare instance where I cannot think of one thing I would change about Palm Valley School.  Sending my kids to Palm Valley is one of the best decisions I've ever made.  I have an 18 year-old son as well who went through private schools in Orange County, from pre-K through high school.  All stellar schools.  Yet, did not understand how exceptional a school could be until this past year.

review.author: Michael B.
review.description: Our son just finished his first year at Palm Valley and we just re-enrolled\nhim for the next year. My wife and I love the education, care, and attention our son  gets from the teachers and other staff. The school is very organized and structured, plenty of family events as well. Since our son started going here he has been very polite to others, his vocabulary is outstanding. We also love the buddy system , each pre-school  student gets an older student from the school that escorts them to events such as assemblies, our son thinks its the coolest thing to hang out with older students. Very secure campus, plenty of space for kids to play, classrooms are very tidy and organized, and the teachers give plenty of attention to each and every student.

review.author: Kristin K.
review.description: My children have attended Palm Valley school for 5 years. The education they receive there is the best one could ask for in the desert. Both the staff and all of the families there are so welcoming and caring, everyone knows each other; it is truly a tight knit community. My children get PE everyday and have art classes, music, and now even spanish weekly! We have a fantastic new head of school as well.

review.author: Cheyanne M R.
review.description:
Like most parents, I strive for the best for my child. It's not easy picking a school, but after the school year has started I know I've made the absolute right choice for our family. Not only am I honored to be a Palm Valley parent, I'm extremely proud!!!!!

The administration is very welcoming, accommodating, and open to hear my voice and anything I've had to say.   I feel comfortable to discuss what I feel is important, whether it be my with my child's teacher or the  wonderful head of school Mrs. Rice. I've been treated with great respect and nothing less!!

I believe in this  incredible school and align myself with the way its ran 100%. Mrs. Rice is the leader that Palm Valley needs and I'm confident  that she makes the best decisions for our school.  Her devotion is truly pure and the love she has for Palm Valley is undeniable!  Our school wouldn't be what it is today, without her.  A big thanks to the whole administration working together to give our children the best!! 

My  child has blossomed more than ever since attending Palm Valley, and I know its because of the devotion and compassion this school is made of.  My child's teachers have  made an impact on my child's life as they continue to grow and learn and I am forever grateful for that!! 

Palm Valley is an exceptional school that has far exceeded my expectations.  From the kind Teachers such as; Mrs. Traub, Ms Garza & Ms Perez, awesome Directors like Mr. Klausz , and Wonderful Head of School Mrs. Rice - everyone has been easy to talk to and share input with.  The community here is Real and  it feels like Family!!  Cheers to many more years!!

review.author: Sepideh P.
review.description:
Palm Valley used to be a great school. Everything changed since 2015 after the era of the new principal.
If you want to know more about how the head of school is running the business see this article:

https://www.desertsun.com/story/news/education/2018/10/18/palm-valley-school-parent-complaints-end-student-expulsions/550826002/

This is what happens to kids whose parents dare to criticize or question the head of school. 
She rules the school with absolute power exactly like a dictator.
This is not something that we should see in the 21st century and in America.


Edit: I actually have firsthand experience with the head of school. My son, Ryan, who was in Palm Valley since kindergarten got expelled from school last March with no fault of his own. 
My son started school in Palm Valley when he was 5, he actually grew up in this school. He had all his friends in the school and in March this year while he was in 6th grade, he was expelled by the head of school. It was a very difficult time for him to adjust. He couldn't understand why he- who has not done anything wrong should be punished. 
I still don't know how a person calling herself principal who is supposed to care for the kids and actually shape their trust towards authority can do such a thing to a kid.
I posted this review because I want parents to make an informed decision before they sign up their kid for this school and under the supervision of the new administration.

review.author: Kavita D.
review.description: In my 13 years as a member of the Palm Valley School community where my younger two children went, 9 of those years were under the leadership of Mr. Vince Downey and were fantastic years. During that time I can recall one student being expelled for possession of a knife and threatening another child.  The child actually did something wrong.   In the past two years, we have been under the leadership of Susan Rice- who I consider to be an egomaniacal dictator.  She has expelled many innocent young students because their parents had questions regarding grades, mass exodus  of teachers mid year or  other such concerns that she didn't want to answer or deal with.  Mind you, the parents pay a lot of money and should be able to question anything, especially with regard to education, grades, teacher turnover, meals, etc Last week, We dodged a bullet and preemptively withdrew Our son knowing he would be the next victim of her expulsion. He is a straight A student with not a negative mark on his record and lived by teachers and peers. In her usual MO, as she has done with previous parents, she sent us an email stating that we need to meet with her in her office immediately or the outcome would affect Sid. It was a veiled threat. Well, we did our research and found out from several sources what exactly transpires in her Little Chamber of Secrets.  Her email was prompted by recent concerns I had regarding her leadership and the loss of many faculty and students under her regime. Even after we withdrew Sid she sent me an epic email  which now directied the threats at me.  Today I learned that another brilliant, MENSA category, articulate, talented 6th grader  was expelled because his parents had similar concerns. The student as with many before him did NOTHING wrong.  Like  Sid he had been there since preschool and also like Sid was an asset to the school as a student.  Can you imagine the emotional trauma and impact on these kids?  But what really irks me is how other faculty, families and the Board stand silently and allow her to carry on?  Is it a dictatorship? Are there no checks and balances? Does she have sole decision making power? The family whose child was most recently expelled fled  from Iran to escape a dictatorship. Doesn't anyone care about the impact this has on the children?? Being expelled, having a mark on their record, leaving a place and community they have considered home, leaving friends, having to make new ones with three months remaining in the school year?  What does the Board do?? The Board is comprised of supposedly upstanding members of the community such as doctors, lawyers and even law enforcement officers. In my opinion, These people are no different than the people who knew about and enabled criminlas like Jerry Sandusky Or Larry Nassar.  While this is not sexual abuse or physical it is ABUSE.  Abuse of power and emotional abuse towards innocent children.. Silent bystanders who know and allow this conduct to continue are just as guilty of wrongdoing and emotionally abusing children.  It is truly a sad state of affairs which  will undoubtably lead to the decline and possible death of what was once a great school.  Do your Due Diligence. Unfortunately, I had to give it one star but that is being generous. There should be a negative star rating.\n\nI

review.author: Tessa S.
review.description: The Toddler Program is incredible!!! My son has been in the program for approximately 2 months and he is already doing so well! He has learned baby sign language and is already communicating with me! He even tells us "Agua" when he wants water! Mrs. Traub, Ms. Nuno, and the Director Mr. Klausz are absolutely fabulous! They have worked with us in setting goals for my son ( such as limiting bottle and Pacifier ) and have even set up a plan for potty training! I couldn't have asked for a better school for my son! Thank you for all the love you show!

review.author: Stone J.
review.description:
Palm Valley has been a wonderful experience. My daughter, a happy and bright little girl in her third year at Palm Valley, loves the school.  As a single parent who is bearing the entire cost of the education, I also love PVS for a number of reasons. 

The first reason are the teachers. They are caring, capable, and committed. Most, if not all, have advanced degrees, bring rich experiences to the classrooms, and pay attention to the details. Each of my daughter's teachers she has loved, and have been caring, empowering, and made sure each student received what he or she needed. For example, during each of the last two school years, both of my daughters teachers, without being prompted, volunteered to stay late a few afternoons a week to tutor my daughter through some tough spots. 

Another reason I am a fan of PVS is the staff. The staff are well-educated, and caring professionals. They make the time to address issues, provide updates, and ensure each of the kids receive what that individual student needs to thrive.  In my case, staff has been especially patient with my situation, and has kept a loving eye out over my daughter. I can't tell you how much this means.  The staffs' care has truly been a blessing. Each of the staff my daughter interacts with are good-hearted, ethical women, who take pride in what they do. IMHO, they are great influences.

Another reason I value my daughter's time at Palm Valley are the resources, which are available to her.  There are a total of nine students in my daughter's classroom.  She can't help but get one-on-one time and attention not possible if she was attending a school with 30 or 40 students per classroom. There are a number of enrichment programs such as technology, robotics, music, physical education, language, and a really strong arts program. Also, PVS values critical thinking and reasoning. They begin to introduce the rigors of college-level education as the students advance in their PVS education. I watch the graduating seniors each year. Each year, PVS's seniors are accepted into a number of the nation's top universities with significant scholarship offers. I want this for my daughter.

Another reason I value my daughter's time at Palm Valley are the other parents. The majority of the parents I've met are accomplished professionals from a variety of fields who care about their child's(ren's) education. Please know I have a number of friends who are similarly impressive people and professionals. These friends care deeply about their child, and chose to send their kids to public school. That works for them, and I am confident their kids are going to do incredible in life [in part because they have such good parents (the apple doesn't fall far from the tree)].   This said, I like knowing that when my daughter makes friends at school, and spends time with these friends outside of school, there is a high likelihood that the parents of the other kids similarly value academics, achievement, and hopefully integrity. 

Lastly, my daughter has made a number of great friends. The kids in her class are bright, good hearted, and come from an ethnically diverse background.  Great kids, great parents, and enriching experiences... All good things.    

While the cost of PVS is no small amount, I look at the yearly tuition as an investment in my daughter's future.

I hope my thoughts help anyone looking for the "perfect" school to send their child/ren. While no school is perfect, PVS has been a great, great experience.

review.author: Kylie W.
review.description: I just started my 18 month son in Palm Valleys Cricket program. I was extremely nervous as most new moms are. I've been so pleasantly surprised at how easy the transition has been. The teachers let me call and check on my baby everyday, and send photos, so I'm not a nervous nelly, it really makes me feel comfortable and confident with the staff. The staff as been fantastic and plan on keeping him there as long as possible.

review.author: Chris N.
review.description: As a parent with 2 children attending PVS, I am very satisfied with my experience as a new family this year. My family has felt extremely welcomed into this wonderful community. Starting with the Head of School Mrs. Rice and continuing down to Mrs. Fisher the Head of Lower school, where my daughter is in kindergarten and Mr. Klausz the Head of Preschool where my son is. My children previously attended another private preschool in the area but after attending a few events for PVS, we felt this was a better fit moving forward. We love the teachers that our children have and feel like we are leaving them with family. The communication is open and honest and we have never felt more confident in our children's education.

review.author: Jayne L.
review.description: My kids went to this school back in the day and it seemed okay although the administation was well, a bit out of the ordinary. However recently it appears that things have degraded somewhat.   If you want to send your child here i would take a serious look at their staff turnover, etc before proceeding.

review.author: Greg R.
review.description:
I have two children attending Palm Valley now. I have read all the reviews and many are from parents that have left. I thought it was time for someone to post a review from a current parent that is still with the school. While I can't speak to issues parents have had, my experience has been vastly different and positive. 

Both of our children are happy at Palm Valley. The parents we meet through Palm Valley, we've formed tremendous bonds with and respect. To me this speaks volumes about the school community and likely quality of kids my children will interact with. In many cases, these parents have the means to send their children anywhere they want for school and have chosen to send and keep their kids at Palm Valley. 

I have found the current administration is willing to help when asked. I have one child that was having a hard time educationally. I meet with the Head of school, within a few days of my request. She brought in teachers, the head of lower school, found us an outside testing center, and because we were willing to do what was necessary as parents, the school created a team to help. We were also expected to do our part. Our child is now receiving 1 on 1 teaching with a specialized teacher during the school day combined with classes from two grades and has built a team of staff we communicate with weekly. There are also outside tutors the school is interacting with. In fact, I meet with the whole team again this week, my 3rd time in less than a month. The school was even willing to have the outside testing company observe the classroom and paid for it.  In my opinion, way above and beyond. To get this type of specialized attention is rare but also what you're paying for at Palm Valley. 

School education is more than just the educational tools; reading, writing, math etc. My older child is learning how to do public speaking, learning how to act and behave, look people in the eye when speaking, Palm Valley goes beyond the traditional curriculum. My son just came back from a 2-day overnight at a Marine Institute in Catalina. To me, a school is the sum of the educational work and other activities combined that lead to a well-rounded child's total education. 

We have found the school to be overly concerned about behavior and bullying issues and we are grateful for this. The school does expect parents to get involved if there are issues and be proactive. I like this approach and appreciate I know what's going on. I would much rather, too concerned, than not enough. The stories are everywhere today and they all end with if only someone paid more attention...

Where graduates are going is also a good indication of how a school is doing and Palm Valley has fantastic college placement. At the end There are cheaper options than Palm Valley it's expensive, but you get what you pay for. They also give out a fair amount of financial aid. If you compared Palm Valley to private schools in most other places, Boston, NY, Los Angeles.... it's a bargain at 30-40% less. I hope this helps prospective parents. All the best in your search.

review.author: Sandy L.
review.description: My 2 children have attended PVS for the past 8 years (middle school & high school). Our experience has been great. They have received an excellent education & built strong communication skills. My oldest child is now excelling at a major university, which I think is a direct result of the stellar preparation provided by PV.  I have always found the staff and administration to be very approachable, readily available & open to discussing concerns. I am very thankful my children have had the opportunity to attend PVS.

review.author: Donika S.
review.description:
My family with three children have been with Palm Valley School for 8 years.  I choose a private school because the options for public school are just not appealing to me for them.  That leaves private school as the option and I am happy to have chosen Palm Valley School to educate and affect their lives.  They have each received a very personal, hands-on academically-driven education with many options in the fine arts.  The school is made up of three dynamic campuses:  Lower School, Middle School and Upper School and I've seen my children experience each level.  The lower school has changed significantly since my children left that part of the campus and seems all for the better with the addition of technology and labs.  Mean girls seem to be on every school campus no matter where you go and that problem although exists, is being handled much swifter than in the past.   A bully (very mean girl) and her bully mother were rightfully asked to leave after the mother bullied children (including my own). This woman actually laid hands on someone else's child.  The school did the right thing and as a private school they can act without limits of public school rules. Because the classes are smaller, the problem of mean girls is a much bigger problem at other schools and at PVS can be addressed faster with control.  The teachers and administration today identify these issues immediately and try to help everyone resolve them such as recommending relevant resources or ultimate removal if there is no willingness to change.  Because of the smaller classes, teachers will and have reached out to me about a behavioral change in my child or a concern about an academic subject.  We can and did address that immediately together and this is an invaluable service.  

The Middle School years are the most formative years for all children and this is my favorite part of PVS - the children grow in a very safe and caring environment where academics remain the focus.  I think this is the best kept secret in the desert - the Middles School at Palm Valley.  If you can afford private school for a short time, this is where you want to spend the money - the Middle School at Palm Valley.  The school continually emphasizes the fine arts augmenting the high academics - their experience in drama and music blow parents away with each performance and presentation.  For instance, at a young age in 3rd grade, the students begin annual poetry recitals and get excited finding the right poem to present to a large room that includes the entire school.  This is tremendous experience.  These poetry recitals carry through Middle School and the Upper School with optional participation in regional competitions.  The relationships the students develop with the teachers feel very collegiate - these are mentors the kids admire and stay connected with throughout their lifetime.  

Although the school is not well known for its athletic teams, physical education is absolutely part of the daily curriculum and complemented with the teachings of a healthy life style.  For instance, Mondays are knows as Mile Monday because they have to run/walk at least a mile in PE each Monday.  Goes over well with teenage girls!  Seriously though, to keep children moving daily coupled with good eating habits, well we all know how imperative that is.  

My children have each received so far a very fulsome experience and I'm grateful for the teachers and administration and the parents too.  The number of volunteers and commitment of the parents is significant and I know they help watch over all the kids including my own when I'm not there.  I have PVS friends who've left the area or moved to other local schools and their children are all thriving.  Evidence that the school provides a great foundation of academics and more.  

I work full time and all the disposable income I earn goes to their education.  Each morning when I drop them off, I feel so much relief that they are in a safe place getting an exceptional education without sacrificing the arts, the sciences or physical activity.  A commitment to a private school is a very major decision and I hope this review helps another mom or dad.  My children are surrounded by teachers and parents who are committed to a well-rounded education.  Palm Valley School has been a blessing for my children and a constant foundation in a life surrounded by change.  They will each be ready for college or whatever they decide to do with lifelong friendships made along the way.

review.author: Theresa H.
review.description: I am a parent at PVS.  My 2 children have attended PVS for the past 5 years and will remain at PVS until they graduate high school in another 3 years.   PVS has sustained their mission in academics alongside innovative teaching.  This school has kept the attention on instilling values and keeping individual attention to students, respect, partnership and diversity. In the last 5 years I have witnessed my children's personal and academic growth.  Both have outstanding communication and conceptual skills, both have not only exceeded my expectations, but they have exceeded their own.  As I read the negative attacks written by former parents I stand to question what personal values are being shown here.   Good leaders funnel emotions into positive actions that drive change. I encourage my kids to use their personal experience and all that they have learned at PVS  to solidify their own values and ideas. I hope they commit themselves that standing to make a difference in the world has more value than becoming narrowly focused with the indifference.  PVS has a great administration. One that I have total confidence in to ensure my 2 children receive an outstanding education.

review.author: Bao K.
review.description: Well of course you would not find our name because we were forced to leave at the expense of your headmaster, also you are a newly hired staff member. Sorry, the school has no recollection of the fight because my child still remembers it :(

review.author: Cherise S.
review.description: Palm Valley is the most incredible school and community of dedicated families, faculty, administration and especially our Head of School.   We have been at the school over 10 years and with new leadership the School keeps getting better and better. Our children's education is most important to us as parents.  We are confident that PVS is the very best School to challenge them academically while nurturing them as they grow and develop.  It is normal for teaches and students to change.  I have always seen the school treat everyone with the greatest respect.   Palm Valley offers everything that the very best private school schools offer. Very grateful to be part of the Firebird family.  I would be happy to talk with anyone who has questions about this incredible school.

review.author: Briana J.
review.description: My daughter has been in the preschool program for 3 months now and I could not be happier with our decision to enroll her at Palm Valley.  I have been nothing but impressed with the staff, the administration, the school grounds, school events and my daughter's experience in the classroom.  Her teacher, Mrs. Traub, is one of a kind and clearly loves the kids in her classroom.  As a first time parent, it takes a lot for me to trust a school enough to drop off my 18-month old every day...but I have the utmost confidence in PVS.  Mrs. Rice, the Head of School, has been friendly and engaging and even encourages parents to come in and meet with her.  We recently toured the Lower School (K - 5th Grade) just to get a glimpse into the future and we were so impressed with that specific campus...the teachers, the students, the classrooms, etc.  I can't wait for my daughter to get to experience it all!

review.author: J K.
review.description: My child has attended Palm Valley School for 9 years and it has grown and improved during that time in many ways.  Most families come to this school because of the educational programs, personal attention to students, quality of faculty, and 100% college acceptance rate, all of which are very good reasons.  We will stay at the school through high school graduation for those reasons, as well as the school's emphasis on developing students to be respectful and caring citizens who value equity, diversity, and inclusion.  I feel very fortunate to have the opportunity to send my child here, as do the hundreds of families who also consider it the best school for their children.

review.author: Brad O.
review.description: My Child currently attends Palm Valley and we couldn't be happier. My child needs have been met and have actually exceeded our expectations on their growth. The administration is very approachable and attentive to our needs. We wanted the best for our child and we feel Very confident we have the best for our child's education. In today world you cannot sacrifice a proper education and well being for your children.

review.author: Michael L.
review.description:
Worst customer service ever!

I called Friday 10/27/17 to inquire about there dance / lessons / services and I believe I spoke with the owner Cecilia Shahandeh. I briefly expressed what I liked about her website and inquired about a particular dance that she has listed, she basically just brushed me off, said she was busy, took down my phone number and stated she'll get back to me. It is now Tuesday and not even a courtesy call back. 

Very unprofessional.

review.author: Rachel W.
review.description: Taking Salsa & Bachata lessons here at beyond the beat dance studio on Friday nights is one of the best things to do in the desert! If you're looking for a way to socialize and learn something new this is it! It is $10 for one lesson or $15 for 2 lessons and there is a freestyle social dancing held after the lessons as well.

review.author: Magdalena D.
review.description: How disappointing I show up with my daughter for the ballet class and no one is here???? I was told the class is every Saturday at 10am. What a waste of time.

review.author: Eric S.
review.description: Started taking private lessons at this studio about 3 months ago.  I have no dance experience whatsoever.  The progression is quick and consistent, if you put in the effort.  The instructors are very patient with me especially since my background in dance is non existent.  I will most likely be learning everything these instructors offer... except ballet.

review.author: Bianca S.
review.description: Great studio, I have been going for about 6 years now and I love it there. They offer a wide variety of different style of dance and the teachers are very helpful. I started with no background in dance and the teachers were very patient, strict when they have to be, and fun. They also put on unique recitals that always keeps shows and classes exciting.

review.author: D J.
review.description:
Worst experience ever. I've never witnessed such unprofessional behavior especially in a children's environment. 
I came in with my daughter (8yrs old) to ask about the class schedule, times & prices. I wanted to enroll my daughter in a hip hop class. 
When I walked in an older women, (the owners mother) was the only person in the studio at the time and gave me the class schedule and informed me that the hip hop class was actually going to begin in about an hour. So I asked if I brought my daughter back at the scheduled time would she be able to do the class for free considering it's her first time. She said yes. 
We came back for the class. We walked in and there were a few younger girls there but no one was in the front greeting people. So we stood there and waited for someone to greet us. The owner walked in with a horrible attitude, bad vibe and not a very nice look on her face. She walked right past us, went behind the counter, set her purse down with out even acknowledging our presence and walked to the back. You could definitely tell we were new to the studio and she did not show any care in the world about who we were, or why we were there.
The owners mother was in the back baby sitting the owners 2/3 yr old daughter. 
Then she returned to the front and said very rudely, "can I help you". There was no hi how are you, thank you for coming in. No enthusiasm about having a new child wanting to enroll. I mean isn't that how she makes her money? 
I then told her we were there for the hip hop class and she replied "ok the drop in fee is $15.00". I then let her know I was in about an hour earlier and was told today's trial would be free. She didn't respond to me. She yelled to her mom in the back "mom come out here, you told her there was a drop in few right?!" Her mom then said "no I let her know she can do the class for free". 
With anger the owner pointed to a sign in sheet and told me to sign my daughters name and then aggressively walked off. 
The owners 2/3yr old daughter does the hip hop class, although she isn't old enough but because the owners mom teaches the class she joins in. So when her daughter came out for the class the owner tells her mom she doesn't want her daughter to do the class because she was "throwing up all day". I emmidately let my daughter know to keep her distance because I didn't want her getting sick. The owners mom insisted that she was fine and brought her in to the class anyway. 
At this point they were talking very rude and argumentative towards each other about the situation all right infront of my daughter and I. Great first impression right? Anyway. They both stormed off and I had no idea where to go. There are two dance rooms and I had no idea at that point who was teaching the class or where to go. So we remained at the front. 
Then the owner returned after storming off and said "the class is down there" and pointed down the hall. 
So we walk down the hallway and the owners mother had already started the class. She was so wrapped up in the argument she was having with her daughter (the owner) she stormed off with out even guiding us to the class.
My daughter walked in and the teacher did not make her feel welcomed at all! My daughter is shy and stayed in the back of the class. The teacher was not welcoming or even attempting to incorporate my daughter in the class. 
I was shocked, furious and taken back by what I just experienced. I ended up just pulling my daughter out and that was that! 
There was more but this review is so long already I think you can get an idea of what the studio is like...

review.author: Silvia A.
review.description: Family owned studio( mother and daughter ) good ballet instruction my 8 year old daughter attended for a little over 1 year and learned quite a bit . However the studio lacks organization and communication there is no front desk staff and the customer service it's really bad! Bipolar bad, their ego it's bigger than their business sense,  I had to purchase a costume on my own so my daughter could match the rest of the dancers for the winter performance show, since we were given a look a like hand made table cloth fabric costume. My daughter's ballet instructor /costume designer, was extremely offended and could not understand why I wanted my daughter to look like the rest of the cast and not be the only one wearing an odd looking dress for the performance. Not only was my daughter a regular student but we had paid the costume fees  just like everyone else did. Upon learning this she decided that she would confront me in front of all the parents and students in the studio in a very rude, unprofessional manner. To top things off, the owner forgot to include my daughter in the show's program, claiming she had no recollection of the cash I had given her for this ahead of time. She didn't even apologize nor showed any type of remorse about this.  This is completely unacceptable and unethical.

review.author: Denise M.
review.description: I took my daugher here on August 25th, 2014 for the first time to take the HipHop Class at 6:00pm. When I entered the dance room, I asked the instructor if I could sit inside the room and he said no because that distracts the kids, so I went into the hallway, when I see the instructor pull the hair of one of his older students. He pulled it hard enough that the students body came back towards him. I couldnt believe what I had just witnessed. I was extrememly upset, but did not want to cause a scene in front of my daughter. I wrote the dance studio an email explaining the situation and letting them know I would no longer take my daugher there. They responded that they would talk to the instructor, but I got no apology from them and by the way they suggested I take my daughter to another dance school because the instructor said she was great in class. The email was not apologetic and I dont think they care for what happend that day. I definitly dont recommend this place.

review.author: Marcela P.
review.description: So far my son loves it here. Great teachers and ample programs and sports for the kids. \nThe only complaint I have are those early morning parkers that park their car right in front of the school and hold up the entire line. Drives me crazy. It makes me want to bring a bullhorn  with me in the car lol

review.author: Josie L.
review.description: Would go five stars but the office staff is just a bunch of liberal rude women. I don't need a lecture to pick up my son.

review.author: David D.
review.description: This school is a absolutely first rate. They have a fabulous track with a great texture for running on it. Their swimming pool is really nice. There are several baseball diamonds.  Lots of huge grassy areas for sports.  They have a huge building built just for theatre. They have lots of covered parking spaces. Their marching band is absolutely first class. I live a block away and hear them practice all the time. Their entire campus is absolutely first rate. And they have a wonderful faculty.

review.author: Mis J.
review.description: I can't complain much about PDHS. Nice teachers, nice classmates, good classes and nice college prep. However, some large school shootings in Minnesota(or something like that) drove authorities crazy the year before I left. Now we were wearing IDs on lanyards around our necks, walking through metal scanners and there was some prohibition on when I could leave class to go to the bathroom.  I don't think the school is still doing this but it has remodeled its appearance/buildings. I'd go to PDHS again!

review.author: Arsenio G.
review.description: Nice place for your kids to study.Oldest in high school now times fly when you change diapers now we need adult diapers!!lol!

review.author: KC M.
review.description: Nice facilities for a small town make up primarily of retirees. Attended a Senior Olympics event. The field and track facilities were\npretty well maintained ~ the grass could use a little attention and maybe more water. What was really beautiful were the mountains that surrounded the town.  Blessings : ) KC

review.author: M F.
review.description: This childcare does not offer a grace period to pick up your children when you get off at five o'clock and they close at five o'clock. There is a dollar for every minute you are late after five o'clock. There is a young lady that kept giving facial expressions when I asked why there isn't a grace period if a parent has to get off work first and ensure they make it safely to get the kids. The time was only ten mins, not 20 or 30 mins. It seems as though they want the money during CO-VID 20 but does not want to be professional.

review.author: Trish M.
review.description: Went here to take a 4 day course. Every inch of the college is well maintained & the workers were nice. There were tons of parking spots. \nOne negative is the part of town & it is a bit far from Bham. \nBut I would return if an opportunity arises in the future.

review.author: Barrett O.
review.description:
I originally became aware of these folks on Facebook and have since attended one of their classes. I signed up online and got everything communicated to me nicely via messenger. 

At Southern Grace Creations they offer art classes dealing with glass and resin, door hangers, canvases, and more. Classes for adults and children, beginner to advanced, and they supply everything you will need to make your art piece: (canvas, window or picture frame, paint, glass, shells, sand, glitter, resin, etc.) Some people choose to bring trinkets like a special sea shell, sand dollars, starfish, small beach wood, necklace, broach, etc. (you can also bring  other materials, including canvas and art supplies if you desire)

I showed up and was welcomed by Bobbie, the instructor, and since this was my very first time working with resin she was very patient, explained everything about the process, and guided me along nicely. You can choose from either doing your project on canvas or on a framed glass, I chose canvas. (other options available) You pick the size of canvas or size and style of frame and you're ready to go. There's a big variety of crushed glass, shells, and all sorts of materials to put on your project and you can paint it first or work with a blank slate. (stencils are also available if you need them) 

I chose to draw and paint a basic sky, water, and beach background then cover it in different colors of glass with some shells. After your project is complete Bonnie instructs you how to properly cover it in resin, it's pretty cool. Since it takes 3+ days to cure or set you will need to come back to pick it up, and that's it. Aprons and plenty of space is provided.

Bottom line: It's especially easy with Bobbie's patient direction and you can make something that's just fun or make a family heirloom. Recommended!!!! 

314 Greeno Rd 
Fairhope, AL
270-314-3318

https://www.facebook.com/southerngracecreationsfairhope/

https://www.glartent.com/US/Fairhope/100258254819309/Southern-Grace-Creations

review.author: Joslyn W.
review.description: talladega college is the most unsanitary HBCU i have attended this school has been around for years and they still havent made any progress with trying to keep it up. there are bugs infections and water leakages among some of the rooms. the cost of this school is way to high for their living conditions this is tragic. they need help somebody call the health department

review.author: Melissa B.
review.description:
Sunday, March 9th, Tony and I was driving back to Nashville from Birmingham and I chose a road route via Talladega so I could check out their historical buildings.

 I didn't know that there was this historical college here so I was very pleased and in awe of some of the gorgeous buildings that made up the campus of this old college.
 
Even though there is Security Alert sign about 24 hr protection...No ONE stopped us. I enjoyed this college because of all the old buildings. When in the area, you should stop by and check it out.

History:
Talladega College, located in Talladega, Alabama, is a private, liberal arts college. It holds the distinction as Alabama's oldest private historically black college. As of 2009 the school received full SACS accreditation
The history of Talladega College began on November 20, 1865, when two former slaves William Savery and Thomas Tarrant, both of Talladega, met in convention with a group of new freedmen in Mobile, Alabama. From this meeting came the commitment, "...We regard the education of our children and youth as vital to the preservation of our liberties, and true religion as the foundation of all real virtue, and shall use our utmost endeavors to promote these blessings in our common country."
With this as their pledge, Savery and Tarrant, aided by General Wager Swayne of the Freedmen's Bureau, began in earnest to provide a school for the children of former slaves of the community. Their leadership resulted in the construction of a one-room school house using lumber salvaged from an abandoned carpenter's shop. The school overflowed with pupils from its opening and soon it was necessary to move into larger quarters.
Meanwhile, the nearby Baptist Academy was about to be sold under mortgage default. This building had been built in 1852-53 with the help of slaves - including Savery and Tarrant. A speedy plea was sent to General Swayne for its purchase. General Swayne in turn persuaded the American Missionary Association to buy the building and some 20 acres (81,000 m2) of land for $23,000.
The grateful parents renamed the building Swayne School and it opened in November 1867 with about 140 pupils. A building constructed before the war with slave labor for white students became the home of the state's first college dedicated to serving the educational needs of blacks. In 1869, Swayne School was issued a charter as Talladega College by the Judge of Probate of Talladega County.
The former Baptists Academy building, now known as Swayne Hall, has remained in service as the symbol and spirit of the beginning of the college.

Andrews Hall, built in 1910, houses the Music Department and the Education Department. It is named for George Whitfield Andrews, D.D., Dean of Theological Department from 1875 to 1908.
Arthur D. Shores Hall, constructed in 1974, is named for the late Attorney Arthur D. Shores, Class of 1927, who served for many years as a member and chairman of the College Board of Trustees.
De Forest Chapel, built in 1903 in commemoration of the life and service of the Rev. Henry Swift De Forest, D.D., President of the College from 1879 to 1896. DeForest Chapel was renovated in 1996 and rededicated November 1996. De Forest was the father of inventor Lee De Forest.
Fanning Refectory, built in 1928 from a legacy of Dr. David H. Fanning of Worcester, Massachusetts. The building contains the student and faculty dining rooms.
Juliette Derricotte House, built in 1940-41, was the gift of the Harkness Foundation and named for Juliette Derricotte, Class of 1918, who at the time of her death in 1932 was a member of the Board of Trustees. Formerly a staff residence and guest house, it was converted into a women's honors dormitory in 1988.
Silsby Science Hall, constructed in 1926, was named for Dr. E. C. Silsby,[2] who was a member of the College faculty for 37 years. The building was a gift of the General Education Board and friends and alumni of the College. It contains the laboratories and classrooms for the Natural Sciences and Mathematics.

review.author: Kay P.
review.description: Ignore the 1 star reviews from Chris and Yulee in Tampa, Florida. They are reviewing an unaffiliated school with the same name located there. \nBayshore Christian School in Fairhope provides a complete Classical Christian education for students living in Mobile and Baldwin Counties in Alabama. Their students excel far above standards in public schools. Students are educated by well trained and qualified caring teachers who first and foremost love God. The whole person is addressed and the curriculum is complete and supported. Graduates excel and are awarded more money in scholarships than students in public schools with 10 times the graduates!  Students learn Latin beginning in 4th grade and Science and Math skills are taught well above public school standards. This school provides a wonderful environment for all children.  There is no "dumbing down" as all have the potential to do well.  \nAs Federal standards have reduced public education to a worthless diploma, Bayshore Christian School in Fairhope Alabama is helping parents to produce  well educated and responsible Christ followers!

name: University of South Alabama College of Nursing
Camellia Baptist Church Day Care & Preschool
University Of South Alabama Baldwin County

review.author: Lauren J.
review.description: I've only had one class here so far and I really enjoy it! The only downside is having to drive fifty minutes across the bay to get there. Aside from that, the classes definitely make up for it and I fell like I am getting my money's worth.

review.author: J A J.
review.description:
Visiting the churches in Prattville while on vacation, I found 1st Baptist Church Prattville. Great worship service!  Real nice people. Great sermon. The pastor spoke on what we all need to hear over & over again. Since of course humanity  can't get the basics right. I loved it!

Proverbs 3:5-6 
Trust in the LORD with all your heart, And lean not on your own understanding; In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths. 

I went back on Wednesday for more manna. Good food for the soul. I found myself refreshed and blessed!

review.author: Niekia T.
review.description: We're here today visiting Huntingdon College In Montgomery, AL with my stepson. He's a potential recruit for Football. I'm not sure in what direction he will go as far as choosing a college, but so far I like it. Although Huntingdon is not an HBCU, I would definitely look into attending this college. We were able to take pictures in the weight room, and me and the boys got a chance to enjoy the beautiful campus they have. It wasn't that far from Birmingham, and the staff really seem to care about their students not "Just" as football players, but as individuals and their success in the classrooms. Overall, this seems to be a really good college, and even though, once again, its not an HBCU, I will fully support this school.

review.author: Rhea P.
review.description:
I have never attended, but I love walking the lovely grounds and the viewing the architecture.

The library is so very special to me.  Very cozy with a lot of character. 

According to Legend, two red lady ghosts inhabited Pratt Hall dormitory.

review.author: Jim C.
review.description: Three of my children went to Huntingdon College. My youngest Josh will finish Florida State University Medical School in May. My youngest daughter Mary went on to make top grades at Boston University School of Law and the Federal Court of Appeals in Atlanta. My oldest daughter choose to be a full time mother. Her daughter is now on full scholarship at Troy University. A Huntingdon College education for my children was just what they needed. \n\nThe campus is beautiful, the classes small, the culture helpful, and the faculty excellent. After graduation each of my children have remained in contact with their college professors who have been supportive long after graduation. Visit and see what  you think. It was great for our family and I give it top marks.

review.author: Iman S.
review.description:
My daughter loves Mathnasium! 
We started her at Mathnasium in May a little before school ended. Of course like a lot of parents we worried that she might be a little behind because of virtual school and our own shortcomings as "teachers helpers". 
Our daughter really enjoys going, she attends 2-3 days a  week in person. They also have virtual slots as well if that's more convenient. 
They make it really fun and my daughter loves winning prizes. She has a review coming up and I'm looking forward to how far she's come.

review.author: Oriana S.
review.description: My kiddo has been in attendance for about a month now maybe less and he really enjoys it. He ask everyday about going back simply because the tutors make math fun and exciting, which is great because he gets bored pretty quickly. He is understanding some of his math specifically Addition and Subtraction. I will give another update in August.

review.author: Iman S.
review.description:
Churchill Academy is a gem of a school and my child has really blossomed there. My daughter has been attending for two years now and the teachers here really care and have the students best interest at heart. The school makes it nearly effortless to get in contact with administrators and teachers if you have any questions or concerns. 

I love the quarterly ILP (individual learning plan) meetings they set up for parents to see how your child is progressing. The "no bullying" policy, Tyson their therapy dog, and the family friendly atmosphere are all things I love. 

Call to take a tour!

review.author: Tammy H.
review.description: My son was going to a private school and making pretty decent grades. After receiving his SAT results I noticed that he was only reading on a third grade level and he was is eighth grade. I contacted MasterRead on Zelda Road and I so glad we did. The price was reasonable and he received one on one tutoring. In a short period of time he went from reading on a third grade level to reading on a ninth grade level and his grades sired. He went from a C average student to an A-B average student! \n\nMs Walker is absolutely amazing!

review.author: Kathy C.
review.description: A must see! The displays and videos were amazing. I learned so much & wish everyone could go here. First class museum!

review.author: Tank G.
review.description:
This Museum is located across from the Troy campus. It is co-located with a library that is only accesible to Troy students. They have metered street parking right out front and within a reasonable walking distance.

The site of the museum is significant because it is where Rosa Parks was arrested on a bus for not giving up her seat. It has a historical marker out front marking the location. It has a neat sculpture outside that can only be viewed directly, any other angles and you are looking at some posts in the group.  There is also a very nice sculpture of Ms. Parks sitting alone in her seat on the bus. It makes for great photos.

The museum is small and offers self guided tours. There are no pictures allowed in the main exhibit area. The tour begins in a small room with benches around it. You watch a movie about segregation in Montgomery, the bus system and the boycott. Once the movie is over, some doors open and leads you to the next area. The next area is a pretty neat reenactment of Rosa Parks being arrested on the bus. You view the action as if you are viewing it from outside of the bus. It is very nice and really makes you feel like you are in the action. 

 After the reenactment on the bus, some doors open up to a gallery that has exhibits, videos, artifacts, and pictures. You move at your own pace from this spot until the end of the tour. You will see a replica carpool vehicle over there, you will also hear stories told by people that were there during that time via videos and you will see a display of leaders riding the bus after the boycott ended. They give you the option of using your phone for an audio tour in a few sections of the museum. It provides you some information about what you are looking at. I did not use it because it seemed like more effort than what it was worth to me. Some type of push button audio kiosk would be perfect in its place. Anyway, as i mentioned, the exhibit area is not a very big area. We went through it in about 15 minutes.. The entire tour took us about 30 minutes. Even though thee is not a lot to it, it was still a nice visit and I  learned a bit. It does a good job making you feel as if you are back during that time.

No museum would be complete without a gift shop, this one is no exception. They have a small gift shop where you not only purchase you museum admission, but you can buy souvenirs like shirts or bags.

All-in-all this a decent museum. I love that it is located on the historical site where the bus incident occurred. It is small, but still makes a great impact. It' is definitely worth a visit if you are in downtown Montgomery. I would recommend checking out some of the other nearby museums, like the Legacy Museum and Civil Rights Center to maximize your trip.

review.author: Penny S.
review.description:
This museum is two parts - our family of five just did the museum experience. We had to wait for it to be go in as there are timed small experiences for the first part. This was really just an intro to welcome to the museum. 

We spent probably 1.5 hours here without doing the second portion. The last half of the museum has lots of reading, but the first part was a great simulation experience that even the youngest would get a deeper understanding of Rosa. The museum store could be improved as there are so many amazing kid books about Rosa Parks.

The library next door was mentioned as something to do - but they said this was only for school groups. Don't forget to walk several blocks to see the Rosa Parks statue at the fountain.

This is well worth the entrance fee!

review.author: Carrie G.
review.description: The coolest thing is that this is on site of where Rosa parks bus stop was! In the museum I loved that we could watch the situation as a pedestrian looking into the bus. I love museum that's make things as real as possible! We really learned a lot here!

review.author: Endora B.
review.description: Always nice to know your history. If it had not been for her not giving up her seat on the bus no telling where we would be

review.author: Becky D.
review.description: I took my 8 yr old here to tour the Rosa Parks exhibit. The exhibit was educational & engaging. The staff at the library were also helpful including Marilyn, one of the custodians.

review.author: Richard R.
review.description:
Meet Mr. Rivets, the robotic operator of a time machine bus that looks very similar to the buses used by the City of Montgomery during the bus boycott of 1955-56.

    __V__
   |  ~  ~  |
   |   o o  |        Hi!!!
 {    [---]   }
   |______|

You will find him in the Children's Annex of the Rosa Parks museum which features a historic time-jump to different dates using large screens on either side of the time machine and prerecorded narrating. On the second floor is a photo timeline of Civil Rights events and informational columns highlighting the important faces of the movement and their story.

Back in the main building is a gift shop, exhibition art hall and a self guided tour highlighting the famous story of Rosa Louise McCauley Parks and her defiance to give up her seat on that faithful day. What I never knew about the history of this event was that it wasn't altogether random. Rosa Parks planned to do this with the help of other civil rights leaders so they could use it as a launching point for a federal case against the unconstitutional segregation laws in Alabama. It was only an idea, but Rosa fulfilled it when she found the opportunity, because it couldn't be staged. That takes nothing away from Rosa Parks. The danger of such defiance was deadly real, as witnessed by the Freedom Riders in the same era.

Oddly, the case was not brought to court using Rosa. Instead they used the first person to actually defy the bus laws, young Claudette Colvin, whom was 15 and pregnant at the age of her arrest. Her arrest happened on March 2nd, 1955, a full 9 months before Rosa's arrest on December 1, 1955.

The story is told using a full sized model of a Montgomery bus as you stand outside of the bus looking through the windows (which utilize TV screens).
