Brown as with many of the other Ivies has solid finances because of loyal alumni and generous friends who believe in the mission of the school. Of course, Rhode Island (especially Providence!) has much to offer and it doesn't overwhelm you at all. Who knows? I may be here for the long run! (shhh don't tell California that!)

review.author: Tina S.
review.description: Beautiful campus, interesting students, outstanding faculty! \n\nThe campus is most beautiful in the the spring when all the cherry blossoms on the quads are in bloom - it is a magical time of year.

review.author: Greg M.
review.description: Great campus up on a hill in Providence that looks pretty much like you'd want an Ivy League school to look. There's a big open lawn everyone was hanging out in, a busy coffee shop in the bookstore, trees everywhere, old buildings (and some ugly newer ones) and a few funky streets nearby with bars and restaurants and shops.\n\nI had a good time just walking around checking things out. Maybe one of my kids...

review.author: Ellie T.
review.description: I attended their pre-college program, so we were all high school students, minors, yet there's people smoking everywhere on campus and the police doesn't seem to care. In general, the people were just trashy, though some actual students have told me that the real students are different, not sure if it's a good different or bad different.

review.author: Bunny B.
review.description: My son graduated in May, 2015.  He had a terrific experience.  A terrific learning environment, steeped in tradition.  Beautiful campus, well maintained.  Administration was easy to deal with, and the people were very responsive whenever I had questions or concerns. Numerous options for financial assistance.

review.author: Les M.
review.description:
I have visited Brown University off and on through the years and was an applicant to the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences.  And I have been intrigued by the attention it has gotten as well over the years, most recently for the selection of Ruth Simmons as president (she is leaving very soon).

Known since the '60s as the hippest of the Ivy League, with the most flexibility and openness in its curriculum, Brown is also one of the most smallest in the group both in terms of numbers of students and actual campus size.

The campus is small, compact, and has many handsome red brick Georgian architecture.  The atmosphere is laid-back but studious.  I enjoyed spending time at the John D. Rockefeller Library while my sister went to classes.

My sister had nothing but praise for the school when she went there.

I am disappointed by a relatively recent event, though.

Ruth Simmons, its president, made a startling remark to Mike Wallace in his interview of the former. She recounted a slight she experienced from a faculty member at Harvard where she was doing her Ph.D. in Romance languages and literature, her field being17th century French literature.

Mike Wallace gave her an incredulous look--raised eyebrows and all--and actually said something like, "17th century French literature? How arcane! Whatever for?"

Ms. Simmons was apparently so caught up in her being able to vent her woeful tale of racial discrimination that she did not offer one whit of a defense of her field of graduate studies. 17th century France was the most powerful nation in the world, and French cultural domination is attested by a roll-call of the most celebrated intellects of that era: Pascal, Descartes, Moliere, Corneille, Racine, La Fontaine...this was the era of Louis XIV--le roi soleil--and Versailles and the birth of modern diplomacy.

The 17th century without France would be like the 20th century without the United States.* And we today are a lot closer to the 17th century in our outlook, customs, and institutions than we are to the time of Jesus Christ or the gladiators.

Granted Americans don't generally know much about world history, but Ms. Simmons's bemused silence vis-a-vis Mr. Wallace was pretty disheartening. In essence, she silently endorsed the prevalent but parochial attitude among our countrymen that world culture and history are primarily American. No need to dig further than Neils Armstrong, Martin Luther King, Jr., Abraham Lincoln, Mark Twain, or George Washington, do we?

Let's hope that Brown's next president (Ms. Simmons is resigning her at the end of the current academic year) will offer a more spirited defense of the humanities, not just Aime Cesare, David Diop, etc.

We are built on the shoulders of those who came before us. An education ought to be inclusive. Unfortunately, Brown may offer too much of a "select-what-you-will" (and by extension, "ignore-what-you-will") approach.

* * The following century ("Le siecle des lumieres")--but equally unheard of by most Americans-- would bring with it both the Enlightenment and the American and French revolutions.

The Enlightenment is the anti-thesis of what George W. Bush (and his co-religionists) stands for, but is impossible to understand without studying the 17th century.

review.author: Melissa S.
review.description:
Brown University, I give you one star off because I'm still paying you your God-#f!*&^$! money!!!! 

Luckily the experience of attending you was worth at least 6.  True, I was Xtra-Lite on the academics, Xtra-heavy on the social scene, but sheeeyit......  I learned more from my effing brilliant, humility-inducing peers than all my lit-theory-global-justice-drumming-science classes combined.  

Breeding ground of future mind-mafia, and run by the real (Italian) mafia.  Can't pack more character in than that.

name: The Center For Sexual Pleasure & Health

review.author: Alicia G.
review.description: Just when you think the CSPH couldn't get any better... it does. In January they moved to a larger space within the Grant Building and it. looks. incredible. The library area is very cozy, and all of their toys and educational supplies are neatly organized, making it easy for folks to look around and explore. The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable, and willing to answer any questions. They also have a great collection of antique vibrators which are beautifully displayed. \n\nI highly recommend checking out the Center for any and all sexuality/gender/women's studies related things. They have an expansive library and an education staff who can point you in the right direction. They also offer monthly workshops, trivia nights, and other fun events. Always a great place to explore and learn!

review.author: Ophelia V.
review.description: Now in a bigger, better space, The CSPH continues to wow me.  Seriously, check it out.  I could spend hours here!

review.author: Tasha M.
review.description: The Center is a great place to learn anything you'd like to know about sexual health, and they even offer sex counseling!  It's 18+, though, so please keep that in mind if you plan to visit.  Megan Andelloux, who runs the Center, is fantastic and will answer absolutely any question you may have.  She is really dedicated to keeping this resource open for anyone who wanders in and is not afraid to speak her mind about what she believes.  The CSPH is a great addition to The Grant building, and is a great way to put Pawtucket on the map in terms of tourism.

review.author: Jaclyn B.
review.description: The Center for Sexual Pleasure and Health was a second home to me in my pursuit of sexuality education and literature. After spending quite a lot of time with the library, I've found that their collection exceeds any other on the east coast in terms of amount, variety, and quality. For fellow book-lovers and students: this is THE place to go for your research.\n\nIt doesn't hurt that the decor is awesome, too.

review.author: j s.
review.description: Very cool place. A little hard to find the first time. Had to park a little far on the street. But I really can't complain, it's a free resource. Staff was very friendly, helpful, nice. Enjoyed the library, coffee, samples, and example toys (of what to buy or not). Are the hours listed on Yelp or their website most current? (currently listing different hours on each)

review.author: Josie L.
review.description: A great place to learn about sexuality! The environment is cozy and inviting, not at all intimidating. If you have any questions, want to check out some interesting books or vintage sex stuff, or are just curious definitely stop in.

review.author: Breezy R.
review.description: The Center was an amazing place to start a career or gain experience in sexuality. The staff is engineered as a tight-knit group that works and bounces ideas off each other. The Center really tries to focus on educating the public on sexuality issues and health. The topics range from secret fetishes to virginity. Anyone curious about sexual health should feel comfortable consulting Megan or the staff, because it is an easy-going atmosphere. The Center is like an encyclopedia that one can actually walk into. The knowledge is endless, and any question is welcome. The Center takes the shame away from those sexuality questions that you cant really ask anyone else. There truly isn't anywhere else like it, in my opinion. If you are planning on having an internship at The Center expect a small group of interns that help you grow and learn new things as well. The best thing about The Center is that you can be yourself and also learn more about sexuality than you thought possible!

review.author: Rose C.
review.description:
I'm sure that this will be taken down very soon by Yelp but I figure it doesn't hurt to say this one more time for those folks defending this school and their actions: Black Lives Matter does NOT indicate that ONLY Black Lives Matter. That's not what the movement is about. It is about shedding light on the racial and systemic injustices that our black communities and neighbors endure on a daily basis - it is meant to teach, to educate, to reform. If you are threatened or worried about something on a t-shirt, you're likely someone who needs to step back to reevaluate yourself and your privileges. Why are you upset that we care about our BIPOC and POC communities? Isn't that allowed? Should it be celebrated, especially with our youth?

I would love, love, love a daycare and childcare center that taught children at a young age to practice love, empathy, and learning. Too bad this place isn't it! I'm seeing so many reviews say things like how this childcare center is correct in how they acted because they should just let kids be kids. What? Why? You want to put blinders over your kids eyes to what is going on in the world? That's exactly how you create ignorant people. We should be teaching our children about what's going on - not hiding them from it. BLM isn't political. It's humanity. 

This school deserves its one star and I hope that nobody sends their kids here. It seems they lack basic values of Christianity. What if I wore a shirt that said "Breast Cancer Sucks." Is that a political view too? Does it mean that breast cancer is the only cancer that matters? What if it means something very personal to the child wearing it? would this center send the kid home for caring about a cause? Ridiculous.

review.author: Kay T.
review.description: How are you threatened by a shirt with words? You call yourself a Christian School, welcoming all but your actions state otherwise? I also noticed on your FACEBOOK page of your end of the year pictures (June) only pictures of Caucasian children, so your prejudice was showing some time ago.\nSHAME ON YOU, INCLUSION, LOVE FOR ALL GODS CHILDREN IS WHAT YOU SHOULD BE TEACHING, NOT HATE & SEGREGATION!

review.author: Tashi P.
review.description:
All lives can't matter until black lives matter.

For anyone who still doesn't understand this concept:

https://www.vox.com/2016/7/11/12136140/black-all-lives-matter

review.author: Thomas M.
review.description: Probably ok if your child is brought up in a hypocritical, racist household. For anyone not comfortable with that setting, it's probably best that you look elsewhere. If faith-based education is important to you, seek out institutions that actually operate within and strive for the principles within their professed belief system instead of ones that act in direct defiance of it. Pathetic.

review.author: Edi D.
review.description: Shame on you for demonizing a momma trying to teach her child the importance of advocating for civil rights. Too bad if it makes you uncomfortable: what does that say about you?? I would not trust this preschool to protect and honor the unique attributes of any child.

review.author: Shelia K.
review.description: Really upset with the narrative that Black Lives Matter being a "political movement" A person and the color of their skin and the way they are treated is not a politic to be discussed. I hope this place has learned to be better, but knowing the history of Arkansas, I don't have a lot of faith.

review.author: yazmine p.
review.description: I would never allow my kids to attend a school who believes that wearing a Black Lives matter shirt condemns racisms. if you are afraid about other parents being upset their kids will ask about why black lives matter, than the parents really need to get a reality check and read the bible again. don't be a hypocrite. I would not enroll your children in this racist's school.

review.author: Crystal H.
review.description: DON'T SEND YOUR CHILD HERE!!! This place is corrupted and silences children's voices. They banned a six-year-old girl from wearing a Black Lives Matter shirt! The officials and staff at this school won't let your your kids practice their first amendment right of free speech. They refuse to accept what is going on in the world right now with the Black Lives Matter Movement and instead choose to oppress those kids who stand for something as it doesn't align with their values. This is supposed to be a place of learning and acceptance yet THIS PLACE IS EVIL AND CORRUPT. You'd be better off at another facility that actually allows children to express themselves freely.

review.author: Lynda F.
review.description: Apparently HIS KIDS doesn't include fine Black children...bad place that humiliates children and has bias against expressive tasteful clothing. Shame on you!

review.author: Myah K.
review.description: My child expressed how unsafe she felt here, the staff is horrible.

review.author: Karen H.
review.description: How can you kick a child out of your facility for promoting what is true? Black Lives Matter. That is not up for debate. I hope that other parents take their children out of this "preschool" because it is obviously not being run be competent people. I fear for the safety of the children of color going there.

review.author: Tasha W.
review.description: If I could give a lower rating I would. You're what's wrong in this country. We have been denied and silenced for so long and you in your high horse are threatened by it, shame on you!

review.author: Louis W.
review.description: Shameful that you would remove a girl from school for exercising free speech on a T Shirt. Unless you want your kids to grow up and be racists do not send them here!

review.author: D. H.
review.description: Beware the "dress code." A 6-year-old was kicked out for wearing a BLM shirt. Black Lives Matter is not a political issue.

review.author: Lynn W.
review.description: Horrible racist staff. Thought they could traumatize a six year old child because she wore a shirt that celebrated the police not murdering black people. How they consider themselves a Christian facility is beyond me. I would be checking in unannounced several times a day to see what else these judgmental people are doing to these children.

review.author: Fishy L.
review.description: Any school that is going to kick out a kid over a shirt that had no offensive images or words is a school that doesn't know how to properly handle situations like this and will definitely fail to handle other serious situations.

name: Just Kids Preschool & Lilliput Learning Academy

review.author: Jason B.
review.description: As a history buff, I was invited to a Czech 50h wedding anniversary at this location.  Apparently there are a lot of Czech's living in the area, Vasko and Kostelecky to name a few. \n\nAbout this place:  A group of the descendants of turn-of-the-century immigrants to Silverhill from the mid-European region known as Bohemia -- now part of western Czechoslovakia --  gathered this morning to re-open their cherished community hall that had been damaged by a tornado in March of 2011.

review.author: John J.
review.description:
Eye Level is rebranding. It used to be Enopi, but now it's Eye Level. Located on the corner of Camden Ave. x  Trinidad Dr., the Almaden branch is the corner suite with the banner outside. Eye Level offers classes in Math, English, and Korean for K-9 levels. It is a self-directed learning environment where students study materials approved by South Korean parent company, Daekyo.  Currently, Eye Level has approximately 2.5 million members in 16 countries, and as part of the No Child Left Behind Act, Eye Level offers tutoring known as Supplemental Education Services (SES) in California.

I'm here twice a week, so I see Eye Level not only as a resource for reviewing knowledge, but also an opportunity for students get ahead of their class. Eye Level administers a diagnostic test to evaluate students' level, and has a curriculum for each level. There is a separate classroom for Math, English, and Korean, where tutors provide guidance to students. In turn, the owner Ms. Park reports each student's progress to their parents at regular intervals. Students who are good at Eye Level are rewarded with prizes for every 100 "Enopi Dollars" they earn through getting good scores on quizzes, homework, and comprehension tests. Students benefit from positive reinforcement from their tutors, Ms. Park, and parental support. Therefore, I think Eye Level has a very good system for students to develop confidence in themselves and supplement the subjects they study in school.

Other learning centers in the area include Tutoring Club and ThinkTank Learning. Tutoring Club specializes in specific high school subjects while ThinkTank Learning boasts miracles for getting college applicants into their dream school.

review.author: Jen N.
review.description: Three of my children are enrolled here in the Korean program. Janet is an amazing teacher and runs this great center. The facility is clean, organized, and safe. Most importantly, the programs are structured in a way that self-motivates children to learn, and I have seen wonderful results in my children. They also have popular Math and English programs here. Although my children are not enrolled in those programs, the materials look great and the teachers are kind and knowledgeable. I highly recommend checking out this place if you are interested in a tutoring center that will give personal care to your children and help them achieve amazing results.

review.author: Christine S.
review.description: It was so worth meeting with Manny on a Zoom call. He saved me thousands ($49k) of dollars in tuition by knowing what is out there for grants, scholarships, etc. He will go over your assets and help you determine how to fill out your financial aid forms. He's very personable as well. It is worth your time.

review.author: Claudia W.
review.description: I made the decision to join a free webminar with Manny from Facebook a week ago.  It was very informative and eye opening!.  Manny gave a through explanation in stating the differences between the UC and Cal State System.  Also the intricacies of the Financial Aspect of College Admission.  It was so helpful to know where to start!.  I have 2 kids, one High School Student with a great Academic record but unsure how to make the most of it for her.  Manny has already created an outline with priority steps to take in order start this process in the most affordable way possible.  He is very patient and takes time to listen to my personal situation and has provided very sound advice.  I highly recommend to any parent with a High School Student to consult with Manny. Guarantee it will be the best hour you will have as a parent navigating today's college admission process.

review.author: Helene C.
review.description: Manny was very helpful in providing us guidance on ways to save money with the high cost of college tuition.  We have 2 kids in college and were trying to figure out how to stretch our dollars.  He is highly knowledgeable on tax savings strategies.  He takes the time to explain things that made sense for our situation.  Highly recommend Manny.

review.author: Ruth L.
review.description: A friend recommended Manny to me and we are so very grateful for his help. As a middle class family we were not going to qualify for any need based financial aid and Manny was amazing.  He recommended several private colleges that each offered our son over $100,000 in scholarships at schools that were in cities he was interested in living in and with majors he was passionate about.  Our son ended up in the honors program at a wonderful private college in Boston and he just finished his first year! He is getting over $140,000 in merit based financial aid that is guaranteed over the 4 years he is in college and he is excited to be at a school that truly meets his needs and is cheaper than the UC's.  We had no problem signing up with Manny to help our daughter find her dream school who is now a junior in high school.  He is worth every cent!

review.author: Roxana S.
review.description: Manuel has been great, explained with patience what we needed to know. He found the time to talk to us even on a short notice and at a time when I'm sure he was overloaded with requests. Great to talk to and ask for advice!

review.author: Niki H.
review.description: I was refered to Manny by a friend to try to figure out college costs. I was overwhelmed and didn't know where to start. Manny helped us choose colleges that had high academic rates and were generous with Merits. He helped us with Financial aid and taxes and how to get the most money. At times I reached out to him 10pm and he was still available and ready to help. I will definitely recommend his services to any student who is looking to apply for college .

review.author: Angeline D.
review.description: As the first in my family to go to college in America, it was extremely difficult to navigate the college application process, from the essays and to the financial aid. However, once I went through College Planning ABC, I was able to improve the quality of my essays, get support for financial aid, and overall have a less stressful college application process. I'm now happily a mechanical engineering major in UC Santa Barbara, and I'm grateful for the support College Planning ABC provided me on my journey here.

review.author: Mike P.
review.description:
As a parent of a recent senior graduate, I am so thankful I attended Manuel's free college planning seminar. I enjoyed it so much that I invited several friends and attended a second session with my then, sophomore & freshman. Never too early!

What makes Manuel's (Manny) approach to college financial planning so successful is his ability to get through to each student, understanding their strengths and weaknesses. His personality is a huge factor in why I chose to work with Manny. He has a no-nonsense approach, keeping open lines of communication with parent/student. I was always kept in the loop with all of my son's appointments, deadlines, etc. 

The college application process can be a daunting maze, with each school asking for something different from each of their applicants. Manny knows this maze like the back of his hand, offering new, up-to-date information on college requirements, SAT/ACT testing, essays, etc. 

With Manny's help, my oldest will be attending his dream school in the fall, all the while making it very affordable to do so. I've got another senior that is currently working with College Planning ABC and my daughter right behind, will also be under Manny's guidance in the near future. College Planning ABC made college affordable for my son and I. If you've got a high school student in your life wanting to pursue his/her college education, reach out to Manny and his team at College Planning ABC.

review.author: Valenn O.
review.description: We attended a few of the FREE workshops and each time I would learn something new.  We signed up for the program before JR Year and it has been a great decision for our family. The program is complete with results.  Our son received acceptances from 3 Universities-School of Engineering here in the SF Bay Area - School of Engineering. One of them included a generous scholarship offer.  They guide you through the whole process.  We are very happy!!  We highly recommend College Planning ABC!

review.author: Julianna P.
review.description: Manny is a great counselor and can help you streamline the process for college and help you in making such a tough decision!

review.author: Swan R.
review.description:
My daughter recently got accept from waitlised SCU. Yay thanks for Manny help and guidance. 
If you are parents who do not have time or experience in college planning Manny will be a good resource to go to. 

Yes, would recommended College Planning ABC.

review.author: Janet L.
review.description: Manny was so wonderful to work with.  We reached out to him during my child's senior year in late October 2019 to get help with college applications.  With so many new rules and changes, college applications was so confusing.   With such short notice before the deadline for college applications in November 2019, Manny was able to guide my child to successfully meet the college applications deadline as well as helped my child with editing appealing college essays.    With Manny's help, my child was on target with deadlines & college choices.  That made a tremendous difference for us.  Manny is a life saver.   I really enjoyed working with him too.  He is so accessible & available.  He also helped us with scholarships and that helped us saved a lot of money.   Thank you Manny for all your help!  I highly recommend him as he saved us a lot of time & money.

review.author: Sharon H.
review.description: Free complimentary workshop for College Planning is very useful for parents who has kids going to college. At first I was worried of attending  because  I was half expecting there would be some hidden sale tactic. Nothing like that happened, it really was at no risk or obligation seminar. No sales pitch happened, Manny (speaker) just really have a passion of showing you the in and outs of saving money in college and how to minimize your cost by applying for private and federal grant or scholarships and how to go about it. Its tons of good information, and what's more, he offered an hour of complimentary one on one meeting in his office in San Jose. Attended that too today and again no sales pitch and just useful stuff. I totally recommend for you to catch the next seminar.

review.author: M M.
review.description: The man can walk on water! We used Manny for both of our daughters who were one year apart. His approach to the process was what we needed to keep us all on track for both girls. Both my daughters attended his workshops and classes and knew what they needed to do and when it needed to get done. This in itself was a huge help. Both ended up at Chapman University. My oldest attended there first and my second daughter followed suit. With  Mannys expertise he had me go back to the school and petition to get my daughters merit amount raised based on her academic accomplishments.  Everyone was afraid that they would revoke admission if I pushed too hard but Manny knew what they offer for what GPA and he was correct and we ended up almost doubling her merit! That was a huge chunk of money for us to have saved. Who would have thought after you get accepted that merit was even negotiable. Manny did! Again.... I can't say enough wonderful stuff about him and his energy. Both my daughters adored him. They both since graduated college. One with a double major in 4 years and the other  in three years and walked together. Manny followed them on their college progress and still keeps in touch today. If you have kids prepping for college I would highly recommend him.

review.author: N M.
review.description: Manuel suggested schools that are more likely to provide grant money, so we ended up saving money at a very good college.  He considers major, GPA, SAT score in terms of the colleges he recommends.  They worked with us to get the college apps and FASFA forms filled on time.  There are multiple deadlines so that was very helpful.  They also worked with my daughter on college apps and essays.

review.author: Janice S.
review.description: If you are stressed out about the college application process, the financial application process, or how to write an essay for college applications, then College Planning ABC is for you. As a busy mom, I don't have the time or energy to research everything. Manny is an expert in this process and is so knowledgeable and easy to talk to. He will work with you to find the right school and the right budget for your family.  I highly recommend him for parents trying to navigate the college application process, you will get information that no school counselor will provide you, especially on the financial end.

review.author: Gail C.
review.description: Manny and his team helped us to navigate the financial aid process when my daughter got accepted to her first-choice college, which also happens to be one of the priciest ones.  Since my daughter has four parents supporting her, Manny and his team not only helped us to make decisions as to whose income to use, but they also helped us to fill out the FAFSA and other required documents.  As a result, my daughter received numerous scholarships and grants, and paying for college didn't take a huge toll on our finances.  I am happy to say that my daughter is graduating this school year and she is able to start her career without a mountain of student debt!

review.author: David C.
review.description: Manny has helped me with the struggles that most high schoolers face when getting to there college. I got in to some colleges from high school but not the ones i wanted to, so i waited it out through community college. When my time came to apply again, Manny continued to help me get into the school i wanted to, SDSU. He helped me with all the required paperwork that I needed for school as well as all the financial part. He saved me a lot of time and I highly recommend College Planning ABC.

review.author: Mike P.
review.description: If you have kid(s) in high school, then you owe it to yourself to attend Manuel's (Manny) free College Planning presentation. Bring your student(s) as it's worthwhile for them to get an understanding of what it takes, financially & academically, to attend their dream college. A dynamic speaker, Manny definitely keeps things light & moving at a good pace, providing key information regarding the college application process.  With real life examples provided, you will walk away more informed & confident about your child's collegiate future!

review.author: Nancy R.
review.description:
My son's new favorite person...   Without question the best decision we made in the last two years was to work with Manuel.

Private college was never on the horizon from our perspective.  Attending a free seminar opened our eyes to the possibilities.  Learning how and why certain colleges selected students was fascinating, and the seminar flew by leaving us hopeful.

When Manny met with our son one and one, his attitude changed overnight.   He had an optimism and enthusiasm about all things testing (who knew?) and wholly enjoyed the phone interviews about what he wanted from a university (studies, sports, clubs, social).

Finally, school selection was key and proved to be the piece that completed the puzzle.  Not only does our son have scholarships to incredible private schools, but he has options.  From our prior plan of living at home attending the local college to the current visits to private schools to DECIDE which one to attend, my son's life is forever changed.

From two hard working parents who would never have been able to navigate the academic jungle without Manny, our gratitude is endless.

review.author: David S.
review.description:
If you're looking for a place to improve your leadership and speaking skills, with a special emphasis on storytelling (and, let's face it - stories move people in ways that facts and figures don't), the Silicon Valley Storytellers Toastmasters club is for you.

Every meeting includes opportunities to take on a leadership role, three slots for prepared storytelling, and Tale Topics - impromptu storytelling based on a prompt you're given just before you speak.  Like all Toastmasters clubs, expect to give and get constructive feedback.

Visit the club on the 2nd and 4th Monday of every month - there's a no-host dinner starting at 6 (to pay for the room), and the meeting starts at 7.  Guests are welcome, whether or not you have Toastmasters or storytelling experience.

review.author: Sara T.
review.description:
Took the step stool making woodworking class yesterday. Highly recommend it. Suitable for beginners. Our teacher was Larry Truhe and he was absolutely wonderful. Patient, thorough in his instructions, and quite entertaining. It felt great to be able to make with your hands and also leave at the end of the class with a fully finished step stool! 

My only complaint is that we were only provided eye masks and no ear muffs/earbuds or dust masks. Some of the machines were super loud (think screaming banshees) and dust was absolutely flying all over the place. Towards the middle of the class, people started coughing a bit more often. My chest started hurting and is still hurting now. My throat definitely feels off. Sawdust is not a joke. Pack a dust mask for this class at the least.

Otherwise, really enjoyed the class! Will definitely sign up for some more and wouldn't hesitate to take another class with Larry.

review.author: James L.
review.description: This is a great place for those who for one reason or another missed out on graduating high school on time. It's never to late to get your GED and this place can get you ready for that. On average people with High School diplomas or their equivalent make a lot more money than those with out. So if this speaks to you check it out and see how you can get your GED.

review.author: Veronica S.
review.description:
My instructor was amazing. She was very professional, prepared us well for the workforce as much she could during the start of the pandemic, and would also provide instruction using different techniques which is helpful since not everyone learns the same way. Truly a gift to the program.

However, the CTE supervisor was unprofessional at the end while some of us were left looking for our own externships. While many clinics stopped accepting externs due to Covid, that does not give a representative of the school the right to be rude and condescending to its students. The newsletter sent out after our graduation also had wrong information. It said I gained my employment with a large hospital after going through the program and their Externship provided by the school. This is a lie. I had already been employed by the hospital for 4 years PRIOR to taking the course and remained in the same job position following graduation. I also had found my own externship even though at the informational meeting about the program, it was clearly stated we were not supposed to find our own and that the school would provide us with the externship. There was at least one other student where the newsletter stated the same lies about her employment being due to the school's program and externship. 

Would I recommend this program to my friends? Debatable. The instructor was amazing and I highly recommend HER. But the rest of the experience has left a bitter taste in my mouth.

review.author: Thai N.
review.description: Hello everyone, \nI just wanted to say I know some of us feel a little subconscious in reaching out for education at this age.. But were in luck, Because a testimony from me is that I just got off the phone with someone at their office about getting my classes and in the process she shared with me how to enroll in some photographyClasses with some pretty good Info! Made me feel pretty confident And I definitely appreciate it! May the world revolutionize itself around us with this!   Thanks to a Gabby, C. For being the assistant on the phone today. -ThaiNg.

review.author: Madhumitha P.
review.description: I had bought the sewing 101 class for my sis in law and she love it so much. She is a beginner and she said it's a great class for beginners. They learnt 3 to 4 projects. But, she enrolled for the next sewing class soon after finishing the 101 and had a bad experience. She said they hardly taught her anything. You just buy patterns and sew in the class and there is nothing that they teach.

review.author: Natasha W.
review.description:
This review is for the office of SCAE.org, not the actual classes. I signed up for two classes - both woodworking - and the class that wasn't cancelled (making a cutting board) was fantastic. This review is for the office because due to their mistakes, I won't be taking another class.  

I registered for the Adirondack chair class and apparently there weren't enough people so the class was cancelled. No one called though son I still went to the school. Thankfully the teacher was there and he told me about the class situation. The school was going to wait a week to see if more people would sign up but unfortunately they didn't. I did receive a call that week but now, over three weeks later, there still hasn't been a refund. I've called and emailed and the office's response was that it was refunded - even though according to my bank statement, it hasn't. 

It's too bad, you can't just pay the teacher the night of the class and skip the mess of the registration and office.

review.author: Chandra D.
review.description:
4 stars: for the school.
3 stars: for the sewing class I took.

So. I can't hate on Santa Clara Adult Ed because they offer affordable classes. The ladies in the office were friendly to me and answered all my questions.

$80 for a 5 week sewing course? Can't beat that price!
Sewing machines are in the class. You will have to spend an extra $50-$80 on sewing supplies. 

The sewing class:
Susan Sjostrom is listed as the instructor but she also has a sidekick named Susan that offers assistance.

I took this class because I have ZERO sewing experience. I barely knew the diffference between a bobbin and a button.

I recommend that you take their class if you have SOME experience and are looking to improve. I was lost EVERY class and only finished one project out of the 5 they had (one for each week). 

The ladies had sewing jargon/terms roll off their tongues, but didn't really offer visuals for the terms. I constantly found myself going home and using YouTube to figure out what the heck they were talking about.

Half the time I felt like a moron because they gave out oral directions and I had no reference point to really understand what they meant or how to get started. So when directions were given I'd go back to my machine and cry (ha...just kidding). 

The only time I felt liked I really, truly learned was when Susan Sjostrom sat at my sewing machine and EXPLAINED everything to me as she did it. It was so, so awesome! 

There are only 2 instructors, so you'll have to wait awhile to get questions answered if you have them. 

At any rate, you can't go wrong with Santa Clara Adult Education.

review.author: Steve W.
review.description: BEWARE that they will cancel the class at last minute and charge you extra service fee. This doesn't make any sense and they refuse to refund you the full amount you paid when registering the class. This is not very legit. I will never use them.

review.author: Momu G.
review.description: I did salsa class here with instructor Lisa and we really had fun. First 2 classes were spent in getting adjusted to instructors way of teaching, but other than that it worked out.\nI will definitely suggest instructor to be more organized and include revision of last week's moves at the beginning of each class.\nI will recommend this class.

review.author: Jocelyn J.
review.description: I have attended several courses for more than half a year. It was really an excellent experience studying in Santa Clara Adult Education. My instructor Gail who taught Communicating, Team building, and Problem Solving in the Workplace is awesome. Her class is very interesting,  interactive and useful. I gained a lot of new ideas from every participants in this class. Emerita who instructed Microsoft Office Course is very professional, she always encouraged us patiently. Nancy who taught ESL is always willing to share us everything and she is really nice. It's worthy to attend the school, and the fee is reasonable as well.

review.author: Fullmoon T.
review.description:
The 3 stars are for the location and the school director. I tried to take an accounting class here in the evenings and I want to WARN anyone that wants to do the same. The instructor is from India with a HEAVY Indian accent. She has a masters in accounting and teaches FAST! so fast your head will spin from trying to compute what she just said to keeping up via instruction. 
Example she went through one chapter in 30 minutes. How do I know? because I timed her. Then she wants you to group up and Work together. I mean everyone is just as lost how can we help each other? 
We the students don't really ask questions because 1. She does not understand what we ask. 2. We're so lost in trying to keep up and decipher what she is trying to say/teach. We don't know what to ask.
After her examples on the white board she never asks if we had any questions. She just moves on, quickly.
Being in her class reminds me of a fast paced school like Heald College or the old Sawyer business college etc.
This class will be good for the people who are used to the Indian (India) accent and/or have some experience in accounting already. For the beginners this class will Challenge you to the fullest for the reasons stated above.
The instructor does not check homework. You have to check your own. If you do not check your homework via a Teachers edition binder she has and you are doing it wrong. You will never know if you are doing it right or not. She encourages us to snap photos of the answers from the teachers edition binder. The only issue with this is. She usually shows up for class 5 minutes ahead of class. You do not have time if someone else has the books (there are 3) (so you stay lost)
She swoops the books up quickly as to deter you from checking homework after class. Again, she is in a hurry to go home and she does leave Right On Time and not a minute after.
The instructor is not very welcoming or friendly. So it's hard to approach her before or after class. She sits at her desk with no eye contact. (head down) Don't have to put up a (Do Not Disturb Sign here)
When I do ask a question she does not understand what I am trying to say. She seems frustrated. She is very impatient with us and you can feel it. #discouraging
This class  will set you back just under $200.00 Class plus books, working papers.
The only way I kept up was good old Youtube videos. I am sure she is a good person, but not everyone can teach. Does not matter how many degrees you have. If you are an instructor. You must have patience and speak English properly or at least slower and make an effort so We (students) can understand.
It took me awhile to understand the meaning of proprietor from her. Instead of saying "Only" she says One-ly business person and makes reference to business assets with examples of "bags of wheat" I kid you not.
For the people, specially beginners. I would suggest before you fork out all that money. Ask the director of SCAE if you could do a sit in first before making a commitment to sign up and fork out $200
I'm just glad. I took that class to get an understanding oppose to "Needed" the class for a career. 
You have been informed. Now make up your own mind.
Again, for the record. This review is nothing personal against the teacher's personality as a person. It's strictly business.

***I think it's very interesting how YE G. only has one review LOL I don't think my personal experience regarding the Accounting class was ridiculous. I'm just keeping it real. It's difficult for us Americans who's native tongue is English to try and comprehend heavy accents from ESL and second, try to learn something new. Update: 2016 Santa Clara Adult Ed is bringing in a new instructor this Summer. The other instructor received too many complaints. 

YE G. if you are the instructor I had the experience with (coincidence?) This review has nothing to do with your personal character as a person. You yourself mentioned how difficult it was for us to understand you remember? You understand Accounting book theory. But you have no prior Accounting experience in the real world (Those are your words) I suggest taking classes on how to improve your English skills and slow your speech down. You will be a more efficient teacher.  I'm letting other people know what they can expect and how difficult it was for some of us students to understand you. (we spoke after class) before they fork out over $200.00 for just this one of three classes. No hard feelings towards you. I'm just being honest.

review.author: Mel D.
review.description: Photography classes with Noella Vigeant here is amazing. I've taken photo classes in other schools but the quality and value I get over here at SCAE with Noella is the best.It's not just one day workshops/classes but rather a series so you can break down the concepts such as exposure/composition/flash.  Then because you have a chance to submit your own photos week after week... you get feedback and she can tell you what to fix. That's really hard to beat. Also, she hardly brings her camera in her classes so that she focuses on you, the student, and making sure you are not being left behind. In some field trips, she shadows you around and gives you challenges on photos and you have to achieve it before she moves on. My skills have leveled up since I started classes with her. And did I mention it's super cheap?  It's a crime not more students sign up.

review.author: YE G.
review.description: What fullmoon T said is ridiculous. The instructor from Indian prepared well and taught well, it's one of the reason why I learned from level 1 to level 3. And it's fun in the class I think she explained very clearly, even she has Indian accent I can still understand what she said as I'm a foreigner here. \n     When you want to leave earlier with reasonable reason she'll let you go, but she always come very early and finish on time. I don't know why fullmoon T gave her such negative evaluation, maybe he or she just not so into accounting..

review.author: Rowena Z.
review.description:
This place is really hit or miss.

I took Social Dance Survival which was poorly structured with a disorganized teacher.  We could not tolerate it for more than two classes.

On the other hand, Sewing 101 and Sewing 102 were fantastic!  As a complete newbie to sewing, Sue & Sue were so encouraging and provided many handy tips and tricks that they accumulated over 20+ years of sewing.  It's that bit of knowledge that is hard to find in a YouTube video or a book...  you really need to be there with an experienced hand to figure out all the proper ways to really finish your project.  With Sewing 101, you're given projects to do which are wonderful to do...  with Sewing 102, you are given much more flexibility in your projects.  I would highly recommended these sewing classes.  It's just a shame I can't enroll in Quilting 101 since it's during the weekdays. :(

review.author: Margaret R.
review.description:
I came here for a 5-session 3-hour sewing class. I ended up having to pay ~$80 for the class. Great deal especially considering some places offer one sewing class for $40. 

The instructors were extremely knowledgeable and passionate about sewing and other crafts. 

I liked that each student got to work on his/her own project because it definitely made the classes more interesting. The only con is that sometimes you have to wait a while before you can get an instructor's attention when she is helping someone else with his questions on his specific project. 

You are required to buy some basic materials and fabrics, but the classroom has sewing machines and tools for students to borrow.

review.author: Anna S.
review.description:
The classes here are a true crapshoot. I signed up for a conversational spanish class once that was fabulously bad. I dont even want to go into the teacher's many faults, but suffice it to say, I dropped the class, didnt get any money back. I think you do have the option of transferring the money you spent to another class, if it doesnt work out, or the class is canceled. the teachers get paid based on receiving the minimum number of applicants, so the classes get cancelled if only, say 10 people enroll, and they have determined that there needs to be 12. however, the classes are very inexpensive, and can teach you a lot if you have the time and the interest in a subject. 

I totally support adult/community education and everything it stands for. this location shares the school buildings with two continuation schools, a jazzercise school and some other things, including a large program for developmentally disabled adults. there is a parent participating pre-school here as well. 

most of the class participants are retired, altho they run the gamut with a fair amount of stay-at-home moms and others. They run tons of classes on network/etc certification, GED classes, knitting classes, you name it. All of the ESL classes are free!

The community garden may be the best part of it. you can basically rent a plot for 2.5 months. this comes with free classes on saturday mornings of gardening activities led by my mother herself. not to be biased, but she is very informational and enthusiastic. her classes include all sorts of topics, from building compost piles, and other earth-friendly activities, to making garden statues, edible flowers, learning about all sorts of plant varieties and growing tips, etc. It is not only informative, but very community-oriented, a great way to get to know your neighbors. The garden also hosts educational field trips for local school kids, as well as a raised bed plot for the developmentally disabled adults in wheelchairs. 

if you want to know more about the classes, drop into the office on weekdays, the ladies there are very helpful. if you are interested in the community garden, come by any Saturday from 9-12, the gates are open and people would love to show you their plots. The program runs for 10 weeks, it costs $35, there are 4 sessions a year.

review.author: Ellen D.
review.description:
Santa Clara Adult Education offers many different courses at reasonable rates.  

So far, I have tried coed soccer and beginning hatha yoga.  Both classes provide a good workout in a friendly environment.  I highly recommend SCAE if you are looking for a low-key weekly workout or are interested in trying a new type of exercise.  The classes are ideal for someone who anticipates that a late workday, etc. will sometimes keep them from attending; there is no pressure to be there every week.  Overall, a great resource for the residents of SC and nearby towns.

The sessions begin about every two months, and you can register and pay online.

review.author: Vee K.
review.description: If you ever want to sew or quilt take Sue sjostroms class.  She knows EVERYTHING pertaining to crafts.  Doesnt matter what you are working on, she will work with you individually to help you along.

review.author: Saswati P.
review.description:
Hello : I have just taken the course Achieving Top Search Engine Positions (Santa Clara Adult Education)- please be careful not to take this course:
1- Inconsistent 
2- Just waste of money
3- Filled with trash and jargon

review.author: Anu R.
review.description: This review is for the sewing 101 class by Susan Sjostrom at Santa Clara Adult Education Center. The class size is apt with choice of BYOM(machine) or use the ones in class. They let you learn at your pace. Susan and her assistant Susan are very knowledgeable, encouraging and accessible throughout the class and make you feel like a sewing hero even if you just sewed your first pin cushion :) I can't wait to take another class with them and the price just cannot be beat.

review.author: Juliann F.
review.description: We are so grateful we found Keys to Communication! Within a little over a year, my son is talking nonstop and I'm so appreciative of the advice & support I've been given. We will miss you guys very much!

review.author: Genevieve L.
review.description:
Horrible communication and customer service. I was excited when I found them because the reviews seemed great. However, the greatness stopped there. 

I reached out via Yelp on 10/21/21 to submit an inquiry and get more information. I got a quick response on Yelp and was told by the owner to call the office. I immediately called and dealt with their receptionist who was less than helpful. Didn't understand why I was inquiring. I explained I wanted to make an appointment for my child and get more information. She said she would send an intake form and that it would be reviewed within 24-48 hours by the owner. She asked how I wanted to pay and I said I could either use insurance or pay out of pocket. I said I was willing to do whichever was faster as I only cared about getting an appointment, not the cost. She said okay and to send insurance info because they could quickly verify whether or not to use it. 

On 10/22/21 I sent back the completed intake along with pics of our insurance cards. 

Then.... Radio silence. 

I was notified on 10/23 that my email still had not been opened. I then called several times over the next week to Inquire and follow up. Was told they were "looking into it and waiting for the owner to review the intake form."

On 11/9/21 I messaged on Yelp because I was not getting anywhere. The owner apologized and said the admin would be calling me. 

I got an email notification that my email had been opened by them for the first time since it was sent 3 weeks prior. I got a long excuse and was asked if I was still interested and to provide insurance info. I then also got a call. I restated that I had ALREADY provided the insurance pics in my original 10/22 email and that all I cared about what the appointment, not the cost. And it faster to just pay out of pocket. She was confused and said she didn't see my info and would look again. I replied back in my email as well saying all info had already been provided. No apology.  Nothing. She then stated she would now pass on my info to the billing department. 

Radio silence again. 

And now on 12/2 I get an email saying they don't have an insurance contract with Health Net. They also don't know when they will be able to renew it. Nothing about paying out of pocket or apology. Just "Thanks!"

A month and a half later and a total waste of time. No appointment.

review.author: Miriam D.
review.description: I brought my 4 y/o to Keys to Communication because it was listed as a provider with my insurance and they had great reviews. Melanie in the front was very helpful with all my questions. Everyone we encountered was pleasant. My daughter worked with Ms. Simone and loved going to speech. Ms. Simone was very sweet and patient with my daughter. She had fun and engaging activities. We had to do some therapy virtually and even those were fun for my daughter. Ms Simone always gave feedback and advice to better help my daughter. We both enjoyed the experience at Keys to Communication.

review.author: Miss L.
review.description: Keys to Communication is a great place for speech therapy. We had the pleasure of working with Alissa and Thao and they were both great with supporting my son for his speech delay. They provided various strategies and gave us homework to continue building his language skills at home every week. Alissa is really passionate about the field of speech language pathology and I trust her 100% with my son. They were patient and caring and never gave up with my son.

review.author: Lauren R.
review.description: Keys To Communication was such a blessing.  I had the opportunity of working with Alissa Tone directly and she provided applicable strategies and techniques to improve my speech and overall confidence.  \n\nThe staff is responsive, professional, and very courteous and feels like an extended family when I go in.  I would highly recommend checking them out!

review.author: Jacob F.
review.description: Keys to Communication is such a positive, professional place to improve your child's speech! The staff are friendly and genuinely love working with kids! Our two year old daughter, with delayed speech, came once a week for 8 months and and now she can't stop talking :) A big thanks to Speech Pathologist  Amy and receptionist Melanie for making our experience so great!!

review.author: Jenny L.
review.description: My 3 year old son recently "graduated" from Keys To Communication because he met all of his goals. While we are thrilled that he met his goals, we were sad to leave. From our first phone call, all the way to our last day, we had nothing but positive experiences. Everyone was kind, welcoming and professional. My son worked with Ms. Simone and she was amazing. She always had fun activities planned that kept him engaged and he was excited to return each week. I highly recommend Keys To Communication to anyone who is looking for speech services.

review.author: Younsoo R.
review.description:
I recommend Keys to Communication to anyone looking for speech therapy.

I decided to trust K2C with my son because Alissa Tone recommended to rewrite the goal with more specific therapy goals oriented for my son after hearing my son's case and reviewing his evaluations.  She recommended Merrett and attended the sessions from time to time to check the progress.  Alissa and Merrett gave their advices  me to follow up for my son at home. 
 
My son has improved in interactions with others such as making calls to stay away from people saying inappropriate things at school as well as saying 'no' and expressing he was not happy to his peers.

Merrett made a note book with the lesson summary with HW to follow up.  She reviewed and explained practices to followed up with me and my son at the end of each sessions.  She also praised things he did well and note the improvements he made. She was patient and professional.  Some of the lessons were 'think it ,say it'; monitor people's reactions as you are describing your interests; stop and ask if they are interested; appropriate vs. inappropriate in different situations; etc.   These activities also helped to self reflect, so he started to watch his own actions during conversations to reflect his intention and attention.  She also had him practice with staff in the office and play game.  

BTW, the staff, Melanie and Tracy, were wonderful.  They got the practicing buddy role down!   Tracy's efficient in her communication in billing.   Melanie is friendly and remembers everyone visiting the office and their schedules.  

Highly recommend Keys to Communication.

review.author: Patricia H.
review.description: Alissa Tone and her staff are simply amazing! Our 6 year old granddaughter is speech delayed and when my son asked Kaiser for an assessment they were totally clinical. At the time, she was 4 years old and did not want anything to do with any doctor. The doctors simply stated that she could not be assessed. Alissa came to our home and was successful in conducting an assessment.  We could not be happier with the beautiful child our granddaughter has blossomed into. She has no problem telling her Pops that she wants In and Out or telling her daddy that it's time to get on the trampoline. Last night she sent her uncle to 31 flavors.  We are loving it!  Alissa keep up the wonderful, transformational work that you have going on!

review.author: Katie W.
review.description:
My experience with K2C was great from the start. I spoke to Melanie the first time I called and she answered all my questions and sent me the new client forms right away. 

We were paired with Amy and couldn't have been happier. She clearly laid out goals for my son that we worked toward each session. My son and I both looked forward to seeing her every session. Amy always thought of new creative ways to engage him when he would lose interest in an activity (as most 2 year olds do!)

Not only did Amy encourage and facilitate my son's progress at each session but I learned so many great tools for working with him day-to-day at home. My son would often ask to see Amy on days when we weren't scheduled to work with her. 

Everyone in the office was friendly, cheerful, helpful, and communication was never a problem with front desk and billing staff. I can't say enough great things about K2C!

review.author: Peter H.
review.description: Used Keys to Communication for our son. The Staff are all wonderful. Miss Mikaela was a great therapist and connected with our son. Tracy who handled billing always assisted when referrals and insurance were giving us the run around. I would highly recommend this office for anyone looking for Speech Therapy.

review.author: Mayra L.
review.description: My son's therapist was Simone. He really enjoyed working with her and really improved his speech needs. She communicated well with his school district therapist and that way they were both working on his same goals. He was able to graduate and meet his speech goals within the time frame. My husband and I are grateful and pleased with the services received. We had once worked with Merett as well and my son enjoyed working with her as well, he was pulled out of therapy due to covid when jt first began and since he still needed services I was happy to see them in the list of providers. I was excited when I called them and found out they were taking new referrals and that is when we got a chance to meet and work with Simone. The whole staff is friendly with everyone that comes into the office.

review.author: Sarah R.
review.description:
I brought my 4 y/o here for treatment of her stutter. I couldn't tell if it was normative and we were home schooling due to COVID, so it's not like we could lean on a teacher to tell us anything was serious. I decided to get an evaluation for peace of mind and they suggested she would benefit from treatment. The course was relatively brief and after several weeks her stutter is improved about 60%! 

Scheduling was easy, the front staff was very nice, the office was clean and felt COVID safe. Merrett gave us the evaluation but We worked primarily with Amy. My daughter and saw her in person at first but then over video. She did a great job over video and my daughter thinks Amy has the "best games". 

Happy we came!

review.author: Sam R.
review.description:
I wanted to take some time to write a review about Keys to Communication. 

My older son had Ms. Amy as a speech therapist for a while. When he first started, his expressive language was very poor. Nobody could ever understand what he was saying. Within a month, we noticed tremendous progress as he was able to say certain sounds he couldn't say before. Ms. Amy provided weekly homework, which helped SO much! She's an extremely caring and fun loving person. My son looked forward every week to seeing her! She made each session fun and my son's speech improved drastically by her methods. Due to scheduling conflicts and schools reopening, I needed to change my son's time slot. Ms. Amy wasn't available for that timeslot, so he started seeing Ms. Mikaela! 

Ms. Mikaela was also amazing! She was very patient (my son likes to talk a lot!) and friendly with him, and he always had great memories of their session. 

My younger son is currently being seen by Ms. Merrett. My son is very shy but she has had such a great effect on him that he instantly goes to play/ learn with her. It shows that he has no hesitation and he enjoys their time together. We have seen such an amazing improvement and Ms. Merrett always has helpful feedback and provides tangible advice for improvement! We are extremely happy with all of the instructors our kids have had, as well as their commitment to improving their communication. They are without a doubt deeply committed, knowledgeable, and kind professionals.

review.author: Amy K.
review.description: My family and I have nothing but great things to say about Keys To Communication! We brought our son in for a consultation when he was around 2 years old and he was barely saying 3 words. Our Speech Language Pathologist, Amy Nguyen, worked wonders with our son! Amy instantly connected with him and catered the sessions to his interests. Amy did a fantastic job making the sessions fun and playful which allowed my son to connect and want to work very hard during his sessions. In just a short 8 months, our son was able to catch up and graduate from speech therapy. *Please note, there was a lot of "homework" we as parents needed to do with our son but Amy helped streamline this process with the wonderful sessions and guidance she provided us! Our son was always so happy and excited to go see "Ms. Amy!" and couldn't wait to get into the car to go see her. Ms. Amy will always have a special place in our hearts and we cannot thank her enough for all her hard work and expertise that she bestowed upon us! We highly recommend Amy Nguyen at Keys To Communication! We also wanted to give a little shout out to the receptionist, Ms. Melanie, who was always so happy to greet us before our appointment. She was always so warm and welcoming which made the temperature check process such a joy to complete.

review.author: Shahram E.
review.description: Merrett has been a wonderful experience for my daughter. We struggled to find her speech therapy and came across Keys to Communication. I am so happy we found them. Merrett helped my daughter greatly. Compared to other places we went, Merrett clearly explained the process and provided us with techniques and exercises to practice at home. Merrett and the team are very professional and experts in their field. Again, I really appreciate them telling me the parent how I can help at home! My daughter has graduated now and wouldn't think twice to go back if needed in the future. Thanks Merrett and Keys To Communication!

review.author: Hilda O.
review.description:
My son was diagnosed with a language delay just after 3 years old and we were lucky enough to work with Merrett for 11 months. The difference we saw in that time was just amazing - he went from being unintelligible at times, to saying clear, full sentences and understanding quantitative concepts. 
What was really impressive is that part way through our course, Merrett was able to pivot her teaching style to adapt to my son's preferred way of learning, which led to even more productive sessions. 
Aside from the weekly sessions, Merrett provided us with the techniques to use at home for my son's continuous learning, which helped a great deal. 
The sessions never felt like speech therapy, the environment was always fun and interactive, and even though my son has now 'graduated' he still asks to see Ms Merrett every Saturday.

review.author: Nick V.
review.description: Merrett and Alissa have been amazing with our twin boys. Their techniques are very effective and they accommodate both of our boys for individual sessions at the same time on the same day. We are lucky to have been referred to them by our Pediatrician, Dr. David Trager. They have given us the techniques, tools, and signals to help us work with them at home. \n\nMy boys are always extremely excited to see them and love their sessions. They are 20 months and we have had sessions for two months because our twins were language delayed and have we have seen significant improvement since K2C.

review.author: Yemon O.
review.description: My 2 year 3 month old son with Hypotonic motor issues and speech delay received services last year for 6 months while he was getting OT at Stanford.  This office followed all Covid protocols, Melanie from front desk is great and friendly. Melanie was very communicative when he was first referred and follow up regarding the short waitlist.  Stanford told me 9 month waitlist for speech at the time. My son's therapist Amy interacted well with him, was patient even on the days he didn't want to do certain things. My son's speech was getting better and now at 3 year old 3 months. It's exponentially better. I can see a huge difference with him versus his preschool friends. He can have long sentences, full on conversations, understanding and communicating what he wants. We stopped going in January my husband was worried about Covid and Amy thought he has improved so much that it was ok to stop. Since we had BlueShield HMO, they told us exactly what the doctor should write on the referral and billing was not an issue. His weak oral motor issues are still ongoing as we see it in his feeding habits, we may probably need speech again in the future. I'll definitely go back.  Now that I'm having so much difficulty finding a quality OT place again that take my insurance for sensory issues; I'm really appreciating this place and had wished they had OT too.  I know those 6 month of therapy is going to help him advance into successful life as a child going to school in later years. Thanks Keys to Communication team. Dealing with Stanford OT referral was a nightmare and we got in after 6 months of waiting and billing was a nightmare. Our Insurance called Stanford multiple times to have them run the insurance so I wouldn't get any bills. Stanford OT we had was great if you can ever get in but it does not feel close knit like Keys to communication team.

review.author: Raina F.
review.description: My son was treated by Merrett for about a year for speech delay.  In that time, he truly blossomed.  He was barely making sounds when we started and now is able to fully communicate.  Merrett is a fantastic SLP.  She bonds well with young children and uses a play based approach to make sessions fun and entertaining for the.  My son looked forward to our weekly meetings. The rest of the staff is patient and professional.  We had a very good experience overall.  I highly recommend Keys to Communication.

review.author: Puneet S.
review.description: Our daughter has gone to Harker since their inaugural preschool class started . She loves it and so do we . Teachers are great and after school programs are plentiful . \nEven though it takes an hour to get to school we think it's worth it.

review.author: Kevin M.
review.description: Not worth the money you pay out. For what it's worth, at this age you can get by at a Montessori school and get the same result. If you plan on attending, wait until elementary to start dishing out the $$$.

review.author: Bella M.
review.description: We are just about to enter our third session of summer school for our kindergarten age boy and we are thrilled with Harker!! Our regret is that we didn't apply for school this year. Our son has blossomed under their tutelage this summer-- from the summer principal Ms Chen, to the summer director Ms Gonsalves, to the teachers, support staff, and all the summer teaching kids-- thank you!!!! (Also a massive shout out to The Big Cheese and Ms K -- two of my favorite people!!) it's been an amazing experience for our family -- thank you for showing us what's possible. You've made an indelible impact on our sons development and on our growth as parents. One week left and in the words of our son...we wish it was forever".

review.author: Christine R.
review.description: Our daughter is a Kindergarten student at Harker and is thriving. She loves her teachers and various classes - which includes language, computers, character development, STEM, art, music, gym, social studies, violin, gymnastics, and even cooking! I am incredibly impressed by everything she is learning at such a young age, and the fact that she is truly loving learning in itself!\n\nThere is a reason Harker is a top-rated school in the *country*. Her father and I cannot say enough good things about the amazing, well-rounded education she is receiving.

review.author: David C.
review.description: What a wonderful school! My son finished Kindergarten here, and is now in 1st Grade. He loves school and always impresses me with what he's learned. We've been particularly happy with the emphasis on deeper conceptual understanding of material, so it's not just rote memorization and regurgitation. Word problems were a significant part of Kindergarten math, and I'm positive I wasn't doing word problems that early when I was a kid. The teachers and administration are very receptive to feedback and concerns that inevitably crop up during the school year. We've been happy with the way they've handled issues, and clearly customer service is an important part of their philosophy. \n\nTuition is on the higher range of private schools, but in this case you truly do get what you pay for.

review.author: CuteFurry C.
review.description: My child transferred to Harker lower school from a very good public elementary school.  He does not have a Harker sibling, did not score high in the admissions test (as compared to students transferring from private schools), did not win any competition, and is not a sports/music star-to-be.  And we did not hint a big donation either.  Frankly we felt extremely lucky to be admitted and great sense of relief.   My only complaint is the tuition but I guess it's fair market price to pay.  My child is very satisfied with Harker and adjusted really well.  Each subject has a dedicated teacher who's able to give more to teaching and the children.  I would consider one teacher from last year as a star teacher who gave that much more to teaching with passion.  Each child is able to flourish in his/her own way.   At least for the lower school unhealthy competition is not encouraged.  Every child is respected and the goal is to aid every child in the discovery of their passion, strength and learning.  Homework and curriculum is suitable for the grade level. Because my child did not have private school education before coming to Harker, I tried to help him with homework and bridge any gap as needed, which helped ease his stress and anxiety and help him catch up with other students.  Based on what I observed, other parents did not need to help the children with homework (which the school discourages anyway).   The school sends report card three times in the year, where every homework and class work would count to show a general picture of the children's effort and achievement.  My child asked me why we did not start him at Harker earlier, which I did regret about.  I don't think Harker is worth every penny you paid for, but it is the best choice in the South Bay Area and therefore worthy of the investment in the children's life long learning and education.

review.author: Daljit K.
review.description:
I strongly discourage those whose kids have no siblings in the Harker to apply for this school. If your kids have no siblings already in the Harker, the chance of your kids to be admitted is very slim, if not impossible. The destruction of your kids' self-esteem and confidence because of failing to be admitted in the Harker will be disastrous, and will affect your kids' future forever.

Harker publicly declares that they DO have policy to have higher priority to enroll the kids who have sibling already in the Harker. There are only a few openings every year, and there are more applicants whose siblings are already in the Harker. Therefore, if your kids have no sibling in the Harker, it is extremely difficult for your kids to be admitted, no matter how excellent your kids are. My kid has several classmates and friends who have siblings in the Harker. They are not as excellent as my kid, and they never work hard for the entrance tests. But they told my kid that they don't need study hard and they could go to the Harker whenever they wanted to go. Although a top student, my kid has much less chance to be admitted. Frustrated, my kid no longer studies hard as before, and spends more time in TV and computer games, saying "It's useless to study hard. I don't need work hard since you're rich!". We always educate our kids to study hard to be successful in the future. But now my kid doesn't believe me anymore. 

If your kids have no sibling in the Harker and you want to send your kids to Harker, you need think twice. Not only will it waste your time, energy and money to prepare for their tests, more destructively it will ruin your kids' future most likely.

review.author: A S.
review.description: Great school, solid community, wonderful teaching and very involved staff. All around great experience! So many options for after school and wonderful feedback from teachers and staff. Couldn't be happier with our experiences.

review.author: Lisa G.
review.description: I attended Harker for 9 years. When I graduated I felt my education was more advance than my peers and prepared me for highschool. The education is top notch, the sports programs are competitive and the afterschool supervision allows working parents a safe and educational environment for their kids to enjoy unitl pick up time. The teachers care about each student and the development of their education. I am looking forward to sending both my kids to Harker in the next few years.

review.author: Lys S.
review.description: The best school in the bay area!   The academics truly challenges the young minds.  Each child is motivated and encouraged to do the best to their ability.   My child's teachers have been excellent and I have never felt that my child has been pushed by the school so much as some stated.   I think most of the pushing is from the parents themselves.  The children are well behaved and taught to be very respectful towards others.  There seems to be good communication between the teachers, parents, and counselors to make sure the children are doing well academically, socially, and emotionally.  Harker also provides a nice balance of field trips, outings, etc.  Extremely expensive, however well worth the money!    Due to the high cost of the tuition, I had contemplated on whether it would be a wise decision.  So far, I have no regrets.  I think Harker is building a wonderful foundation for a lifetime of learning.   Most of the children here successfully move on to an elite college and are more than well prepared for college.

review.author: Stella K.
review.description:
We stopped by San Jose State University so my daughter could take a look and get a feel for the campus. She is considering applying here since they offer the major she is interested in.
