From her calm, engaging approach to the way she inspires the children to explore their own world, she is a jewel of a teacher. Her school is small, but mighty!

review.author: Cheri G.
review.description: I was interested in taking my Grand daughter to Little Hands Montessori Child Care and after some research on the head teacher I came up with nothing. I emailed her to try and get more information and she just beat around the bush about her education. She claims to have studied Montessori teaching at NAMC, I emailed them and they have no records for her. Also the Day Cares' Facebook Page says they learn nutrition play outdoors and art but nothing about math reading Or ABC's her response in her email was " I think that the website explains it just fine in detail" for the price they are charging they should be up front with the info. Asked and not be so arrogant.

review.author: Joni S.
review.description: I highly recommend Little Hands. I have two children that both went there for a year. My kids, now 3 and 4 years old, have a great start in their educational journey. They both have very different personalities and learning skills that were both nurtured and loved thanks to Little Hands. Both my kids went there together for the past year. (Which having brother and sister together creates its own challenges.) It was amazing to watch the two of them grow and learn. They are both much better at sharing toys and feelings between themselves and with others. I am so proud of them and so thankful for my decision to send them to Little Hands Montessori Preschool. My children now teach me sign language and yoga that they learned at school and they practice almost everyday. My daughter is now especially concerned about her health and making healthy choices everyday. She only wants to eat healthy foods. She's not even 5 years old yet. I have Preschool to thank for that interest. She's keeping the whole family in check. Not only was it great for my children but it was an excellent choice that benefited our whole family. I am sad to say they don't attend there any longer only because we moved away. If you have the opportunity to send your kids here, I would recommend it.

review.author: Tianna B.
review.description: Rogue Community College is a waste of time and money. All the teachers are old and outdated in their fields. They write some of their own textbooks and don't even bother to bind them, but continue to charge you insane prices. The worst part is definitely the instructors though. I had a math class where the teacher instructed the class to "not ask any questions in class". The teachers put off actual teaching to volunteers at the tutoring center who may or may not know much about that particular subject. The "lab" class for the science courses are taught by whichever staff member is available whether they know anything about science or not. The person who taught my lab class was not able to answer any question and many students called that class a "DIY class" because there was no instruction going on. I would not recommend this college to anyone who wants a real education. They will take money from you any way that they can without giving you anything in return.

review.author: Serena D.
review.description: GenerateTech has excellent coding classes and hands on technology training for children. They offer after school classes, summer camps, and field trips. The teachers are patient and smart and the classes fun for the kids. For kids that want more than just playing video games, this is a great place to go.

review.author: Tina B.
review.description: Saraland City Schools all in all is a great school system to send your kids to, I wouldn't be the one to try and turn you in another direction. The school is nice, the eduacation is good, most of the teachers are very help, etc. The only thing I would have to complain about is how focused it is on sports. Mostly football but sports in general. So much time and focus goes in the sports that the arts are rarely given the support that it needs. I understand how good sports are for students but the arts are just as important for a student to be able to grow. Although the Arts are not as loved as they should be Saraland offers many arts to participate in and that I am extremely grateful for. The only thing I and any of the parents and students are asking for is more support and focus.

review.author: C Lyn M.
review.description: Saraland has great schools. All 3 schools have a very good programs for all ages. For children that have behavior issues to children that have very high IQ. The schools have a lot of things to involve parents in. If the parents want to be involved.

review.author: Monique P.
review.description: Saraland Elementary school was the best choice for our family. The community is very family oriented. We feel safe with the Saraland Police Department. My kids love this school system.

review.author: Maya H.
review.description: I have never felt more disrespected than at this establishment. On my first day I received scowls from the counselors. One even stated that misgendering a trans person on purpose is not only okay but expected. When I had a panic attack the music teacher ignored me even though I stated multiple times I needed space. Been accused of skipping when I was in a therapy session, the counselors have told the class I've had a mental breakdown, etc. when the former art teacher was fired for texting inappropriate things to a student the school claimed nothing happened and it was all just a rumor even though there was proof. This school is no where near decent. Almost every staff member either hates kids and immature, and the nice sweet staff are undervalued and underpaid.

address.streetAddress: Office 12 Haywood House Hydra Business Park\nNether Lane Ecclesfield

name: Kip McGrath Education Centres Sheffield North

review.author: Kayla C.
review.description:
Such a great university!

While the building is nice, I do think the actual library is subpar; it's more of a common area for students to be social than an academic space for quiet studying, research, reading, etc. The second floor of the building is the "library," but it's mostly couches, some tables and chairs, table games, board games, arcade games, TVs... The actual "library" is very small area of the second floor, marking one side of the second floor of the building. There aren't a ton of books, I think there is ONE private study room (on a first-come, first-served basis), and it's very sad compared to South's library: several floors of MANY books, a lot of computers, MANY private study rooms for groups as well as cubicle areas, and it's understood and enforced to be respectful and quiet there. 

As a nursing student, it was a bit disappointing there is no formal library or separate building for the School of Nursing. I love the university, but it would be great to see them do more for the academic settings and rein it back a little on the social ones. The social aspects of the university are great, and while nursing students have privileges to be in certain parts of campus for studying regardless of time of day or semester schedule, I think more students could benefit from a formal library-- away from the relaxed environment of loud socializing-- and private study areas within the library. As far as a building for the SoN, only time will tell how/if the funds could provide that...

review.author: Isaac V.
review.description: Going for the Accelerated Nursing Batchelor's and, while the education is great, the school nickels and dimes you to death with fees. The school is already expensive at $425 / credit, and they still stick you with $260 per term (three terms per semester) and other ridiculous fees. I've seen people taking the normal 24 credits for one spring semester, and getting billed $18,000!!!  UM leadership needs to realize they are not Harvard and tone it down a little.

review.author: David C.
review.description:
A hidden gem.

The University of Mobile stands in the shadows of the University of South Alabama only due to its size.  Springhill College is older.  But the University of Mobile (UM) is a world-class school and has achieved remarkable status in a relatively few number of "university years."
My son has attended the University and has benefitted in so many ways.  He is a music and business major and has received top-of-the-line training in both areas.  As an "All-Steinway" school, UM's dedication to having an ultra high quality music program is apparent.  Christian music legend Dr. Roger Breland is engaged and accessible to the students.
The campus is first-class, and the students are friendly.  My son has made a multitude of great friends. We have attended many different programs there from recitals to the annual "Christmas Spectacular".  If Branson, Missouri closed down, the faculty and students at UM have more than enough talent to do anything they do in Branson or Nashville.  Their new recording studio, 880 is one of the very best in the country.
Dr. Smith, the new president of the University seems focused on taking things to the next level and beyond.  He certainly has the credentials and skills, and I believe you will be hearing more and more about this amazing school in the years to come.

review.author: Renee B.
review.description: I absolutely love this facility! They truly go above and beyond! I am so thankful that we found them!

review.author: Brittney P.
review.description: I am happy with the care that my child receives. I like how everyone that works there is happy and clean. I like how the kitchen is separate from the class rooms. It's more like a actual "school" than a daycare. The kids have a great learning program and I feel like he son is so smart and he is only 2 1/2. The children are carefully looked after and are all loved. The only negative thing I have to say about this place is the nutrition program. They say that their food is nutritious but they feed then powerded sugar donuts for breakfast, coco puffs, and give snacks every day like crème pies, brownies and cookies. I mean sugar every now and then is on but feeding my child any type of sugar before they have teeth and every day is not right to me. We do not eat a lot of sugar but my kid is being fed it daily. I have complained multiple times but all they say is that "we don't have to give him any but he will be singled out". And I don't want him to feel like that, its torture for a kid. I even brought snack subsites like gram crackers for him but they keep forgetting about it. Im a little torn with this place because I love the people, the learning program, facility, and the care he receives. But for the price I pay once a week ($180.00) I feel like the nutrition program needs a makeover. There are other options out there besides donuts.

review.author: michael s.
review.description:
From first grade to fith, I attended Robertsdale El-Hi. My adoptive parents went here bacj in the 30's for goodness sake! And it's still there!
My memory us of getting into trouble and having to stand outside in the dark hallway..(the school had wood floors then) and freaking out upon hearing shoes clomping from the distance, fearing it was Virgil Buck, the principal at the time, coming toward me. He actually found me once and was very kind to me. Of course, I had his wife as a teacher in 2nd grade and she kept me in a 'special' desk close to hers so she could keep an eye on me. I actually thrived that year.
The place was so old they still had cloak rooms. I was put in there a lot by teachers. The whole place was OLD! I'm quite surprised I didn't find graffiti from my mom and dad's time!
But I loved the grassy hill outside that sprouted onion grass every spring and the old oaks and pecan trees. One of the old trees is still there but a shadow of its former might.
So glad certain landmarks are still around.

review.author: Brandt W.
review.description: We toured a lot of daycares when we moved to Auburn and knew we found the one when we walked into the Growing Room. It's not a daycare it's a learning center. We have two kids and our oldest is now in kindergarten and she is well a head of her classmates. The teachers are wonderful! I have never worried about my kids care when I drop them off; they run into school and are ready to learn.

review.author: Kim H.
review.description: I was impressed when I visited the center because they took the time to get to know my child as well as myself.  All the staff was very friendly and helpfull in answering my questions.  They have become like family to my child.  I do not worry about my child while in the care of these wonderful people.  My child is well feed with home cooked meals each day.  The children are taken outside each day weather permitting and this is something my child enjoys because he is a child that enjoys being outside.  \nThey are also teaching the children the academic skills they will need when they start kindergarten.  Doodlebugs also transports children to the Smiths Station schools so I will not have to find a new center next year when my son starts school.

name: Pye Bank C Of E Primary School

review.author: Jason B.
review.description: As a history buff, I was invited to a Czech 50h wedding anniversary at this location.  Apparently there are a lot of Czech's living in the area, Vasko and Kostelecky to name a few. \n\nAbout this place:  A group of the descendants of turn-of-the-century immigrants to Silverhill from the mid-European region known as Bohemia -- now part of western Czechoslovakia --  gathered this morning to re-open their cherished community hall that had been damaged by a tornado in March of 2011.

name: Sheffield College The Parson Cross College Sixth Form Colleges

review.author: Stephanie G.
review.description: The uni is very modern, and a lot of funds have gone into it to make it beautiful and easily accessible. The main campus is large and the lecture theatres are very clean. Was only here for an open day so far, but I got a feeling that the majority of people in and out were very happy to be there.

review.author: Qype User (Moosic…)
review.description:
I studied at Sheffield Hallam University (or SHU as it' referred to) between 1997 and 2001. I was based at the city campus and really enjoyed my time there.


 The addsetts centre (Library) is huge and had a full offering of every book you were likely to need on your course. As well as computers you could use to do your assignments and research.


 There are some lovely places to eat on campus and their instore blackwells bookstore is really well stocked too (could get busy at the start of each term).


 The lecture theatres were all good too.


 The university is often seen as the less stuffy of the two universities based in Sheffield.


 I enjoyed my student days there and would definitely recommend it to others.

review.author: Qype User (playla…)
review.description:
Sheffield Hallam University (or SHU as it refers to itself) was formed from the old Polytechnic University in Sheffield and covers a number of campuses.


 It likes to think of itself as the cheeky younger sibling of the high brow Sheffield University while offering good facilities for students.


 Some of the halls of residence have seen better days as have some of the tutorial rooms on the Ecclesall Road campus but there's plenty to get involved in for students and most people enjoy their time here.

review.author: Qype User (Bapend…)
review.description:
this university offered me a place, with a conditional offer, meaning i had to get the required points before i got accepted. i got the required points however i did not get in.


 but it is rated 76th in the university rankings.

review.author: Qype User (angeli…)
review.description:
i studied at SHU but i dont think its as good as people make out it is cos theyve been there and think they have to be loyal to the polace. i think SHU is very unorganised and do not tell you alot of stuff, so you dont know where you are untill last minute.


 but i cant critise there facilities as they do do decent food now and agn, they have a good sizewd libarary, but the people at the main reception in the CITY CAmpus are really rude.

review.author: Bethany S.
review.description: If you go to this college you will end up being sent home on the few days you are in! My course is full time but I am only in one full day and two half days. The health and social care department is shockingly bad! They have no organisation. Absolutely appalling.

review.author: Jamie S.
review.description: Usport is brilliant. The facilities are top draw, very cheap and well located. The football leagues and gym and squash courts are all things i use a lot and I just can't complain.

review.author: Qype User (nomis7…)
review.description:
To Sum Up: Friendly & Supportive Learning Enviroment


 The sheffield college is the main college network within sheffield with 5 sites throughout the city.


 The students are all friendly with and allways make you feelwelcome and the staff are some of the best in the college networks available in sheffield.


 The staff are all supportive and do as much as they can to support there students through there course no matter what difficulties they may be facing, the college also has specialised counsilors that students can go and speak to should they feel that they need to.


 The college offers a vast range of courses at different a range of different levels which means that there is something for everyone.

review.author: Qype User (Bapend…)
review.description:
back then when i went to this school, the first year was rubbish, however the made development of the bulidings. built one big one. and looked better. however all schools always has at least some rubbish teachers and strict. just like this one.


 also, some children causing mischeif to the neighbour hood around the area.

review.author: Aleeta P.
review.description:
It's a beautiful place to live.   The evergreen trees make it beautiful and green all year.  In the spring, the bounty of Azaleas all over the county sprinkle the landscape with vibrant colors.  

Summer/Fall temperatures can sometimes extend into November, so there is not a huge display of fall colors.  Plus, there are more evergreen trees than there are trees whose leaves change color.  

Public transportation is really bad, so a car is absolutely necessary to get around.  

There are a number of institutions of higher education.  Bishop State Community College has 3 campuses that offer different technical specialties.  

Mobile College has become the University of Mobile.  It is a private Baptist -affiliated institution.   

Spring Hill College is another private institution that is affiliated with Roman Catholics, while the University of South Alabama is a public, mostly teaching institution with a phenomenal Medical school, public hospital and level 1 trauma center.  

The State-of-the-Art Convention Center is on the waterfront and hosts all sorts of conferences.  The building was erected around the train tracks such a train goes through the building on a daily schedule.   

The historic (1927) Seanger Theatre in an historic section of downtown Mobile offers numerous live performances and even has a summer movie series.  

Mobile Bay Bears (minor league baseball) are a double A affiliate of the Anaheim Angels and the play their home games at Hank Aaron Stadium.  Hank Aaron, who broke Babe Ruth's  career home run record is from Mobile.  Other teams in existence are (were) the Mobile Bay Tarpons (indoor football), the Mobile Mysticks  (hockey:1995-2002), Mobile Revelers (basketball:2001-2001).  

Downtown Mobile also has the Alabama State Docks (Port of Mobile), which is in the top 12 largest shipping Ports (by tonnage) in the Nation. It is the only deep-water port in the state.  

While this is not all of the glorious offerings of Mobile, Al, you can see that it has many components of a nice place to visit or live.

review.author: Shelby T.
review.description: My daughter is 4 and has been at Weinackers since she was 12 weeks and I was going back to work. They made things so easy on me in the beginning and I knew my child was in good hands. We love this place so much I can't say enough good. When I compare her classrooms and education against traditional "daycare centers" there is no comparison. Weinackers wins every time!

review.author: Amy W.
review.description: My daughter is 6 & in "kindergarten" (by state standards), & this is her 2nd year at the Hillcrest Montessori. We ABSOLUTELY love this school. I would keep her here through college if I could! My very first impression was the incredibly sweet staff. I went in for an interview & was blown away at the organization & cleanliness of the whole school. There were tons of educational activities & "stations", very bright & colorful posters & materials on the walls, & even class pets! Everything was put in its place & the entire environment was just SO charming I never wanted to leave. My child is the "baby" & has a VERY willful temperament, but the teachers won us over almost instantly & proved to me that my daughter CAN be taught self-control and self-direction. Not only have they helped her develop important social & personal skills, but her learning there is astounding. I just found out this week that she is learning multiplication! At SIX years old! We all love her teacher(s), & I have VERY much enjoyed volunteering as much as I can with her class. The *only* problem I have had is that the tuition is very pricey, which I can't personally afford after this year. Breaks my heart!

review.author: Tina B.
review.description: Saraland City Schools all in all is a great school system to send your kids to, I wouldn't be the one to try and turn you in another direction. The school is nice, the eduacation is good, most of the teachers are very help, etc. The only thing I would have to complain about is how focused it is on sports. Mostly football but sports in general. So much time and focus goes in the sports that the arts are rarely given the support that it needs. I understand how good sports are for students but the arts are just as important for a student to be able to grow. Although the Arts are not as loved as they should be Saraland offers many arts to participate in and that I am extremely grateful for. The only thing I and any of the parents and students are asking for is more support and focus.

review.author: C Lyn M.
review.description: Saraland has great schools. All 3 schools have a very good programs for all ages. For children that have behavior issues to children that have very high IQ. The schools have a lot of things to involve parents in. If the parents want to be involved.

review.author: Monique P.
review.description: Saraland Elementary school was the best choice for our family. The community is very family oriented. We feel safe with the Saraland Police Department. My kids love this school system.

name: Moffett Road Baptist Child Development Center

review.author: C S.
review.description: Both of my children attended preschool through 8th grade here. Excellent education and caring, loving staff and administration. Both my children excelled in high school after a wonderful foundation was laid here. Great education and great Christian foundation on a beautiful and safe campus. Would highly recommend.

review.author: Bryan D.
review.description: So heres the thing the pre kindergarden teacher is just amazing she is always pre-pared arrives at school early each day and stays most days until the early evening. Your child would be blessed to attend her classroom. Speaking about this classroom it is very well decorated with many different learning centers.  \n\nI vote this school as the best if the best.

review.author: Alicia S.
review.description: This review is for the blessed beginnings preschool. We recently had a problem here at this school and did not receive the support that we had hoped for. The principal and Director of the school was not as concerned as I thought they should be. I really felt like they were trying to discredit my child. My child made an accusation and they did look into it, but when asked to do further research their response was "that would take a long time". Not the response you should hear when your child is making an accusation. No one ever called to see how she was doing during the process. I finally called them to let them know that we will be removing our child from the program. I am really hurt from this experience because we've been with the daycare since 2011. My oldest daughter went here and so did my son. I did not agree with how the situation was handled. I will not recommend this facility.

review.author: Heather B.
review.description:
We started this school when my daughter was 2 years old on the pre school.  We had such a great experience with it that we decided to keep her going to the school   during our time we started getting involved with the school and some church activities.  Kindergarten went well but I was always worried that my child was too young in the class and voiced my concerns only to be assured that she was fine. In kindergarten alone she had two different teachers in one year. Hoping next year would be a good year we decided to give it another chance. 
well two months into the year we find out that guess what again a change in teachers.
The teacher coming in had found her favorite kids. During this time my mother passed away and the families in the class offered to bring dinners we were thankful.  This is where I learned my lesson.  The head pastor pulled us a side and gifted to us several gift cards to store knowing we were witnessing hard times. We were grateful.  Thanked him and wrote letters to the person who donated them. 
A month away from the end of the school year his grandchild told my daughter that her daddy was a far loser because he had no job and another parent started talking smack about our family.  I received a call from hus daughter going off on me about Ho she expected more out of me being a Christian woman and how she could make our lives a living hell and get us kicked out. The when I complain to the principal she assured me that my child would be fine and that she would handle it and that she was leaving. She also told me to make sure to change schools for a better education. Sure enough the last day of school the teacher informed me that my child should be heald behind and also provide work. She told me this was work she with heald back since she didn't feel that my daughter was not at level.

Took us three weeks to get our refund.  We sent a letter to the head pastor informing him of our concerns and we receive a Letter throwing everything they did for us in our face calling us ungrateful.  Stated he was going to read the letter to the church and let everyone read it. 

I would never recommend this school to anyone who is not their religion.  They are not accepting or welcoming.

review.author: Serene A.
review.description: Wonderful and encouraging staff!! My son has been attending the center for six months and he looks forward to going each week!

review.author: Ling L.
review.description:
As a new mom, there were much guilt that accompanies the role. The biggest of all and a myth IMHO is that a child thrives best with the mother for its first five years. So it was with a lot of trepidation and questions when I toured childcare facilities around me. With so many by me, and upon the recommendation of neighbors who had lived in the area for a while, The Learning Tree has consistently been the lauded choice. 

The building was very unassuming, a low-lying ranch nestled between an auto parts place and a furniture store, off a busy street. Inside, while it lacked the fanciness and spaciousness of some facilities, it was clean. It smelled clean (and not in a chemical way), felt clean, looked clean, and continues to be so to this very day. I want my house to be this neat and clean! How do they do it??? 

I enrolled my child when he was 9 months old, and every day, I continue to marvel at the progress he has made under their care. I honestly can attest that I will not be able to prep him for all the development that he has undergone if he had stayed home with me, or a private caretaker, or an au pair.

The teachers and staff are warm, loving, firm, and highly knowledgeable. I have sought them out for advice on numerous occasions. from discipline to teaching/learning. They even helped potty-trained him before he turned 2! Every teacher knows all the children by name, even those whose classes he had not even attended. As I write this during the COVID shelter in place, I am tearing up at the thought that he would not be back with them as this is his last year there. He should be spending fun summers with them, growing even more robustly. I can only take comfort that when this COVID is over, we are still near enough to drop by to visit. 

Field trips and holiday activities are included in the experience. My son has met Mrs. Claus, the Easter Bunny, fire fighters, librarians. He's been apple picking, visited maple farms, fire stations, libraries, parks. He's had "cooking" lessons. 

What was enviable among my other parent friends in other suburbs is that my son got an additional enrichment by learning Spanish, which was an option when he turned 4. Plus, at the end of every school year, we received a folder of his progress. That was also unheard of with my friends' children at their daycare. 

I cannot recommend The Learning Tree enough. I could go on, but I highly suggest you give them a consideration.

review.author: Alisha W.
review.description: We love The Learning Tree-Elgin East, and they love our children. Children blossom when given the opportunity and that's exactly what our two children have done here. Dropping them off each morning I know that their days will be filled with adventure, learning, and plenty of love and guidance. The staff has become an extension of our family, asking about events and milestones along the way. Always eager to support our children, in whatever they do. \nAfter a horrible in-home experience, we transitioned our daughter to Learning Tree when she was about 18 months old. From that moment on, I never had to worry about who was caring for my children. Our son started at Learning Tree at age 10 weeks and has flourished. It has been amazing to watch them build such a strong bond with all of the staff here. Even the teachers outside of our children's classrooms know them by name and have built strong relationships. \nThis is a great place that strives to do what's best for children each day.

review.author: Reese H.
review.description: Took a class on Personal Protection in the Home. Scott Thompson was very knowledgeable and friendly. He spoke very well and his presentation was perfect. The facility was awesome. I will be taking another class from him soon. He is well worth repeating as an instructor.

review.author: Kim W.
review.description:
Scott Thompson is an outstanding instructor.  I've taken two training classes with Scott: Enhanced Basic Handgun, and Concealed Carry 1. Both classes were presented in an easy to learn hands on training format. I hope to take several more of his classes.  Great job!

The Conceal Carry 1 class on Saturday was a life changing experience. The materials and hands on training were presented in steps, which was very helpful.  Each skill set built on the one learned before it.  

I have a much better understanding of what it means to be a permitted concealed carrier, the responsibilities involved and the speed in which a "critical incident" can occur.  I learned you never have as much time as you think you do.

Highly recommend Gulf Firearms Instruction for all of your firearms safety training needs.

review.author: Erick C.
review.description: My wife and I took the Basic Handgun Safety Class. Bring a pen and your lunch because that's all you'll need for this class. Ten hours split between instruction and shooting.  Scott was fantastic in the classroom setting. He was very knowledgeable and kept my attention. Safety was a primary focus from the start. Our class was diverse consisting of both men and women and one child roughly 13 years of age. There are three instructors to help and guide while on the range. All three were personable and knowledgeable. I intend to take the concealed carry class as my schedule permits.

review.author: Tina B.
review.description: Saraland City Schools all in all is a great school system to send your kids to, I wouldn't be the one to try and turn you in another direction. The school is nice, the eduacation is good, most of the teachers are very help, etc. The only thing I would have to complain about is how focused it is on sports. Mostly football but sports in general. So much time and focus goes in the sports that the arts are rarely given the support that it needs. I understand how good sports are for students but the arts are just as important for a student to be able to grow. Although the Arts are not as loved as they should be Saraland offers many arts to participate in and that I am extremely grateful for. The only thing I and any of the parents and students are asking for is more support and focus.

review.author: C Lyn M.
review.description: Saraland has great schools. All 3 schools have a very good programs for all ages. For children that have behavior issues to children that have very high IQ. The schools have a lot of things to involve parents in. If the parents want to be involved.

review.author: Monique P.
review.description: Saraland Elementary school was the best choice for our family. The community is very family oriented. We feel safe with the Saraland Police Department. My kids love this school system.

review.author: Jess S.
review.description:
Market Campus was awesome. I was able to turn my passion into my career within less than 6 months of finishing the course (and that was my own fault it took so long!) I'm now working for a well known digital marketing agency and loving every minute of it.

While I'm not making bank just yet, I know I can get there in time. There was hardly any on the job training needed because Market Campus literally gave me all the tools I needed to be up and running on my first day.

Highly recommend if you're looking for a career change or just need to market your own website. Great instructors and fun applicable lessons!

review.author: Mark W.
review.description: The instructors are top-notch, the class is full of awesome content, and I'm 100% glad I decided to take this class. If you have any interest in learning about digital marketing in an easy to understand and fun way, this is the place to go. You won't regret it.

review.author: Jon H.
review.description: Market Campus provided me the most up to date knowledge of digital marketing. The instructors are extremely helpful and gave me confidence to launch a career in digital marketing.

review.author: John R.
review.description: While many, if not most, who take Market Campus are looking to gain skills in a new industry and start a new career, I wanted to improve my digital marketing skills for my own startup and other projects. Market Campus was a great introduction to all aspects of digital marketing: SEO, Paid Search, Social Media, Content, etc. It was incredible to learn skills and information and be able to apply it to my startup immediately and see improvements in real-time. Many aspects of digital marketing, and just marketing in general, had never crossed my mind as important or significant. Market Campus has set me up to be able to tackle any digital marketing problem that may arise within my own projects. The curriculum was well paced and the online delivery was easily digestible. My instructors were extremely knowledable and were industry professionals that eat and breathe digital marketing all day long. Overall, I was extremely satisfied with my experience at Market Campus, and would not only recommend it for those looking to get into digital marketing as a career, but also for anyone that needs or wants to learn the latest and greatest techniques in digital marketing for their own projects and businesses.

review.author: LaToya L.
review.description: AR Workshop Mobile is a true gem! It's a dream workshop for DIY'ers. I saw their ad on Instagram and couldn't wait to try them out. Beau and I decided to sign up because we were looking for different kind of date night. Signing up online was easy. You pick a date, project, design and when you show up to class all your materials are ready. Our instructor was patient and friendly. She showed us what to do step by step. Also, the decor is so artsy and cute. If you're looking for something new to do for date night or girls night out, try AR Workshop. We are already thinking of our next project and can't wait to visit again.

review.author: Juan L.
review.description: Are you tired of the same old date night that involves the typical dinner and a movie. Does going out with bae make you want to play sick just so you don't have to fake interest in something boring that will put you to sleep. Well have no fear because I have good news for you. AR Workshop Mobile gives you something fun to do while you sip on the drink of your choice. You can build mostly anything to your liking that will look great in your home. The instructors are cool and helpful. Check it out.

review.author: Shauna C.
review.description: So much fun! The workers were super helpful and informative and it was so nice being able to hang something on my wall at home that I made. My husband thought he for dragged in to do something girly and he ended up enjoying it almost more than me. We will definitely be back!!

review.author: Barcus P.
review.description:
I had 2 kids there from 2 years old to kindergarten at this location in the past and they loved it there. 

My kids thrived and were constantly learning new things. 

I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them to anyone.

review.author: Leslie K.
review.description: I have 2 kids attending since they were 3 months old, the eldest is now 4 and youngest is 16 months and I NEVER have to worry about the care and education they are receiving.  The teachers are compassionate and it's very clear they love what they do, as evident in how much both of my children love going to school.  I highly recommend Weinacker's Lake Forest if you are looking for a place to nurture your little ones.

review.author: Katie L.
review.description: This is an awesome school! Great atmosphere, great teachers and good location off of 98. My daughter loves it here!

review.author: Lori H.
review.description: My older child went through the entire program at Weinackers. I could not be happier with the education he received. He is currently testing 6 grades above level, which I largely credit to his Montessori education.  My younger son started in the toddler room with Ms. Emily. She is a very loving and caring teacher and it is obvious that she personally invests in all of the children in her care. Since moving up to the pre-school he has continued to grow.

review.author: Marilou J.
review.description:
My son has attended Merryhill since he was about 6-months old. He has been in the infant room and the toddler room. I especially loved the teachers in the infant room and I could tell that my son cared for them too! 

The Principal and staff are flexible with schedules and are always available to answer questions. I appreciate that the principal emails newsletters and important information to parents throughout the week! I am a working Mom and I rely on emailed communication since I am not the one that does the drop off  and pick up from the school. 

Merryhill offers nutritious meals and fun/educational activities for all age groups!

review.author: Jackie H.
review.description: DO NOT SEND YOUR KID HERE. My son fell on his head 3 days in one week. Last fall was while he was eating in his seat and fell forward with the eating chair. Immediately went to pick up my son and asked for footage of what had happened. Tami did not want to provide the footage, as she "couldn't leave the desk". She said we'd Need to make an appointment to view the footage. Which I immediately emailed her so that we can schedule. The only reason I was/ still am frustrated is because how does my son fall 3 times in one week? The last fall was while he was eating and strapped in, seriously!? To which they basically blamed him since he moved to fast. He was about 6-8 months. We go in to look at footage she basically gives us a run around and how the school is great and they really look after their kids- not. Brings in the teacher who let him fall, who did the same as well. The teacher who let him fall explained that she didn't want this to happen again and was going to watch them more closely... seriously? After about 45 minutes of listening to them do nothing. Tammi pretends to look up the footage and says "oh the cameras are not working, they must be under maintenance". She knew the cameras did not work, she knew what she was doing. How do you advertise that the kids are always closely monitored via cameras and when my son fell it seems to not work? She then followed with "the floors are not that hard to where they would get hurt". For anyone who has a kid there, they are definitely not the same floors as other daycares who don't neglect their kids. As I told tammi, the first time was an accident, second time was "what's going on" and the third is just neglect. She argued it was not. All I have to say is be glad you guys do not have a lawsuit on your hands. DO NOT SEND YOUR KIDS HERE. YOU WILL ONLY HEAR HORROR STORIES FROM HERE. TAMI IS AWFUL AND RUDE. No real apologies were made and all she asked for was payment, after I had put a stop payment on the tuition. To when I responded that tuition should be the least of her worries, she waived the fee and took the deposit as the fee. SERIOUSLY THIS SCHOOL IS AWFUL. NEGLECT ALL AROUND. I am still so upset about this, I trusted them with my baby because of all the false promises they promised. As I said, they are lucky they don't have a lawsuit on their hands.

review.author: Deja S.
review.description: This preschool is completely unprofessional and completely unethical. Please do not send your kids here. They do not have the proper training and will leave your children without proper care and unsupervised. The staff doesn't care about the safety of the students and only looks at them as paychecks. Definitely do not recommend.

review.author: Anyah Y.
review.description: This establishment is very unprofessional and above all doesn't follow covid guidelines. If you want your child to get sick, not prosperous be taken care of or anything in that nature, this is the school for you !

review.author: A J.
review.description: If your child is pre-k/4 go see Mrs. Bree. She's super sweet, funny, and has a passion for teaching the kids. It's more than just teaching, she nurtures them and truly loves them. Curriculum is great and helllllo you should see the classrooms bulletin boards and doors. So friggin cute.

review.author: Ava H.
review.description:
Let me begin by saying that we are grateful for  our son's time here. The School was always clean and the hours are so flexible. He was there 3 times a week for four years and they were always willing to accommodate us if we were in a pinch and needed an extra day of childcare. We were always met with kindness and the school is a fun and safe atmosphere. 

However, after leaving I learned a few hard truths. The school stresses academics and curriculum and I do not feel as though my son's educational outcomes reflect this. In fact when being assessed for Kindergarten it was realized that he was far behind and did not get in to the parochial school we had applied to. We then went to another school where one month in we noticed a huge change, and in 6 months he had caught up to the necessary benchmarks. 

Additionally, I do have to make a full disclaimer and say that in the spring before we changed schools he was diagnosed as autistic. This can explain the above issue but can also lead to the matter that yes although I am the parent and fully responsible for my child's well being, as a first time mother I put some reliance on my child's teachers to indicate to me if something was concerning. One day they had a child psychologist observing another child there and she caught it, in one afternoon. So my only advice to the school may be to consider investing in some training to identify and assist special needs children. 

Overall I would say we had mostly positive experience but wanted to share my thoughts/ concerns.

review.author: Anna R.
review.description: Today I tour the place let say first impression was not as expected . I work with children myself and know the importance of being welcomed into the facility. There were two ladies at the front desk one was busy on the phone and the other didn't acknowledge me and stared at the computer screen. I stood there and said " good morning "! Finally I got acknowledged. The receptionist who was in the phone began talking to me and was friendly.  Then Sara came and gave me a tour of the place . She was amazing ! Sara knows the information and answer my questions. I tour the place and it seem pretty good except the class where the four year olds . The teacher was busy cutting out letters which means her eyes were not on the children . The children were eating and this could have been a great time to learn about the foods they are eating and also interactions take place during meals .  As a teacher myself and parent I was not happy to see that . Also she was not welcoming at all the teacher slightly turn to see me and went back to cutting out letters and numbers she didn't get up and approach my daughter or me shake hands nothing unprofessional. I hope to tour again with my husband.  Friendliness and attitude can definitely be improved.

review.author: Nicole C.
review.description: Highway robbery! !! I  began looking for full-time daycare for baby while i was in the second trimester.  I knew i would be returning back to work by late April.  I can't just waiver on that i have to work and i know when my time is up. Merryhill told me there would be a spot in late April. I paid a deposit because the manager / director told me there was a spot. They even told me how i could bring my daughter by before hand to interact with the teacher and daughter. Only when i called to confirm my start date they told me there was no opening until July. They will not refund my money and didn't even offer an apology. I asked if they could transfer the deposit to my friend since i have to do something else now and they said no. If they are this bad before we walked in the door i don't want to know what they do in there anyhow.

review.author: Cassie V.
review.description: Started my son here when he was 6 weeks old. They were always so thorough with home reports. He continued at this daycare for almost 2 years and I was so sad when we had to leave. The one and only issue I have with this school is the price. It's so expensive. The teachers were great with my son, they require a code to get into building, they have pictures and names of parents allowed to pick up. They are very good with security. We do cloth and they were accommodating.

review.author: Ngaolia A.
review.description: We loved the availability that Merryhill offered for our work schedule. The teachers are excellent and compassionate. My son had a wonderful time in their intermediate preschool program. The staff and administrators are so helpful and our relationship with them felt professional and at the same time like family. I always worried about who I leave my kids with. But I never have to worry with Merryhill. We stopped attending because we moved out of this city, but we miss the community that we had become a part of.

review.author: Christine G.
review.description: I toured this school for my child and did not like what I saw so I decided on another school. The academics is what caught my attention but the school is very pricey , yet participates in the county program for free childcare for low income parents ( Resource & Referral) . There is too many students in the class for what I wanted for my son's first school experience to be (the student to teacher ratio was near the high limit). What I saw and did not like was teachers on their phones on Facebook while the kids lay awake on their cots ( they could have been patting the kid's backs and trying to help them get to sleep)...and the teacher helping a child to use the bathroom during snack and not having him wash his hands! That was gross and a no go for me!

review.author: Paul T.
review.description:
Still hadn't heard back regarding incidents that happened! 

Cameras should be put up all over-and not just to protect the front office either. Outside cameras and in-classroom cameras should be made visible to staff and parents. Camera footages should be kept at a minimum of one week in case there are things that don't get reported right away.
  It's hard to take their word for it when I have observed some caretakers being less than patient and pulling and nudging kids to the side to "be out of their way". Those staff know who the caretakers are! I know some parents may also have ideas too!
I also propose a guideline on kids who are too rough and who hit other kids often. If there are 3 strikes of biting or hurting other kids, please take them out. 
It's basically the same few people going around causing all this grief and trauma. I'll bet there are so many kids affected but it hasn't been shared well or I'll bet there is quite a number of victims (kids & parents) out there who are too traumatized to share their horrible experience.

review.author: Ana Z.
review.description: The pros of Merryhill preschool are the facilities. They have new and large classrooms and multiple playgrounds. However, I always felt that  teachers were overwhelmed with the number of students and the amount of work. My 18 month old was often nervous at the drop off and most of the time none of the teachers came to pick him up or calm him down. I just had to leave him crying till he eventually stops, and this happened time after time. It felt like teachers didn't really care and the director just wanted to increase enrollment to maximize profit.

review.author: Mischita H.
review.description:
What a combo! A Sports Art Gallery and University in one! The official name of the gallery is The American Sport Art Museum & Archives (ASAMA). The museum is reported to have the largest collection of sports in the world in this small building. The art work is great. The gallery is open Monday to Friday 9am to 4pm. Admission is free.

The school, United States Sports Academy, offers Bachelors, Masters and Ed.D degrees in Sport Science. 100% online, no out of state fees, and is accredited by SACS. There is an on campus book store where you can purchase the typical college gear i.e. t-shirts, hats, decals, etc.

The staff are very nice and helpful- providing info on the art, its history and the university. A cool place tho check out if you are in the area.

review.author: Dennis F.
Shannon E.
review.description: This school is amazing! They truly care about your child's education and well being. Every staff member from the Principal to the housekeeping staff is dedicated to helping your child be the best they can be. Truly an outstanding, innovative school with many activities and creative ideas to make your child excited about learning. I am so lucky that my daughter goes to this school, I have never encounted such an amazing staff in a school setting. I wish I could take this place with us when we move to Ca later this year.

review.author: Carolyn W.
review.description: The teachers at Kiddie Academy are awesome. They care for the children like they are their own. The kids are always busy with activities. The Directors are also fabulous. They can often be seen in the rooms interacting and caring for the kids. They are also always available for parents whether it be by phone or email. The app keeps parents informed of what their kids do during the day including eating, sleeping, etc. Several pictures a day are added to the app. Streamwood Kiddie Academy is a wonderful place!

review.author: Bay A.
review.description:
I think Kimberly the director and Jackie her assistant are not pleasant at all,  I felt really discriminated she kept pushing my child back since October than when the day came and she told me to bring her ready for school she told me my spot was booked and this was in December, and after that she told me to wait til February .......... 
that I was going to be put in a waiting list 

why??  Whyyyyyyy 

Tell me to bring my daughter ready than 
why???  Tell me her spot is booked! 
after I sent her my routine number, 
I feel that kiddie academy doesn't carry the name right with these two individuals, 
they should be more organize and responsible, she told me she emailed me and she never did, 
which was a lie, 
they need a new director and assistant . That know what they are doing.

review.author: Tracey P.
review.description: My daughter has been enrolled since she was 3 months old and we are so happy with all the care she has had at this daycare. The teachers are very kind and the director is very involved. Everyone knows my daughter's name at the school. We get detailed reports with pictures every day and the center does an excellent job making sure parents are always notified about any changes.\n\nWhen we drive by my daughter says "Mommy! That's my school!!!" and she is excited to be there every day. Picking a daycare is a tough decision for parents but I feel like we made the best choice picking Kiddie Academy

review.author: Deana B.
review.description:
This was one of the first daycare locations we toured and we were blown away with how clean the facility was, how nice and informative the director was and how nice the staff and the teachers were. Everyone I worked with was extremely easy to communicate with and they staff their rooms with a teacher and aide, not just with the minimim ratio. The location is well lit, the restrooms in the 2-4 year old rooms are centrally located so they can be seen from anywhere in the adjacent rooms. They provide great on site activities and crafts and they worked with my daughters delays with ease. They provide daily updates and photos and even let me watch the closed circuit TVs from the directors office during my daughter's first week. 

What initially got me in the door was a review stating that their child has a bad first day and the director held the child and rocked them until the child was calm and I will say, they did not disappoint. If we didn't move out of the area, my daughter would still be there. When we left, they made a book of memories that still brings happy memories and a tear to my eyes. 

If I had any complaint, it would be that they set the bar so high I still cannot find a daycare where I live now that doesn't completely pale in comparison to Kiddie Academy in Streamwood.

review.author: Julie P.
review.description:
We moved to the Elgin area 3 months ago and I couldn't be more happy of the programming my son receives.

Kiddie Academy is a very warm and friendly atmosphere. My son has had problems with transitions in the past and did not like going to school. His transitions have gotten so much better and now he asks to go to school!

The curriculum is aligned to have him Kindergarten ready. It amazes me since I see his progress in a daily bases with the daily Tadpole reports (pictures of him participating in all curriculum activities) and just in him.

His teachers Ms. Amy and Ms. Julie Ann are truly the reason why my son is flourishing in developmental milestones and academics. They nurture and care for him as he was their own child. I can't say enough of how my husband and I appreciate everything they do!

The center is very clean and inviting. The entire office staff are very knowledgeable about all their students that attend. They are very helpful and very inviting.  All the holiday parties that they put on our very thoughtful and organized. They are very family centered, which makes dropping off my son a lot easier.

As a parent we want the best for our children, and I truly feel that Kiddie Academy is truly the best for ALL children. I love this place and wish my son started earlier!!

review.author: George R.
review.description: I cannot express how happy my wife and I are with Kiddie Academy! Kiddie Academy staff are very friendly and rooms are very clean! My daughter is 19 mo and enjoys going .. Thank you

review.author: Clarissa R.
review.description:
My son isn't a cookie cutter kid by any means.  He has a little bit of a speech delay and he wasn't 100% potty trained when we brought him here.  He's also pretty introverted, but he is brilliant and he likes to work alone.  At first I liked the program and I appreciated getting pictures of him every day.  What I did not like were the teachers.  One teacher in particular just made a point to tell me how terrible my son was doing every single day.  I would get calls to pick him up for tantrums and throwing puzzle pieces and allegedly hitting other kids (to which HE told me he either got hit first, or he was defending his friend who was getting picked on by another kid).  Every single day I got a phone call about his behavior.  I felt like they absolutely didn't want to work with him at all, like they treated him like he was a burden, and that they just didn't want him there because he was a little different.  I've seen a few times when I would come to pick him up that he would either be crying, or he would start crying and the teachers would be standing in the corner talking, or wouldn't pay any attention to him.  Other kids would run up to him to console him, but not the teachers.

I now have him at another similar preschool and he's doing great.  Within 2 weeks they helped him get fully potty trained.  He doesn't wear diapers anymore and that's only after 2 weeks of being there.  He's also opened up A LOT as far as speech in the past few months after leaving KA.  They actually work with him at his new school.  I've had zero reports of him hitting, tantruming, causing problems, or anything bad in general.  They say he's a great kid, he's learning fast, and he gets along with EVERYONE, even the kids who are super introverted like he is.  They're very patient and very willing to work with your child, which is how a daycare/preschool that you pay as much as you would pay for rent/mortgage should be.

All in all I'm really disappointed with the extreme lack of understanding and ability to work with kids that are just a little different. He's been to two other daycares outside of this one and it's just in this one that he was demonized and portrayed as that problem trouble maker child.  At the other two daycares I haven't had any issues. I took him out because after getting so many phone calls I figured maybe he was having issues here and they would end up kicking him out for some reason anyways.  But taking him out was a great decision because since then he has blossomed so much.  My advice to anyone looking to go here is if your child is a little introverted, shy, speech delayed, to just look else where because they will not get the attention they need here, the teachers won't hesitate to call you over every single thing imaginable, and they won't hesitate to tell you how terrible your kid is doing each day.  There are other daycares in the area for the same price with the same curriculum that do a much better job and have way more patient teachers.

review.author: Arina F.
review.description: Our daughter attended this school for over a year before moving on to Kindergarten. We were very happy with the challenging, interesting curriculum that was diverse and happened inside as well as outside the classroom. We were impressed with how interested she was in her day there and the daily photos and comments as to what she was doing in each one and why really made a us feel connected. We felt the director always listened to any concerns and welcomed feedback. Would send our second child when the time came.

review.author: Carolina P.
review.description: We started our son at Kiddie Academy when he had just turned one. He had a hard time adjusting but all of the teachers were kind and very patient with him.      He got used to it and so did we. The facility is nice and clean and everyone is friendly and welcoming. All of the teachers our son had were wonderful. We really liked their curriculum too. We ended up taking our son out only because my parents could take care of him at our home otherwise he'd still be there. Thank you everyone.

review.author: Sandy B.
review.description:
My son has been going to Kiddie Academy since March `10.  
As any concerned parent, I did a lot of research and visited a ton of places.  By far this was the best place! As soon as I walked in I knew this was it.  The staff is super nice.  They keep the academy very clean at all times.  The teachers are well educated and really care about the kids.  

Here's an example:
On my son's first day we were greeted by the owner/director.  She was carrying another little boy who was also new to the academy.  You could see that he had been crying a lot for his mommy.  However, the director was very kind and consoling to the little boy.  She had been carrying him ever since his mommy had dropped him off.  This made me feel great!  I knew that if my son would start crying they would do their best to make him more comfortable.  
At the end of the day, the teacher told me she had rubbed my son's back to help him take a nap.  How awesome is that?!?!  My son loves his teacher very much and calls her his friend.  
I am very grateful to have found a place that gives me peace of mind.

review.author: Jennifer S.
review.description: Our daughter has been here for about 6 months and she is thriving! They have a great staff, warm and caring. Always smiling. Never looking frazzled or like they don't want to be there. For the cost you aren't nickel-and-dimed about your hours, it's just 6:30-6:30, and their menu is robust. Some other places we visited had basic food (cereal at least 3 breakfasts a week, for example) but here there is a huge variety of real and fresh foods. Love the app with pictures every day. They recommended showing her the pictures and talking about what she was doing at the beginning (she began daycare at 2) and it really helped her adjust. They will be honest with you if there are issues but they are respectful and helpful with progress and other reports, offering strategies to help the kids. The director knows every child's name and many will run up and hug her when they see her. That was a really good sign. Altogether a fantastic place!

review.author: Jocelyn M.
review.description: Absolutely love this place!! My son has been attending for almost 2 years now and I do not have anything bad to say about them. The staff is friendly, outgoing and caring. They take the time to get to know you and your family, and cater to your child's needs. They keep open communication with parents and will make you aware of any issues your child may be having and determine a possible solution to better their educational needs. Love this place!!!!

review.author: Amy T.
review.description: My son was there for two years, and my older children were there during summer break for two seasons.  It is an awesome school, very caring teachers, and staff.  My daughter is a type 1 diabetic, and I was very worried about finding her excellent summer care, but they did an amazing job handling her.  My other son is autistic, and again, just fabulous.  I cannot recommend Kiddie Academy more highly, and I have been at other daycares and have used nanny services.  It is also very very clean.  \n\nYour work day will be stress free with Kiddie Academy watching your children.

review.author: Tanya A.
review.description: We love Kiddie Academy!!  From the clean, open classrooms to the excellent educational program, to the wonderful teachers, I wouldn't take my kids anywhere else!!  Our son and daughter love their school!!  - The Andersons

review.author: Kayla L.
review.description:
I have completely different experience at kiddie. My son is 20months. I  stop often during the day to check on him.  I continuously found out that the teachers don't  help kids in the class during meal time.  He often come back in the afternoon eating anything he lays eyes on and shoveling food to his mouth at dinner time! So make sure you train your little one to be independent.  Also their daily report is not accurate at all.  I was observing outside the classroom several times, how much he ate during lunch, he had a few bites but the daily report says he ate most of them. Hey, I saw with my own eyes, that is NOT TRUE!
 The kids in his class constantly have running nose, no one picks their noses.  My son had dry blood on his lips one day, he seems to have dry blood inside his nostril as well, but surprisingly nobody knows what has happened to him. I understand it is normal to have dry nose, how come nobody saw it...not even the teachers in the class, who are with him for 10hrs??? Then One day I picked him up 2hrs after i dropped him off for a dr appt, he had poop and pee leaking through the diaper when we get to the dr. When i got the daily report I saw the record changing his diaper at 10:30 which is after i picked him up. How in the world did that happen?  Teachers are supposed to TAKE CARE of the kids, I dont see that either.  The teacher gave him 2oz milk and told me he drank all 8oz, one day they forgot to dump the milk in the container i brought. OMG  
I am moving him to another daycare. And since I dis-enrolled him, the teacher put away his bin in the closet and removed his name on the wall the next day,comparing this to the beginning, it took them a month to stick our family picture on the wall?!

It looks like all big happy family on the surface, but i now seriously doubt the reliability of the teachers and the accuracy of the daily report and suspect if my son has been taking care of during the day there in the past few months.  I suggest parents to do more research and check on your kids if you can during first few days or weeks. And watch the behavior changes of your kids.  My son gets scared when we mention daycare and he start getting very attached to the items we brought from home with him to daycare,which clearly shows clearly he is not enjoy a bit spending time there!  Do you want your kids become like that?

review.author: Abhi T.
review.description: This school is awesome. Even though there is a lot of discipline, it's for the better. The principal and the the vice principal help everybody be successful. I go to this school and I like how the teachers interact with the students. Even if I had the chance to go to another school I wouldn't go anywhere. I love this school and I hope you like it and go to it to.

review.author: Lauren O.
review.description: Have been sending our 1 year old here since he was 3 months old. Masuma fosters a very loving and fun environment for these little ones, treating them like her own. Every single week, our son learns something from going here. He absolutely loves her, and the other kids. When we drop him off, he gives her a huge smile and holds his arms out to her - never ever has he been upset when we've dropped him off to her - this is a HUGE relief for this full-time working mom. Just a heads up, she loves these kids like a grandma and feels bad when they don't all get to eat the same treats at lunch. So make sure to be clear with her on any foods you don't want your little one having just yet.

review.author: User E.
review.description:
Apparently Ms. Sheri Fato is not capable to perform her job well, the last two IEP meetings, she did not gave me a copy of the IEP meeting conferences, which that never happened before in 5 or 6 years at this district, until one of their students at SEHS made them to "work" & act. She said that she would send me a copy by mail, several months passed and I never received anything, until I emailed her letting her know that I had the right to have a copy, (apparently to this district we had no rights) well, I got a reply from other person saying that she would  mail me a copy, they did what they wanted to do and I got a copy by mail. 

I really wish I could say something positive but honestly I can't, I thought my kids were in great schools. We never had an issue or complaint about this district, until they decided to handle a very serious situation to their own way, (as the IEP) which is not acceptable, apparently the manic brat didn't only made them to perform a pathetic actuation but also made them sabotage the IEP, the disability you all suffer in your hearts cannot be cured too. Also I was not happy about something the social worker said. It was not professional and maybe if she makes a little reserch about the students disabilities, she might be able to learn that kids with disabilites have good days and bads as well, maybe she will have some empathy and watch her big mouth. maybe?  And the fact that my previous review was reported and deleted that doesn't mean I have changed my mind about these two, you all can say no to your leader and respect your work ethics but seems like most of you just follow orders from your leader, and that shows nothing but how unprofessional, heartless & cold blood you all can be and worst part is that they perfectly know that and they don't care, they only have empathy for their job position. 

If this district could respect the code of conduct policy it would be so much easier but apparently they choose who to apply the code of conduct and to who not, also I'd say officers are assigned to schools for a reason, let them DO their job.

name: Streamwood Montessori School and Child Care Center

review.author: Jesse S.
review.description: Our two girls go here, and we love it.  Our older daughter has already learned some kindergarten material, and she is only 3.  The teachers are very engaging, and it is very well run.  We have been very impressed with the open communication, and with the care that our girls have received.  Our girls will continue to go there until they leave to begin kindergarten.  Definitely recommend!

review.author: Todd M.
review.description: Both of our children have been attending Streamwood Montessori for a little over a year. We switched from a well-known corporate daycare for numerous reasons. Enrolling them with Teresa and Streamwood Montessori is one of the best decisions we've made. Teresa is wonderful and has a staff that truly cares and builds relationships with our children. We have seen them develop exponentially, and in ways that our previous daycare provider could not accomplish. I would recommend Streamwood Montessori to any parent.

review.author: Joy L.
review.description: Though we did not choose this center due to location, we were very impressed with the facility. The director was wonderful. She was very patient and took the time to answer all our questions. The center was very clean as well.

review.author: Big W.
review.description: I've be extremely impressed with the education my children are receiving at Streamwood Montessori. The staff is awesome and professional. I can not say enough great things about Streamwood Montessori. I highly recommend Streamwood Montessori to any parents look to start their children off on the right track.

review.author: Kaisa D.
review.description: When searching for a new school for my 2 year old, I was SO nervous and worried and had anxiety for weeks. How do you pick one? When your child is away from you longer than you get to see them at home, it's extremely important you place your trust into the caregivers helping raise your child. The minute I stepped into the school, I was welcomed. Every teacher we have had there is beyond qualified to do their job. They love on our babies like they were their own. My then 2 year old is now 6 and in the lower elementary program there, thriving. She was reading so early on and flying through workpapers and "work" like you wouldn't believe. We have since had a second child who started at the school when she was 3 months old. With every bump we ran into with breastfeeding a baby and her not taking a bottle, the school and staff worked with me and educated the rest of the staff on what we all learned. For example, breastfed babies have more runny BM diapers than a baby with formula. After discussing this with the staff and director, they had required all staff to read up on the different types of BM's and sign off that they understood. I was so moved that they took my advice and information so seriously and made sure that training was provided. They are always there to answer a call or email or text and I feel SO comfortable leaving my children there every day. I really love the education my children receive there from all the amazing teachers. They also have an outstanding summer program where they incorporate so many fun activities and events all while they continue to learn and grow.  This really is a great school :)

review.author: Betty C.
review.description: After several visits to many child care centers in the area, we could not have made a better choice.  Like many parents facing the need of finding care for their child in order to return to work, we went back and forth over many options.  Streamwood Montessori has been amazingly patient and emotionally supportive to me and my transition of going back to work after being able to stay home for 11 months with my daughter.  She loves it, and it makes me happy to see her smiling every time I pick her up.  I love the teachers there and you can really tell they are genuinely caring for your child.   After our first week there, I can honestly say that these women are truly my angels.  Thank you so much!

review.author: Augustine O.
review.description: My kids enjoyed the time they spent in the school and always couldn't wait to leave for school in the morning. The teachers were nice and friendly with individualized learning. The best part for my kids was the summer camps. Safe neighborhood, secured complex, nice playground, and warm food. Above all, the school opens to 6 PM for busy parents.

review.author: Shelby T.
review.description: My daughter is 4 and has been at Weinackers since she was 12 weeks and I was going back to work. They made things so easy on me in the beginning and I knew my child was in good hands. We love this place so much I can't say enough good. When I compare her classrooms and education against traditional "daycare centers" there is no comparison. Weinackers wins every time!

review.author: Amy W.
review.description: My daughter is 6 & in "kindergarten" (by state standards), & this is her 2nd year at the Hillcrest Montessori. We ABSOLUTELY love this school. I would keep her here through college if I could! My very first impression was the incredibly sweet staff. I went in for an interview & was blown away at the organization & cleanliness of the whole school. There were tons of educational activities & "stations", very bright & colorful posters & materials on the walls, & even class pets! Everything was put in its place & the entire environment was just SO charming I never wanted to leave. My child is the "baby" & has a VERY willful temperament, but the teachers won us over almost instantly & proved to me that my daughter CAN be taught self-control and self-direction. Not only have they helped her develop important social & personal skills, but her learning there is astounding. I just found out this week that she is learning multiplication! At SIX years old! We all love her teacher(s), & I have VERY much enjoyed volunteering as much as I can with her class. The *only* problem I have had is that the tuition is very pricey, which I can't personally afford after this year. Breaks my heart!

review.author: Arasele S.
review.description: This place deserves a 5 star for sure, my daughter is currently enrolled and she loves it, the staff is amazing and truly caring. Would definitely recommend this school!

review.author: Erika Q.
review.description: My 4 year old has been attending Snell's since August 2021 and we couldn't be more pleased. The building is charming and well cared for with lots of visual interest and home comforts for the kiddos such as a tiny bathroom that is easy for them to use, an indoor play house, etc. They have a covered back patio area for days where they want to be outside but under cover from sun or rain and a gorgeous outside playground with lots of places to play with friends. They have a little pool (with safety gate and all precautions in place) and small area with a garden. There is a groundskeeper that lives on site and keeps things tidy and maintained. Lots of security cameras and alarm systems in place. They use the Procare app for payments, communications and daily check ins/outs. They also use the app to share videos and pictures of what your little one is doing throughout the day. For Covid protocols, they take your little ones temperature when they enter and immediately have them put their things away and wash their hands at the little kids sink. They communicate any changes in protocol quickly and effectively through the app or in person as needed. All employees wear masks and encourage/assist the children with wearing theirs as appropriate and follow local and state mandates to the best of my knowledge. My son loves his little class and teachers, he is always excited to go to Snell's and they do sweet things for holidays like special parties and safe treats for them. I really love this place, they provide consistent care and seem to truly enjoy the kiddos. I'm a pretty anxious mom and Snell's makes me feel really good about leaving my son to play everyday. Thanks Snells!

review.author: Lindsey H.
review.description: Snell's is amazing. The teachers are all wonderful and very attentive.  My daughter went here for Pre-k and she enjoyed going to school every day. I cannot say enough good things about Snell's!!

review.author: Angela P.
review.description: Snell's Pre-Kindergarten has been the best experience for my 2 children! Both my son and daughter have grown tremendously under the guidance of the caring staff and teachers. Both kiddos loved all the learning that took place through song, hands on exploring, movement and more. I watched my quiet son come out of his shell and become the loving, caring, and now outgoing boy that he is today! My daughter comes home daily singing songs and talking about all that she has learned. It truly is a blessing to have your child's first school experience be so amazing!

review.author: Andrea M.
review.description:
I can not say enough good things about the staff at Snell's! This place is a blessing to my family. Our son was fortunate enough to have not had to go to daycare and when it came time for preschool I worried about what I would find.

Mrs. Margret put our mind at ease from our very first visit to Snell's for a tour. The way they care about children and their education is apparent.

I could never have trusted any one besides family with my child until he came to Snell's!
