Mike and John (and all the other instructors) do a great job of breaking down the material in a way that makes it easy to comprehend.  They can do that because they have lived the life!  Instructors are always ready to answer questions and clarify as deep as you need!  I walked away feeling like an EMT and passed my NREMT on the first try, no way would I have been able to accomplish that with a lesser school!  Highly recommended for everyone thinking about joining the first responder life! And, if you're lucky you'll get invited to a pot luck put on by the CNAs downstairs!

review.author: Larry H.
review.description: I just completed the EKG Technician program and the National EKG Technician Exam....The class was excellent, and the instructor was amazing...she helps her students every step of the way right up to the National Exam.  I've worked as an EMT and medical corpsman in the Air Force, and found this to be a really informative learning experience.  Looking forward to getting out in the world and running EKG's!\n\nThe best school and staff ever!

review.author: Deashia S.
review.description: I love this school and all that it offers. They get you prepared for everything you need to know plus more and they're always there if you need extra help. I completed the CNA program and the new EMT program. The teachers are great and Edwin and Erica are the best!

review.author: Alexandra C.
review.description: I came to this school by referencees from my co workers..and boy am i glad i did! \nBradford is amazing! Its a small private family operated school that is so professional but has a comfortable feel at the same time. My instructors Melva and Erica were amazing. Im glad i chose this school to do my CNA course..the class was small and very one on one. Our instructors were stricked but very thorough. They want to make sure we know what we're doing in the field. They are a very understanding and comforting.if your looking for a CNA school go here!!!!

review.author: Phanet L.
review.description:
I didn't know where or how to begin my life in the medical field, I was browsing online and found out about Bradford career college and it completely changed my whole perspective within the nursing careers. 

The program was short but long enough to be able to grasp the concept of what CNA's actually does. The classroom lectures provide information to mentally prepare you for the states written test whereas the clinicals helps you prepare for the hands on portion of the state testing. I am proud to say that I graduated out of Bradford career college and was able to find a job within just after two weeks of passing my state testings. 

I am currently a CNA and is now enrolled in the LVN program hopefully to pursue towards the RN program after. I know I wouldn't be able to come this far without Bradford and the staff to motivate me. There's so many positive things I can say about this particular program and the instructors here, but you'll just have to come see it for yourself. If you want to start your life in the medical field, I suggest you look into Bradford career college.

review.author: Kaycee R.
review.description: This is a great school. I found it online when I searched for classes in my area. The tuition is affordable compared to schools around the area. They will teach you everything you need to know and more to pass the test and even be ready for employment. If you are serious about learning their instructor is for you! \n\nI passed my arc test the first time and felt totally prepared. I met a lot of awesome people that have a compassion for caring. I highly recommend this school if you are in Stockton or surrounding areas and are looking for a solid CNA program. Such a great experience!

review.author: J M.
review.description:
I had a very good experience with Bradford. First, I should say I was very cautious about choosing a program given the fact that some institutions may not be accredited or may not have a level training that could get me into the medical field (at least at the level I wanted). I had a close friend go through the Bradford CNA course and she quickly got into a CNA position and she was happy with who she worked for. It was this and the overall course schedule that showed me it was a cost-effective way to get into the medical field. From the training and getting a job, I've been able to gain some solid footing in the field and I'm considering some other options in nursing after I get more experience. As for my training and the outcome from my certification, the following are some main points on my experiences at Bradford and subsequent career opportunities. 

1) TEACHING. The course was taught primarily by a main instructor, but they had other instructors go through other methods and hands-on training. This is a course to be taken seriously. The teaching philosophy is not one-way, it's more interactive where the instructor tries to draw answers from the students (not entirely Socratic, but along those lines). The instructors have a teaching and working knowledge of the field, so I got the textbook and real life/hands on experiences from the course. 

2) TRAINING. When I went through the skills learning and training, there was quite a lot of material. There's a lot of opportunity to work on these within the course but it didn't hurt to practice at home as well. What I did find from the center is that I learned all the skills, and did so at a level that when I was applying and interviewing for jobs, I was able to show the potential employer my skills. This seems obvious, but it can be very difficult when you're in an interview situation.   

Also, I found the required training in real facilities as really helpful in applying the new skills. It's all really well-planned to use what you learned in the formal training and then almost immediately applying it in your internship time. 
 
3) INTERACTION WITH/AMONG STUDENTS. I had a wonderful time making new friends and feeling like a team with my classmates. We had a feeling somewhat like 'we're in this together' and we helped each other to prepare for tests and the final certification test. My friendships and connections were one of the unanticipated 'benefits' in the training with my peers. 

4) PREPARATION FOR STATE CERTIFICATION EXAM (at the Red Cross). Within my class 100% of the students passed the state exam, which says something about the level of training and preparation I/we received at Bradford.  Bradford staff provided support that greatly helped in preparing for the exam. I'm not sure if this is an official policy but it certainly showed the people of Bradford really cared for the success of its students. Additionally, I and others received information from the instructors that helped us connect with potential job opportunities, and they provided very good advice on this as well as other career path options after the CNA. There are quite a few opportunities out there and the Bradford staff helped in guiding me to the right employer. So, overall, there's the training and education, but also some good support and guidance from their staff.  

IN-SUM
I don't really have anything to say that is negative or in need of significant improvement about the program. I have to confess, I really liked the staff and I want them to continue in their work because their program helped me. To me I made a conscious effort to look at all of the programs I was interested in, with the main factors being 1) will this training provide me with a path to get into aspects of nursing and human care, and 2) is this worth my investment of time and money? I was really conscious of picking a program that was credible in the industry, and that I wouldn't just be paying for a certification that has no path to a job/career. After a month out of the course most if not all of the students I knew found jobs, so I feel the price and near assurance of a job in the field is a pretty good deal.

review.author: Alexzandra R.
review.description: I found this place messing around on Craigslist and it changed me life! I am a mother of two and don't have a lot of free time but this class was fantastic. I was extremely worried taking my ARC test but if anything they over prepared my for it and I passed on my first chance. I am now employed and I only started this journey in March. The environment is great as long as you are respectful and care about your future. If you want to make that first step to change your future do it here. When people ask me about being a cna and what I did to become one (it has happened a lot in the past few weeks) I always give the credit to the amazing staff at Bradford! Thank you Erika Edwin and Mrs. Milva because of your support I am now on the beginning of my journey into the health care industry!

review.author: Morgan G.
review.description: I have never left a review on Yelp, but I feel the need to leave one for this awesome school! If you're looking for a CNA program I highly recommend Bradford! They prepare you for everything you need to know for the ARC test, as well as being a good CNA. Just take it seriously, ask questions, be diligent, and practice. It's mostly common sense. \nIt is family-run, but that's what I really liked about the facility. Milva, Erica, and Edwin are awesome and go out of their way to help you with whatever you need. Thank you so much for a great experience!

review.author: Rebekah O.
review.description: Let me start off by saying from the moment i walked into this school i felt comfortable in their abilities to help teach me and prepare me to pass the state certification test. The administrator Edwin is so friendly and helpfull he answered all my questions and helped me understand how the course works. Mrs Melva is very strict and old school teacher. This also means that she is very good at what she does. Sometimes she teaches even more then what you need to know for ARC. Dont let that overwhelm you just soak it all in. Also if you plan on continuing on and oursue a nursing degree alot of the way melva teaches sill help you prepare for that... I graduated in february and passed my Arc the first time in march... I am already working as a cna and so many of the extra things that melva taught us are things that i use everyday. I am glad i chose this school and you should too.

review.author: Mary C.
review.description: Took the end of the year course and I absolutely loved it. The 6 weeks goes by so quick and I felt like I learned a lot and more. Milva is a wonderful teacher and though our lectures can be long, she is thorough and makes sure we're learning every detail necessary to pass our test, but also to succeed in the real world. Edwin and Erica also run the program amazingly, are great at communicating what exactly is going on like if we're not having class a certain day or if we're starting late. Erica is also awesome at helping teaching skills. She's so relaxed and teaches you in a way where you don't feel pressured, but remember exactly what you need to be doing. She also is super positive and helpful and willing to help you practice as many times as needed until you're comfortable with a skill. Would totally recommended them to any person desiring to take the first step into the medical field! (:

review.author: Griselda P.
review.description: Bradford is honestly the best CNA school around!!! They truly make you feel like family and are always there for you even after you graduate. My ultimate goal is to become an RN but I know that I had to have a stepping stone to start off my career I called multiple CNA schools around Stockton and half of them I couldn't understand over the phone!!!! That made me think how I was going to understand them in school, if I couldn't understand them over the phone??? It made me nervous!!! I called Bradford and Edwin, the Administrator was very polite and answered every question I had! (And I actually understood him) I asked a million questions! Like....when the program started, what times were the classes, if they were flexible on payments, how much the program cost, and if they had home health aide classes to offer. (THEY DO) Keep in mind that I  had called around and none of the other schools would give me this information over the phone for whatever reason, not only did he answer all my questions but my fiance's as well. My fiance and I are very critical about schools as I have had trouble getting into an LVN School because of the attitude of the staff this was no where near anything like that! Edwin was very informative, encouraging, and super supportive! My fiance was blown away by him the first time that they spoke in person! That's very hard to do as my fiance is also a manager of an assisted living, and has dealt with many kinds people. He liked Edwin very much and we were sold! I gave my deposit and started school within 2 weeks. I didn't know what to expect as I was nervous and it was my first time back in school after so many years. Make sure to bring lots of binder paper, a pencil or pen, and be on time!!! As you will be taking A LOT of notes during theory!! To be honest at first I was kind of scared of Milva (she's our teacher, Edwins Mom, and an RN). She seemed very  strict and super sassy, within the next 2 days that went away! She's absolutely great , funny, she made the class go by super fast and always had the answers to our questions. Please pay attention in class!!! Study your notes and you'll pass your chapter test no problem!!  Thank you Milva for everything! Because of your teachings I felt 100% confident while taking my ARC written exam! I Passed!!! Woo hoo!! NOW FOR SKILLS!!! (scary I know) You do Clinicals of course!! Almost every weekend of the program! (Sorry no going out anymore because you'll be tired) besides clinicals you do skills at school as well and that's when we met Erica! (Edwins Wife) She's just lovely! She is so calm, down to earth, and will help you with everything you need as well! She became our instant friend! She helped us so much and would always ask us to tell her if we needed her to repeat a certain skill. She's awesome! Thank you Erica for your expertise it helped me during my skill part of my ARC and I passed!!! Overall my experience has been nothing but great with them and I appreciate everyone there!!! I'm currently attending their HHA class (:

review.author: Jos I.
review.description: I went to Bradford Career Center for my CNA training. The training was 6 weeks and it was a great experience. The staff was very helpful with anything that I needed. They prepare you for the ARC test as well. Bradford has rooms where you can go over CNA skills so you can be prepared to become a CNA. The training is affordable as well. They have payment plans that meet your expectations. I highly recommend Bradford for anyone who is looking to be a CNA.

review.author: Jazz S.
review.description: Bradford Career Center is a wonderful institution. I highly recommend them to anyone looking to get started in the nursing field. They have a great six week program for CNA's. The instructor genuinely wants to see you succeed and is very willing to give you any extra help you need. It's a small investment to see if you even want to get started in the nursing field/if nursing is for you(provided that is your long term goal). It felt like a very homely environment and I loved attending classes here. They even brought us treats during class a couple times!(popscicles on a hot day are more than welcomed)Truth be told the six weeks flew by way to soon and I already miss it all. Their doors are still always open to us in any way that they can help us in the future, whether it's guidance or recommendation letters.

review.author: Mark A.
review.description: This is the first time I've ever taken this kind of course. The staff have been easy to work with and very friendly. The course is very informative and I feel it has done an excellent job to prepare the students for the state test. I just finished the course and now I am licensed. I would recommend this school to anyone looking to be certified. I had other options of where to go, but I am happy that I chose Bradford.

review.author: Kara M.
review.description: I am so thankful I found Bradford Career Center!  I am currently taking my prerequisites for nursing school, but decided that I wanted to get my CNA certification in order to get a bit of hands on experience while I'm finishing my studies.  Milva, Erica and Edwin were all fantastic.  Milva is strict, yes, but she makes sure you know your stuff.  She has a sense of humor that comes out as she gets to know the class, which I enjoyed.  Edwin and Erica were very friendly and helpful in answering questions about the whole process.  They both go above and beyond and take a personal interest in each of the students.  Erica was very helpful with practicing skills in class.  It sounds a bit corny, but at the end of the 6 weeks we felt like family.  At the end of the course I felt confident going into both the written and practical exams.  About a week after I received my certification, I was offered a position as a CNA in a local nursing facility, and I am excited to be beginning my journey into the healthcare field.  After I eventually get my RN license, I will for sure be contacting them about their new RN-BSN program.

review.author: Nina N.
review.description: Caring Administrator and Professors. It's a great school. I recommend it to anyone who's interested. I like Professor Milva her jokes and stories makes my day all the time. Classes are never boring. Edwin and Erika are very good people. They really care about you

review.author: Jean A.
review.description: This school is a big mess of disorganization and confusion at its best: $1,100 for 6 weeks of CNA courses. The teacher though genuine about her feeling towards the elderly is definitely too old to keep up with the class demanding curriculum. She left us hanging in the course for a whole week and went on vacation. The teachings, equipment and exam system are outdated, limited and definitely do not stand the challenge of the course. The class is taught only through videos that do not even match the American Red Cross requirements. So, you watch something on video and  is expected to practice in a totally different way. The teacher is overwhelmed trying to teach the class and if you are left behind well too bad for you. 4 weeks in the program we still have not finished the curriculum and have practiced only 8 skills out of 25 ARC skills. Our clinical practice is non existent up to now and the RN has already  signed off our CDPH 283B for the requirement of the 150hrs of training. What a scam!\n\nBesides, this place is family run. Sometimes I feel I am in a daycare since the son and his wife always bring their 2years old daughter to the school. If you are attending this school be ready to deal with a constant screaming child, disruption from the administration since they are trying to get their jobs done over the learning of the students, out dated information, overcrowded class, every element needed to fail the state test.

review.author: Maria M.
review.description: Great school and experience. Love the fact that they make it possible to work with your life schedule. Great teacher!!

review.author: Tracy Marie B.
review.description:
So far so good. My little guy started kinder here and seems happy with it. 

The school is a cute little community with only 116 kids total this yr. Which means plenty of individual attention for students. 

Gina in the office is so sweet and helpful. I joined the PTA and all the parents are really nice and supportive.

review.author: Lady L.
review.description: My daughter received a grant to attend this school. What I thought would be a great opportunity for my daughter, turned out to be a nightmare. If you are a minority, specifically a Black person, you and your child would not be treated like other races. Their rules are broken for "non-Blacks" but a Black person is expected to follow them at all times. You and your child would be made to feel uncomfortable and bringing the issue to the staff only makes you feel more ostracized. I have been strongly considering sending my daughter back to public school. They claim to be more advanced in their studies than a public school, but my daughter is reading a book that she read in Public School three years ago. I am so disappointed in myself for choosing this school. The way that I feel treated by them is not against the law, but I do feel that it is a moral issue. Is this really the Catholic faith?

review.author: Ora Pro Nobis E.
review.description:
This school is absolutely wonderful! The school has a new principal who is clearly committed to fostering an environment of exceptional academic quality and a commitment to teaching kids about their beautiful Catholic faith. 

Now, I dont know if this is just because it is a Catholic school or what, but it is sooo CLEAR that the teachers INVEST themselves into the children there. I'd be willing to bet the public school children do not receive the same amount of attention and love and understanding and CARE that this school gives to it's children- regardless of whether or not they are Catholic, or if they are a child with "Special needs" or whatever. This school loves it's children, it is so clear. 

This school is absolutely on the up and up - you can see it in their rapidly growing enrollement numbers.

review.author: Anne P.
review.description:
After visiting other private schools as well as the public school in our area when our oldest was about to enter Kindergarten, we knew St. John the Evangelist School was the right fit for our family.

SJE is committed to academic excellence steeped in Catholic tradition. They provide a safe, supportive environment and promote healthy social relationships. The students are taught to respect others and take responsibility for their actions in addition to the school's demanding and curriculum. 

I am shocked that a previous reviewer said that the staff isn't willing to work with children with special needs. I have heard the complete opposite... 

I know my kids will reach their highest academic potential at SJE. Coupled with an emphasis on Catholic values - I say that is a recipe for personal success.

review.author: Brian C.
review.description:
This school year (2013), we have two children enrolled in St John the Evangelist.  One is in first grade and the other is in kindergarten.  There were a few major factors that played a role in our decision to choose St John the Evangelist:

   1) Class size:  Last year, our son's kindergarten class was the first year they split into two classes instead of a single class and it helped in making class sizes that were already comparatively small, even smaller.  The amount of attention each individual student receives is incredible!

    2) The Principal was a delight in our interview process and has been an administrator and teacher in Catholic Schools for quite some time.  She personally gave us a tour of the school, invited us to sit in classrooms to examine teaching styles (we visited multiple grades, not just the kindergarten).
She is determined to get the best out of her staff and our children each day.  She is extremely approachable and available to us, as parents, with any questions we have.

    3) Our family's Catholic faith was a big reason in choosing to educate our children through SJE.  It is truly inspiring to see our children grow in mind, body, and spirit simultaneously.  We are truly grateful that our Catholic Tradition is integrated in their educational upbringing. 

One of the many success stories that we have with our son from last school year is that he was already reading beginner books by himself after just a couple of months of Kindergarten.  I couldn't believe my ears when he started reading to me; it concreted our decision even further.

Now that we are armed with our own experiences of St John the Evangelist, we wouldn't hesitate doing this all over again.  We highly recommend anyone considering a private education in the area to put SJE on their short list of institutions for consideration.   It is a blessing to know our children are getting the best of what the teachers and administrators have to offer every day.

review.author: Beth W.
review.description: We are so happy that we found St. John for our 3 daughters. They are getting an amazing education in a safe, caring environment. The school has created a wonderful community, strong in faith and community service! We love all the extra things they offer to enhance their learning experience such as Grandparent's Day, Daddy Daughter Dance, weekly all-school masses, Candy Bar Bingo, Skating Parties, etc. It's a wonderful place for our children to grow up. We are so happy with our decision and are grateful to the caring staff who go above and beyond for our daughters' needs!

review.author: Guest M.
review.description: All fine except there is no air conditioning in many classrooms and no playground. Children run around  a parking lot for recess. I hope they get everything for the 5 stars.

review.author: Crystal H.
review.description:
If you have a special needs child in any sense, this is not the school for you. 

The school's staff is not equipped or willing to work with children with Dyslexia, ADHD, Sensory Processing or other neurological disorders like these. They prefer to label them as "bad" children and exclude them from class activities. Even when professionals are brought in from the outside to work with the teachers to show them how to work with children with these needs, no changes are made on the teachers part and the children are made to feel "bad", "stupid", and sent home.

I would never subject another child to the way this school operates and mistreats children that do not fit into their mold of what is normal

review.author: Jeff F.
review.description: We love ST.  JOHN'S.   Our daughter  is happy there and is learning a lot  from  her teachers.   Would highly  recommend  ST JOHN'S.

name: Community Action Commission of Santa Barbara

review.author: Aimee A.
review.description:
Excellent selection of fabric and a very knowledgeable staff. They are nice and helpful and will help you find just what you need.

This hometown shop is also quirky and fun. I enjoy going around the store just looking at the vintage items and the BEAUTIFUL quilts. They offer classes/workshops for children and adults. 

I always have s hard time leaving as I enjoy it there so much.

review.author: Ross B.
review.description: Best fabric, notions, quilting store!!!  I used to have to drive up from Santa Barbara to get supplies. Now I live across the street. Expert advice too for your projects!!'

review.author: Peggy D.
review.description: This place will get your creative juices going. I love all the craft kits. The selection of fabrics will keep you browsing for a long time. Very worth the trip.

review.author: Emily S.
review.description: There is no wonder why this is one of the most highly rated fabric stores on yelp in the area! This feels like a fabric store for rock stars. The employees are super cool and friendly. The restrictions for covid are superb. The ladies were super kind, helpful, and sweet. Their options are stunning. A definite must stop if you need fabric!!

review.author: Debbie N.
review.description: Love this shop. I don't get there often but find that they are very speedy shipping orders. Ordered elastic this morning and it's already in the mail. Yeah!

review.author: Carlin K.
review.description:
The two people working, who were apparently the parents of the owner, were very rude. They were helping out while the daughter was out of the shop. They helped me find what I needed, but I watched them be very rude and unhelpful to a woman coming in needing help finding sewing supplies for her daughter. They turned her away saying that they were too busy to help her and that they had too many events coming to assist her later in the day or at all. She left upset and then they talked about her after she left. 

They were also rude to my mother who was trying to care for my son while I looked at fabric. If you plan on going there, do not bring your children, as they are absolutely not welcome there. 

I will never go back to creation station and will not refer anyone I know to go there either.

review.author: Deborah P.
review.description: I cannot say enough about this sweet shop. It is a perfect combination of contrasts; modern fabric, projects, and supplies mixed with vintage kitch. This shop is overflowing with whimsical fun and creativity!  Everywhere you look are special creative touches and ideas. The staff was so nice and accommodating that it felt like we were talking with friends. We just wanted to stay and hang out with them. You just can't help but be inspired by all the samples, displays and special touches. An example are the bags that are used for purchases. They are made from vintage quilt magazine pages that have been transferred onto plastic sheets and sewn together on a sewing machine!  Smaller items are tucked into old pattern envelopes!  It's these special little touches that make it the most charming shopping experience. I highly recommend making a trek to see this gem of a shop.

review.author: Karne N.
review.description: What a fabulous fabric, quilting and knitting store.  Just amazing.  The owner has put together  some really imaginative kits for all ages and levels, and her family, who all seem to be employed there, are charming and helpful.  We had a lot of fun looking around and shopping.  A great stop on our trip!

review.author: Alison B.
review.description: This is a really cute quilt shop with a huge selection and lots of great patterns. Really well organized and friendly family-run store. Really nicely laid out and decorated. They also have a retreat center and long-arm machine.

review.author: Sharla M.
review.description: I just want to add my two cents worth on the fabulous fabric - craft store in Buellton.  I recently moved down this way from the Bay Area and have to find a new place to spend my money for such stuff.  I was going to do a t-shirt quilt so I went up to the store and bought some amazing stabilizer that Dana recommended.  Once I had the quilt completed I took it back up there to have it quilted on the longarm.  Turned it in on December 30th, they called on January 2nd that it was ready for pickup!  So fast I could not get up there soon enough to see it.  They did a fantastic job and allowed me to use the big table in the backroom to trim it up thus saving me the back breaking task of doing it on my dining room table.  The quilt looks great and I will be bringing others to them to quilt after I buy more fabric.

review.author: Era J.
review.description: Their selection of fabric and patterns is mediocre at best, although the way they have some of their items displayed is cute and quirky. Although I don't understand the store's policy that the minimum amount of fabric you can purchase is 1/2 yard, what really irked me was the fact that that policy wasn't posted anywhere in the shop. I travel extensively throughout North America and make it a point to visit quilt shops wherever I am and I've never come across this type of store policy! If the owners of Creation Station feel it's  OK to blind side customers like that, this is not a store that I'll do business with so I'll not be darkening the doors of this store again!

review.author: Juliana S.
review.description: The Creation Station Fabric and Quilt Shop is a must stop for everyone. This is an AMAZING place that goes WAY beyond a fabric store and is a must see.  The quilts are displayed among antique beds, cribs, and furniture.  There are ladders hanging from the ceiling, and there is a huge collections of sprinklers.  The walls are fashioned after country rooms with antique appliances that belong to grandma!  Sometimes there is a line for the bathroom, because people have to see it!  It has hanging wisteria, and hand painted poetry!

review.author: Nicole B.
review.description: This shop is awesome, as are all the people who work here. The owners are really passionate about their work, and it shows. \nThey have pretty much everything you need in this giant shop, and they will help you find it fast too. I love that its just minutes away so I don't have to drive to Santa Maria for fabrics, or supplies. \nI don't quilt but if I did, I would spend a lot more time here, it is really geared towards quilters. I do however craft in all other ways and I find everything I need in the store. Embroidery supplies, sewing supplies (I make a lot of baby items), felts, even some knitting and crocheting, but not much in the way of yarns. They have top quality cottons and fabrics, with really cute and modern patterns. My favorite thing about the shop is that they have a lot of unique examples of crafts so you can really be inspired. Pretty good prices too.

review.author: Susan C.
review.description: Best quilt store I've been in in a long time!  A lot of the patterns come with fabric and supplies to make one.  Huge selection of trailer prints.  I'll be back soon!

review.author: Karen G.
review.description: I visit The Creation Station whenever I am RVing in Buellton.  Last week they were having a huge sale.  I went in on Saturday and bought quite a bit of fabric and some kits.  When I was back home cutting it,  I noticed I was short 1/4 yard of one of the fabrics.  I called up there and they not only apologized for the error, but said they would be sending it to me at no charge.  What fantastic customer service!  I love their selection of trailer and RV prints, kits and pin cushions.  Everyone is super friendly and helpful.   One day I hope to make one of their retreat dates.  Great selection and great people = a great store.

review.author: Travis W.
review.description: My wife likes to go here to buy quilting supplies. She says that they have everything that she needs and that its organized. Support this local business!

review.author: Melissa P.
review.description: The people here are amazing.  My husband went in looking for a referral to a place where he could get some zippers replaced on some couch cushion covers and the next thing he knew he was helping to remove the old zippers and they replaced them while he waited.  Providing sewing services for hire is not something they normally do, but it did not stop them.  Paula did a fantastic job!  Christine and Dawn were very helpful and a pleasure to deal with.  You just don't find service like this anymore.

review.author: Michelle W.
review.description: Creation Station is the place to go for inspiration, wonderful fabric choices and the nicest people ever to be encountered in a quilt shop. No stuffy little old ladies here, this place rocks!  The prices are great, the staff is amazing and a sense of humor and fun oozes from this place.  aAd when you have shopped till you drop, you can snag lunch in Solvang for pete's sake!  What more can you ask?  Well-- maybe a satellite store in-- ummm say... Bakersfield?  Until then, this store is worth the drive.

review.author: Karen k.
review.description: Great shop, awesome retreats held here. Check it out!

review.author: Patrice L.
review.description: This shop has "Brown Bag Quilt Retreats" just about every month that are a blast!\nEveryone brings their own project to work on, their own sewing machine and accessories, but if you get stuck on something, there is always a quilter handy who will help you out.  The retreats start Friday morning at 8:00AM and go until Sunday afternoon at 3:00.  Some people stay late into the night, while others arrive early in the morning, sometimes overlapping!  With a full service quilt shop next door, it's easy to pick up last minute items.  The owners, an energetic young couple, make sure that the retreat attendees have everything they need for a rewarding weekend.\nI highly recommend the Brown Bag retreats!

review.author: Justin D.
review.description: Shocked this place still exists.  Attended back in the 2000's for a Computer Science degree (which they stopped offering shortly thereafter for obvious reasons) and it was a waste of $20k and 2 years of my life.  Teachers didn't know the topics, the equipment was outdated, the education all but useless and zero job placement.  Sounds like they are still running the same scam now 20 years later.\n\nDon't walk but RUN AWAY from this place.  There, I just saved you a few thousand bucks.

review.author: Bradshaw G.
review.description: Do not go to Provo College!  It's a total scam. The school allows all students into the program that met requirements but then a semester later many student are removed from program and are not given a second chance to come back. I spoke with a teacher and off the record she told me that the school is looking for "higher quality nurses" which meant anyone with tattoos or a questionable life styles were no longer desired. They kick these people out for poor reasons and then deny there attempt to re enter the program. Complete scam! Dean Summer Warner is a big part of the problem

review.author: Mandi L.
review.description: I graduated this December from the PTA program and I couldn't recommend it any higher! Our teachers were absolute rockstars and really took the time to help us understand, pass the NPTE, and become better clinicians! I loved the small class sizes and wouldn't trade this experience for the world! Career services has been great with helping me find a job. My only difficulty I had here was I'm from Ogden and the commute was really difficult. I hope one day they're able to work with UTA with maybe getting a front-runner pass to make it more accessible for people in Northern Utah! \nProvo PTA class of 2019!

review.author: Claire R.
review.description: Just finished the PTA program and it was an overall great program. Instructors are very caring especially if you make an effort to do what it takes to pass the course. It's not easy but ohh so worth it. I have learned so much in the past 2 years and I got offered a job before graduating.

review.author: O C.
review.description:
My experience with the admissions counselor has been terrible. He is the most unprofessional, rude person I have come across in a while. I went there to look into the nursing program I already have a college degree.  Garret, the admissions counselor seemed like a low level salesman. I think that people should be careful of this place it seems that the admissions counselor is trained to get you to sign up at any cost even if he had to lie and deny it later.  

Garret in particular seemed to get frustrated when I asked him a question that deviated from his crappy sales script he memorized. I felt that he was incapable of leveling with me in terms of how long the program would be with all the classes I wanted to transfer in. He gave me 2 different answers on both meetings with him and he denied what he said which is interesting because I wrote it down. He also bashed other schools in the area that are accredited which is unprofessional and just lame! 

I don't think this is the right place to go if you are transferring or are an older student. I think this place is designed to get students fresh out of high school but I would still pay attention to the costs etc. don't trust the sales/admissions people. 

After some more research and speaking to other people in the area, I found that my experience was consistent with other people. The reviews on this place are bad for a reason.  Thank God I figured this out before I wasted anymore time. I wish anyone who reads this the best of luck on your education journey. 

And if there is someone from the college who reads this. I'm sure you can find admissions counselors who care about helping people.

review.author: Jake F.
review.description: Fantastic PTA program that really helps make sure you're prepared for the national licensure exam as well as making sure their students feel prepared to enter the field. The facility members are fantastic and are always available to help outside of class time. The program/school as a whole is rather small, but that only adds to the learning experience, as each student can have the one on one teaching that is required and you never feel like you are forgotten or being left behind. Would recommend Provo College to anyone interested in being a Physical Therapist Assistant.

review.author: Kami W.
review.description: I have been extremely disappointed  in Provo College. The administration and teaching staff are all jokes. They tell students that they are wasting their time and that they will never make it as nurses. The only thing they are concerned about  is collecting their money. They give some students several chances to pass while failing others in one shot. Do not waste your time or money on this school.

review.author: Austin C.
review.description: HELL FUCKING NO im in texas currently in a move to Highland and desperatly need a college to finish attending. they never answered the phone and when they did i said hi and they will hang up. their prices are different on the phone then online. they are FUCK MONKEYS

review.author: Ashley S.
review.description: I come here about every other week to get a $20 one hour massage. It is an amazing deal. All massages are given by the students but dang you can sure score with some of them. I found a student I love so much I request her every time I come. It is cool because you fill out a sheet before the massage telling the student the areas you would like worked and goals for the session. After the session you can fill out a feed back sheet so the student knows areas to improve.

review.author: R P.
review.description: I went to Provo College a few years ago and was in the personal fitness training program. I feel like it did not prepare me to enter the field.   Only two people in my class passed the national certification test. I feel like I paid so much for an education which did not get me to my future career.  I feel like they are money hungry  and weren't willing to work with me even as a graduate from their school. I would not recommend provo college to any of my friend of family.

review.author: Nicole C.
review.description: I think the first thing that tipped me off that this college wasn't going to be the greatest was the website. You have to "request information" to get any basic questions answered and my informer Trevor, didn't seem to have any idea what he was talking about. I was trying to see if provo college would accept most of my credits from a previous university I'd been at for a year. Trevor asked me to send pictures of my class schedules so he could help me figure out what would transfer, turns out he had no idea and instead of responding with anything helpful he through me a pitch of "well the real question is whether or not you want to finish school faster." I was looking for help not some crappy sales pitch. I decided to set up a meeting in person to see if someone else could help me and I was assigned to trevor again...bummer. He gave me a date and a few times to meet with him, but no place to meet him, when i texted to confirm what time I wanted and to double check where i was supposed to go he never responded. I am extremely disappointed in the service and how i was treated, you feel like you're being talked down to instead of having a normal conversation. I wouldn't recommend provo college to anyone.

review.author: Saratoga S.
review.description:
I went to Provo College because they're accredited, local, smaller classes, offered a lot of perks on campus, etc, etc....When I started school, I must say, all the students were sub par to a normal human being. It was as if the only students they could attract were not personable, clueless to common sense, never used deodorant, and BARELY passed high school.
Then the instructors-wow! Most of them went to college at some point, but I only had one teacher for about 8 of my classes-He had to go and learn what he was about to teach us the day before class!!
All those perks-all went away when they decided to fire the campus president at American Fork, hire some satan woman, then replace her with some dude that thinks smiling will cause cancer. I swear, he couldn't be nice if his daughter's life depended on it. He cut off usage of the gym to students, had little attendance cards like back in grade school, closes his door and locks it so no one could talk to him, fired the good employees that kept the students happy and productive, then changed the accrediting body of the campus which in turn changed requirements and costs for students.
He also banned students children from EVER being on campus. That was a HUGE perk for students going to school at night because they worked during the day-saved them a ton on babysitters or driving to and from families homes where the children now have to stay.
And the cherry on top, most of us are not rich, so we can't afford a huge commute, that's why we chose this campus right near home, and now they're closing down the campus and making us choose to either drop out of school, or drive a light year difference between the campuses. To some, it might not be that much, but to us barely surviving as it is, it's a huge cost! And to try to drive that much more, make it to our job on time, and make it to school on time so we don't get in trouble, is now almost impossible!
IF YOU CARE ANYTHING ABOUT YOUR FUTURE, FIND ANY OTHER SCHOOL! PROVO COLLEGE WILL PUT YOU IN HUGE DEBT, AND THE EDUCATION YOU RECEIVE SUCKS VERY, VERY BADLY! You will not be prepared to work in the area you are studying for. You're better using your gut instinct rather than the "education" they have to offer.

review.author: Mike N.
review.description:
Look into their job placement rates and you will know exactly why they get a 5 star rating.
The fields they offer courses in are relevant and in demand. Faculty is constantly meeting with business from around the area to find out what they want to see in their prospective employees and MATC caters their courses to meet their needs. 
Their salon is great, with good prices. A men's haircut is like $4! And of course they have a full selection of hair and nail services. 
Counselor's are available to help you with whatever questions you have, including relevant job market information.

review.author: Sarah E.
review.description: Being a high school student get you in with no tuition. So far I've loved it I love the teachers and I love the atmosphere, all the students are nice and it's very clean environment, the store has many options and the front desk can answer pretty much any question you have about the place. All the staff are all so kind and friendly, going from high school classes to a college class is obviously kind of rough, but they do their very best to help you out and to continue to the program. I highly suggest going to this location if this is the nearest location to you, they have other locations located in Orem, Provo, and in Lehigh.

review.author: Toni G.
review.description: I would not recommend this school for the LPN program. It is a business and not a school. You are put on a behavior modification program the moment you start. They tell you this is your job but the student is putting in all your investments and the student is taking all the risks. I was kicked out of the program, our class started with 25 and three are now gone. If you want to make an investment toward your education save your money and attend a school not a business. They do not have the students best interest.

review.author: Mike N.
review.description:
This is an impressive elementary school. They are a Leader In Me school and have received many awards and recognition in this regard. 

When you walk into the school, the principal and office staff are standing in the lobby greeting parents and children as they enter. All the teachers are standing at their door with a student leader to great each child with a verbal welcome and a handshake before entering the room. They start the kids day by treating them as little adults, empowering them to behave as such. 

The school goals and standards are posted everywhere, along with how they are doing in regard to those goals and standards. They set high standards of their teaches and the kids as well. 

They focus on the 7 Habits of Highly Successful People written, coached and practiced in ways that the kids understand. This is the back bone of their approach to education and it works. 

The principal is loved by the kids and he loves them. I think his leadership of the school is what has made them so successful.

review.author: Sam M.
review.description: I absolutely LOVE Discovery Tree. The staff, the administration, the one on one my daughter gets. They are able to have outdoor activities, team building activities and projects done multiple times during the week. My daughter is learning more about colors, numbers, animals...etc. She is being taught at an early age what a routine is. What it is like to be "at school". The updates throughout the day I get as a parent, are so comforting. I know they are taking care of my child. I have and will continue to recommend them to any and all friends and family looking into daycare centers!

review.author: Cori K.
review.description: LOVE Discovery Tree. You can tell the teachers actually care about the kids and the instruction they're providing. The lesson plans they prepare keep my kids engaged and excited to learn new things. They are constantly bringing home little projects that were fun, and actually taught a lesson. Tim and his entire staff are amazing, the security features are top notch. Can't say enough good things. We checked out other facilities and nothing else comes even close in comparison.

review.author: Cindy J.
review.description: This is a great preschool! They offer a free high-quality education program for children ages 3-5 and they have helps for parents as well.

review.author: Cheryl H.
review.description:
Pastor Chris Brown is very welcoming.
Not only does this church building have historical significance - but it is a great place to worship with fellow Lutherans.
We came for worship while staying in Solvang for the weekend.
There is coffee and fellowship for all after worship.

review.author: Mark K.
review.description: Finally made it to this quaint, historic church just a few blocks walk from downtown Solvang! This church, still a parish church, was founded in 1912 upon a vote of the new residents of what would become Solvang. Originally meeting in the small local hotel, and then Atterdag College, the congregation finally built this structure in 1928. The church is open daily, and there is a wonderful brochure in the vestibule which highlights the features of this small, beautiful church. The main attraction, at least for me, is the woodwork around the sanctuary. Hand worked by artisan Jes Smidt. He carved the altar, altar railing, pastor's chairs, pulpit and baptismal font. All are amazingly simple yet deeply beautiful, especially the pulpit, with its 3-D statues (St. John, St. Peter, St. Paul and St. Ansgar) carved into (out of?!) the wood. Take a close look at their features and you'll be very impressed with Mr. Smidt's skills. Other features in the church include bright and symbolic contemporary stained glass windows in the sanctuary, and an old sailing ship hanging from the ceiling. Yep, that caught my attention! Seems the Vikings, according to the brochure, view the "church as a ship that takes people safely through the storms of life." To hang a model of a ship reminds the Danish of this, and this haven of safety, the church, in their lives. Beautiful tradition! The last amazing feature of this seemingly simple church is the Phelps pipe organ, a commanding presence in the choir loft. Installed in 1981 after years of fundraising, this organ boasts 20 ranks of pipes, totaling 1,024 pipes. Would love to hear it someday! For historical reasons alone, this church is a place to visit, reflecting the cultural and faith history of the original Danish settlers; yet, it exudes a life and warmth today, as signs of an active faith life still are present in your visit. Come, and spend a little time in this small safe haven in Solvang!

review.author: Tammy B.
review.description: Highly recommend drive tech! We used Rochelle and she made my daughter feel comfortable and at ease, she's up beat and positive. My daughter passed the test on her first try with a near perfect test.

review.author: Heather D.
review.description: Drive Tech is absolutely the best!!!!  Two amazing 2 hour driving lessons & then the final 2 hour driving lesson is a mock DMV driving test.  The kind woman that picked up & taught both of my teens is efficient, positive, & encourages them to understand rules & drive safely.  She teaches beyond the requirement for the test.  My son took his DMV driving exam today & scored 100%. The things my teen learned helped me become a safer driver because over the years I have become complacent.  Thank you Drive Tech for being making the process so flawless!!!

review.author: Karson A.
review.description: Melanie is great! I was so nervous when I started my lessons with her. She assured me it was normal and she was here to help. We started off by driving around my neighborhood where I was familiar with the streets and stop signs. She was always giving me tips and ideas on how to be a safe driver. She gives great lesson plans. She pointed out my errors and helped me correct them. We did a mock drive test at the dmv where she graded me and scored me as if it was a real test. Because of her I was able to pass first try!

review.author: Hallie O.
review.description: We have been an AirTime family for just over two years. From the moment our son came to AirTime he never wanted to leave. We have two children who are on the competitive teams. AirTime has many fun classes for all gymnastic levels. The coaches care about the children and their needs. Our family has recommended AirTime to many other families and we have even had a birthday party at AirTime. AirTime even has cheerleading, trampoline and tumbling and a bus for preschoolers. We love AirTime and can't wait to see our children grow this coming season.

review.author: Lucky M.
review.description: My son went to the preschool for 2 years and it was ok, they changed teachers halfway through the year and got the receptionist to replace her. The new teacher insinuated that my son may need to get checked up for ADHD and she admitted she couldnt understand my son sometimes when he spoke. He only had turned 4 in a class with 5 and almost 6 year olds. Now he's 2nd grade with no issues with behavior in school and is top of the class in nearly all subjects. The facility was clean and organized. We liked the gymnastics that they put into the schedule.

review.author: F J.
review.description: They are a nice facility with good coaches and good equipment. But they seem to be overbooked on everything. They offer makeup classes if they miss for some reason, but depending on what time you have your normal class it is almost impossible to get into one, they only allow a certain amount in the makeup class so if there are too many when you can go it's too bad for you. My wife called and one person was super nice and tried to help her, another called her back and was rude and unprofessional. My wife is the sweetest person alive and will go out of her way for anyone, and they treat her like that? Way to lose business and give me the motivation to leave this review! They need to make it just as easy to go to a makeup class regardless of the time you have your normal class. They schedule the makeups during normal class times, how does that make any sense? We spend a lot of money so our child can go to gymnastics... Life happens and sometimes people miss their class, but let's not screw people out of their money! We won't be signing up at this place again!

review.author: audrey s.
review.description: All of the ladies in the store were so sweet and helpful. They have amazing options for fabric and quilt patterns as well as other notions. They also offer quilting classes. I have never made a quilt before but I have been wanting to make one. One of the ladies helped me select a pattern and took the time to explain what I would need and how easy it really would be. You can also book private classes and private use of their sewing room.

review.author: Bonnie K.
review.description: This place is closed.. although their website says open.  We drove out here based on bogus reviews saying it's an amazing shop and the website saying it's open.   A phone call last night to the number said the shop was open at 10:00am.   \n\nTha shop is EMPTY...looking in the windows st bare floors!   What a complete waste of time!

review.author: Danaan C.
review.description: I did the Part-time cohort in Provo, and it was exactly what I was looking for. I'm a designer at a software company, with no prior development experience. I wanted to understand how my designs would be built and be able to communicate with the development teams I worked with. After a few weeks of DevMoutain I was able to more effectively communicate with the development teams and better understand what could and couldn't be feasibly built. My designs got better and I gained confidence in myself as we built our individual projects each week in class. DevMountain gets you coding from week 1 in front end and backend technologies, so you understand how web applications work and have experience doing it all. They give you the tools to decide which area of development you're good at and enjoy, so you can make a career decision and pursue it. It was awesome. Every night we wrote code with teachers and mentors to help us when we got stuck, giving you context that online tutorials can't match. I had a great experience and made friendships and connections that benefit me now and will in the future. Can't recommend these guys enough.

review.author: Curly G.
review.description: I felt completely out of place and alone during my whole high school career.\nI recall one of my teachers gossiping about me to another teacher because I received a D in her class and didn't receive assistance from my teachers when I needed it. Only a handful of them seemed to be concerned or cared about my future. That school did not provide me with the necessary help or support system.

review.author: Brodie B.
review.description: This is a terrible place to go to high school. I had many many bad memories there. There were very few good memories. The teachers for the most part are all bad. There were a few good teachers though. If you have any choice where to go to school I'd recommend not coming here...

review.author: Sasha M.
review.description: I just wen't to this schools choir , and just listened. They are AMAZING some of those girls should have record deals. They are just great.

review.author: Jason B.
review.description: As a history buff, I was invited to a Czech 50h wedding anniversary at this location.  Apparently there are a lot of Czech's living in the area, Vasko and Kostelecky to name a few. \n\nAbout this place:  A group of the descendants of turn-of-the-century immigrants to Silverhill from the mid-European region known as Bohemia -- now part of western Czechoslovakia --  gathered this morning to re-open their cherished community hall that had been damaged by a tornado in March of 2011.

review.author: Brandy C.
review.description: I was unimpressed with how my children were taken care of. They were not shown the individual attention they need. They were sent home three times because of behavior. It taught my kids if they were bad they could go home. The director would put no blame on the teacher and had me take my kids to the doctor to find out nothing was wrong with them. Ultimatly they were terminated. I do not recommend you put your children in the care of these people.

review.author: Hope R.
review.description: The reason I choose to leave a review after so many years is because this site is about your experience and letting others know. This place is too small for the number of kids in there and not enough staff members that actually want to be there. Kids Plus has had the same teachers and helpers for the past 5 years. It was a different person every other day. When I saw the review from the previous parent, it was so similar to my experience that I had to write about mine. To respond with You don't remember is the same answers I always got when I questioned the way things were being done at this place. I was very disappointed and have noticed a pattern they tend to make. Telling parents to come pick up their child cause they are sick when in fact they are not, gives them 2 days automatically out of the week to not have to care for your child. After Making weekly doctor visits and paying a copay amount each visit, just to give an excuse to the daycare to prove your child is not sick will start to add up and also cause a strain at work. So there you have it to why I placed my review about your company.

review.author: Angela R.
review.description: My first helicopter ride today and it was well worth it. Great flight and great experience. Definitely would recommend Lost Bay Helicopters!

review.author: Nikita S.
review.description: Had amazing time with pilot Mike and much appreciated meeting with Rachel, business owner, highly recommend checking them out if you are in town for a weekend, totally worth the price!

review.author: Justin E.
review.description: Most of these guys are ex military and I always try to support vets and vet businesses and this business is the exact reason why. They run it the way a business should be with great precision and outstanding customer service with Rachael keeping everything and everyone in order.\nGreat experience and I highly recommend them!

review.author: Shelby G.
review.description: My daughters been dying to fly so when I seen their ad pop up on fb while we were on vacation I jumped on it. I wish I hadn't the pilot didn't say a word to us when we got in which made it kind of awkward in my opinion. My 7 year old daughter sat in the front with him she was so excited it was her first time flying and it was a surprise birthday present for her. I've went on a helicopter ride down here a few years ago and it was great the guy talked to us the whole time asked where we were staying so we could fly by and wave I'll be taking her there if we ever want to go again. When we got done she was like why didn't he say hi how are you or bye have a nice day i hope you enjoyed it when we got out that was awkward. i asked which way we were going and he told me left down the beach and across state park and thats the only thing he ever said. The lady that walks you to the helicopter was super nice and friendly.  Luckily my daughter still enjoyed it and it wasn't a total bust for her.

review.author: Katherine L.
review.description: I can't believe that I'm the first to review.  For about a hundie, the two of you can have the most incredible tourist thing.  The pilot (is adorable) is knowledgeable, gives competent instructions without terrifying you, then lifts you off of the tarmac before you can start to panic about being hoisted 500 feet off terra firma in a glass bubble glued to a beer can.  The panic lasts only a couple seconds, then ... OMG.  Just.  Wow.  It's a short trip around the Gulf Shores city, beach and state park.  The pilot loves his little neck of the woods and ADORES his machine.  He is happy to share info and explain intricacies of his aircraft.  And ...  drumroll .... you get to wear those cool headphones with microphones attached.  Do this tourist thing.  Its fun to go hang around the airport, too.  \n\nAFTERTHOUGHT:  It is not, in fact, a beer can.  It's an amazing, well-kept, well-loved flying machine.  I did not mean to make it sound otherwise.

name: Grace United Methodist Church Day Care

review.author: Krystal L.
review.description: We love Meadowlake!! We have 4 kids that attend: first, second, third, and fourth grade! I wish they went up to 8th grade so we could stay there but it only goes up to 5th! They have amazing security: you have to be buzzed in through the front office and all the doors and fences are locked from the outside. You also have to scan you Driver License into the system which is great for deterring criminals and parents that aren't allowed to see their children for custody purposes. The principal will always email you back and the two women in the office are so friendly and amazing!!

review.author: Adam M.
review.description: The most amazing place in the most unsuspecting geography. You have to come in and talk to Matt incredibly talented artist and generous owner. He has an incredible life story and even more incredible mats mocha.

review.author: Brenda S.
review.description: STEPS has a very complete program for the competition teams- there's a lot of opportunities for growth a lot of positive enthusiasm. STEPS recreational classes are algo great and my son enjoyed dancing in the recitals. I highly recommend it.

review.author: Marshall M.
review.description: This dance studio is the best. Great selection of classes for every kind of dancer from beginner to advanced. Our kids LOVE their teachers too. Highly recommended.

review.author: Giselle L.
review.description: I have danced at this studio and I have danced here for 4 years . Steps is a great place to learn dance but  it's also a great place to get life long friendships and have a great time .

review.author: Kyle B.
review.description: Absolutely the worst.  All the negative reviews about the director are Absolutely true. Sue is very immature and petty. Very disorganized studio, billing is always a mess. Sue is Absolutely the worst.  I would never send a child back into that negative environment.

review.author: Brent L.
review.description:
Steps teaches great dance. They have many trophies to prove that. But they are so much more than a competitive Studio. My two girls go to a young class and they learn confidence and wholesome dance.

They also have all kinds of classes. From ballroom dance to belly dancing and everything in between! Sue has a passion for life and a passion for dance! 

I truly feel like this studio has an impact on lives and families for the good!

review.author: Stuart W.
review.description: This place is great! Disregard the lady from CA who doesn't live here and doesn't have a child attending here. Haters are gonna hate

review.author: Dave E.
review.description: We started out with our oldest daughter going to steps and now 2 years later all 4 of my children go there. This place is awesome! The owners are great to work and really know how to work with kids of all age groups. We have enjoyed all the instructors and the fun performances that they put on each year at the festival of trees, lagoon and many more.\n   I would highly recommend this place for anyone that is looking for a good dance studio. They also have a group of Moms that dance. I think that is fun to watch.

review.author: Heather W.
review.description: Both of my children go to the preschool here and they love it. They learn normal preschool curricula, but they also learn music, dance and tumbling, and the class is small enough that they get a lot of one on one time with their teachers. Their prices are reasonable and I would definitely recommend this preschool to anyone.

review.author: Haley E.
review.description: We love Steps! My kids have been going to Steps Dance for the last six years. The director, Susan, is amazing with the kids. We have loved all the teachers there. It is a such a great environment for my kids. I love how they have taught my kids the respect they need to have for others as well as how they can follow their dreams! Steps is not just a dance studio, it's our second family. I would highly recommend Steps Dance as well as their preschool.

review.author: Kristen H.
review.description: My daughter has been dancing here for 5 years!!  She loves it there and so do I.  The studio has a great, safe environment!! My daughter and I will be with Steps for life!!  The instructors are wonderful and are very positive!! LOVE STEPS!!

review.author: Cheltsy M.
review.description: We've been going to Steps Dance for four years now and they are fantastic!  The studio fosters such a great unity among the dancers and we love that our daughter is learning technique as she dances.  She has so much fun and loves her teachers to pieces.  It has been amazing to see her grow as a dancer and how much she has learned, especially during the summer.  We love that Steps' offers dance, tumbling, and private lessons too!  Recitals are always so much fun.  I love that they perform twice a year, rather than once, and competitions are exciting too!  Our daughter loves to be on stage and perform and the teachers have helped foster her confidence, and to believe in herself.  She especially loves when they choreograph a new trick she has learned into a dance for her to perform.  They are so great, and we highly recommend them!

review.author: Lorraine R.
review.description: All 3 of my girls started at Steps Dance & Performing Arts last August.  It's been amazing how much their confidence and performance abilities have grown in such a short time.  Steps offers so many different classes that my girls can take everything they wanted in one studio instead of having to drive from one place to another.   Steps has also helped them excel in competition, which is something they've been wanting to do for a long time. My girls are quite excited to be involved in the Stadium of Fire this year also.  I think people would be surprised at all the different classes this studio has.

review.author: Dominique K.
review.description: Coastal Emergency Medical Skills is awesome! John is such a great teacher he has so many years of experience coupled with a dynamic personality. Coastal creates a comfortable learning environment your open to ask questions no many how silly you think it may be. \nScheduling my class was very easy and the price for the classes are very affordable. Guys this company is professional holds high integrity and most importantly the information is fun to learn!!

review.author: Ellen D.
review.description: John Cobb/CemsCpr Mobile, Al is the best ACLS class instructor and course I have experienced in 35 years. You will leave the class understanding more and feel more confident. I highly recommend this instructor and class. Low stress with quality instruction.

review.author: Jordyn M.
review.description: John is great! I loved the small, relaxed atmosphere. He had coffee and snacks available which was wonderful! When I left I felt fully equipped to preform CPR if needed. Highly recommend!

review.author: April K.
review.description: I was in a time crunch and needed to renew my BLS super quick! This place is awesome! I was able to register for class the day before and the instructors are very friendly and knowledgeable. I will definitely be returning for my ACLS renewal this summer! I wish I would have known about this place sooner, honestly.

review.author: Joslyn W.
review.description: talladega college is the most unsanitary HBCU i have attended this school has been around for years and they still havent made any progress with trying to keep it up. there are bugs infections and water leakages among some of the rooms. the cost of this school is way to high for their living conditions this is tragic. they need help somebody call the health department

review.author: Melissa B.
review.description:
Sunday, March 9th, Tony and I was driving back to Nashville from Birmingham and I chose a road route via Talladega so I could check out their historical buildings.

 I didn't know that there was this historical college here so I was very pleased and in awe of some of the gorgeous buildings that made up the campus of this old college.
 
Even though there is Security Alert sign about 24 hr protection...No ONE stopped us. I enjoyed this college because of all the old buildings. When in the area, you should stop by and check it out.

History:
Talladega College, located in Talladega, Alabama, is a private, liberal arts college. It holds the distinction as Alabama's oldest private historically black college. As of 2009 the school received full SACS accreditation
The history of Talladega College began on November 20, 1865, when two former slaves William Savery and Thomas Tarrant, both of Talladega, met in convention with a group of new freedmen in Mobile, Alabama. From this meeting came the commitment, "...We regard the education of our children and youth as vital to the preservation of our liberties, and true religion as the foundation of all real virtue, and shall use our utmost endeavors to promote these blessings in our common country."
With this as their pledge, Savery and Tarrant, aided by General Wager Swayne of the Freedmen's Bureau, began in earnest to provide a school for the children of former slaves of the community. Their leadership resulted in the construction of a one-room school house using lumber salvaged from an abandoned carpenter's shop. The school overflowed with pupils from its opening and soon it was necessary to move into larger quarters.
Meanwhile, the nearby Baptist Academy was about to be sold under mortgage default. This building had been built in 1852-53 with the help of slaves - including Savery and Tarrant. A speedy plea was sent to General Swayne for its purchase. General Swayne in turn persuaded the American Missionary Association to buy the building and some 20 acres (81,000 m2) of land for $23,000.
The grateful parents renamed the building Swayne School and it opened in November 1867 with about 140 pupils. A building constructed before the war with slave labor for white students became the home of the state's first college dedicated to serving the educational needs of blacks. In 1869, Swayne School was issued a charter as Talladega College by the Judge of Probate of Talladega County.
The former Baptists Academy building, now known as Swayne Hall, has remained in service as the symbol and spirit of the beginning of the college.

Andrews Hall, built in 1910, houses the Music Department and the Education Department. It is named for George Whitfield Andrews, D.D., Dean of Theological Department from 1875 to 1908.
Arthur D. Shores Hall, constructed in 1974, is named for the late Attorney Arthur D. Shores, Class of 1927, who served for many years as a member and chairman of the College Board of Trustees.
De Forest Chapel, built in 1903 in commemoration of the life and service of the Rev. Henry Swift De Forest, D.D., President of the College from 1879 to 1896. DeForest Chapel was renovated in 1996 and rededicated November 1996. De Forest was the father of inventor Lee De Forest.
Fanning Refectory, built in 1928 from a legacy of Dr. David H. Fanning of Worcester, Massachusetts. The building contains the student and faculty dining rooms.
Juliette Derricotte House, built in 1940-41, was the gift of the Harkness Foundation and named for Juliette Derricotte, Class of 1918, who at the time of her death in 1932 was a member of the Board of Trustees. Formerly a staff residence and guest house, it was converted into a women's honors dormitory in 1988.
Silsby Science Hall, constructed in 1926, was named for Dr. E. C. Silsby,[2] who was a member of the College faculty for 37 years. The building was a gift of the General Education Board and friends and alumni of the College. It contains the laboratories and classrooms for the Natural Sciences and Mathematics.

review.author: Richard N.
review.description: An historic institution of distinguished higher learning nestled within an extraordinarily beautiful campus. I finally visited the book store and was blown away at its size and availability of gear, including a few Greek options, that included gear I hadn't seen before.  I dove in on a few TU Mom, Dad, and sister shirts, as well as some Frat 'nalia, and I walked out spending ONLY $100!! \n\nI can't wait to return.

review.author: Renia L.
review.description:
One of the most beautiful historically black college campuses i've ever seen. Red bricked buildings adorned the campus.. it has that preserved look. The history that comes with its beauty is what I truly loved.

You can visit the George Washington Carver Museum, tour the home Booker T. Washington built and visit the burial site of him and his family along with other historic burial sites..all of which are located in the heart of campus. I recommend you see everything!

The university was oddly very quiet. Which left us to assume that the students were in their dorms feverishly studying. 

Make sure to visit the Tuskegee Airmen National Museum on your way into campus (crawford st.)  it's simply amazing to see and read about the young airmen. Emotional to say the least.

review.author: Blake I.
review.description:
Tuskegee was founded in 1881 and led by Dr. Booker T. Washington. The university has national prominence for its programs in Agriculture and Engineering. Many of the buildings on the historic campus were built with the assistance of students.  

Located in a small town, the campus maintains a conference center that includes lodging and restaurant facilities for visitors.  My visit to the campus was enjoyable as everyone was friendly, pleasant and welcoming. 

Some of the many interesting sites to visit on campus include the George Washington Carver Museum, the National Center for Bioethics in Research and Health Care, and the grave sites for Dr. Booker T. Washington and Dr. George Washington Carver. You should reserve time to visit the museums to learn more about the contributions this institution made to this country.

review.author: Jackie S.
review.description: This institution is so special to me because it is a HBCU university. My grandson is a freshman 2018-2019 year. An awesome and amazing, so much history abound Tuskegee University is so outstanding!!

review.author: Bunny B.
review.description: None better!  The professors are dedicated to the school and the students.  I graduated many moons ago and my affection and admiration have not diminished.  The business education that I received has served me well - through my MBA and law school.  The school offers a terrific foundation in a small town where values still prevail.

review.author: Richard N.
review.description: There is nothing in the world like an HBCU.  We dropped my first born off for his freshman year and what an experience.  Upperclassmen met us at every corner from the front gate with Pom poms and warm welcomes all the way to his dorm.  Initially I was flustered by the long route to his dorm, but that was part of the experience provided by the welcoming committee - celebration of your hard work, future, and the legacy of all who have gone this way before, that my son will add to during his tenure as student and future alumnus. SKEGEE!!!!!!!

review.author: Larry S.
review.description:
This is a review of the historical parts of the school. 
       Very nice GWC museum with a lot of his personal effects. Remember many of the buildings were built by the STUDENTS!! Very humbling. Super friendly attendant at the museum.
