       The Lifting the Veil of Slavery bronze statue is arguably the best statue in the world. That sounds stupid but in a world filled with statues of military heroes and the like this really is an amazing, moving, visceral, real presence. 
     The cemetery speaks for itself.

review.author: Tiffany M.
review.description: Great university rich in heritage and tradition! I would recommend it to anyone perusing an education especially in the sciences.

review.author: Megan C.
review.description: Tuskegee University is where all of my family went to school. It's a great historic town.. It's certainly not much to do there.. I really only go for my family and any big events that's going on campus, but it's a great college for education!

review.author: Chandra H.
review.description: Great place for higher education. Beautiful architecture. The George Washington Carver museum is a must see. Friendly and helpful students and staff.

review.author: A. C.
review.description:
Mixed emotions! The faculty and staff in my college are great! Love em to death. They are great ppl that are helpful in every way. These ppl truly have your interests and goals at heart and pushes you to your full potential. However the administration is another thing. As with any institution you expect to have bumps and road blocks, but the workers in the Financial Aid and the Bursar's office are HORRIBLE! I dread having to go in either office. They are rude, they talk down to you, and they're unwiling to help you, explain, or clear up any misunderstandings. They never answer the phones (and I've seen them ignore the phone while I was waiting in line). And they just have bad attitudes. 
Paperwork is always missing and it never fails, something always comes up at the end of the semester where you end up having to pay some fee that mysteriously wasn't covered or paid at the beginning of the semester. I can go on.
But despite those few problems the university is fine. 

The things we put up with to be a Tuskegee Alum!

name: SPECS - Sherre Padgett Education Consulting Services

review.author: Cathy S.
review.description: I liked Thomas University when I attend there. But I had to take time off because of a car wreck and lots of rehab. When I tried to return non of the classes I had taken that would let me use they wanted me to start completely over. If you know expensive it is thats not an option. However by brother barely had to take classes on campus because he had work experience. Doesn't seem very fair.

name: American Red Cross Thomas County Chapter

review.author: Ray L.
review.description: Best school ever. I suggest that you send your kids there. amazing education. Lots of students get a scholarship from colleges after going to this school.

review.author: Hibiscus O.
review.description: So helpful, friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. I just took my macbook in to have a weird rattling sound diagnosed-- Chase fixed it immediately! I also bought my computer here, and my husband has had equally excellent experience here as well. \n\nHighly recommended!

review.author: J J.
review.description: Highly knowledgeable and a pleasure to work with. I have utilized Rob for all of my computer based needs for over 14 years. He set up me up with my first Dell( yes... I said Dell!) and now he helps me with all my Macs! Whenever I have a question or need some work done, he is speedy in response and extremely reliable. Honest, fair prices and friendly to the max... I'm lucky to have Rob and The Core team on my side when I'm in need of IT help. They are great!

review.author: Kendra H.
review.description: Great Experience!!!!!!!! Received the help I'd been needing for awhile now. The customer service was excellent!!!! No issues, whatsoever, in being able to solve my problem!!! I would most definitely recommend!!!

review.author: Robin F.
review.description: Very helpful with all Mac and Apple products. I've bought all my Macs from them. They helped me return my Mac when I dropped fruit juice on the keyboard. All nice and helpful folks there. Rob the manager is super.

review.author: Cheryl B.
review.description: I'll never buy a computer anywhere else. These guys go above and beyond. Customer service above and beyond.

review.author: Gloria L.
review.description: Andrew did a fabulous helping me learn about my new Mac.  He was very knowledge and made sure that I understood the areas that I had concerns about.  Everyone is always top notch at the Core!!!\n\n- Gloria

review.author: Haven M.
review.description: An accredited school that you can find great opportunities, however the most valuable part of the experiences are friends for life.

review.author: Ashley M.
review.description: Things are a little unprofessional, and you'll be there awhile, but the girl who did my hair knew what she was doing and it looked great. I got a haircut and full highlights and if I remember correctly, it was around/under $50. \nTIPPING IS ONLY IN CASH, so beware, I only had about $2 on me and was embarrassed.\nHours are a little limited since it's a school, closed Wednesday, Saturday, Sunday.

name: SPECS - Sherre Padgett Education Consulting Services

review.author: Gabe P.
review.description:
What's  not to love about this beautiful campus.   I always enjoy visiting during the fall football season......


ROLL TIDE!!!

review.author: Rob S.
review.description:
I'm actually really shocked that this review has never been written ..... my apologies to the tide ..... ROLL TIDE!

I've been to this campus several times. Either game day or for job fairs. The team that we have worked with to set up our recruitment of co-ops has always been top notch. They have the systems down and make it a super easy process. Great communication between the employers as well as the students. They always go above and beyond to make this a nice day for anyone participating.

As far as the football program is concerned (aside from a loss this week .... :( .... ) they set the bar high at Alabama. This is basically our professional sports team. We've grown accustomed to winning through out the season and always being in the hunt for another championship. Top level recruiting and execution on the field .... hard to beat 'Bama football.

Love this university and spending time here, if you're a fan of college sports, you should make sure Bryant Denny is on the list of stadiums to visit.

review.author: Marc C.
review.description:
Amazing campus.

Super clean,  expansive and up to date technology.  I was impressed!

Roll Tide!

review.author: Miriam A.
review.description:
We were super impressed with Bama Bound over the past two days!  University of Alabama is a large campus, but they make you feel right at home.  We had cheer teams showing us where to go each day and smiling faces everywhere you turned.  The guidance and leadership for helping our son choose his courses were excellent and he was able to get the class schedule he needed for his major.  The campus is beautiful and clean!  It is a smoke free campus and they have great security on site.  There are so many support systems for the students and the dorms are top rated in the United States.  

The bookstore and food services were impressive!  So many good food options and lots of great clothing and swag to purchase.  

Overall the campus is a beautiful walk and bike friendly area with great green spaces and wonderful classroom and housing facilities.  We look forward to many visits over the four to five years our son attends.

We feel welcome as a new part of the University of Alabama family. 
Roll Tide!!

review.author: Lorine F.
review.description: An incredible university- diverse programs, phenomenal faculty and staff, and an absolutely gorgeous campus. I cannot recommend attending Alabama enough! You will find your forever friends and discover passions that will guide your career. And the sports teams don't hurt- attending football, basketball, softball, gymnastics, and baseball games were a major bonus to an awesome experience. Love this place. RTR.

review.author: Lauryn W.
review.description: I love UA so much, it is a great school for anyone who is looking to belong and get a great education!

review.author: Jared A.
review.description: Just visited, but beautiful campus! Roll Tide Roll!\n\nLarge campus so you have to walk a long way to get anywhere. The stadium is great place to visit. Great bookstores.

review.author: Susan B.
review.description: Just toured last week with Royce as our guide.  First, I want to say that Royce was an amazing guide!  Full of knowledge, professional, friendly and funny. And the campus is amazing!  Super clean, updated, friendly people.  Academics also impressive. Roll Tide!

review.author: Ben B.
review.description: Great college, storied football program, friendly town.  \nRoll Tide Roll.

review.author: Robert L.
review.description: First of all I have to say I grew up a Vanderbilt fan even thou I lived in Ohio so I never cared for the Tide(they always killed us in football) but now that I am older and more mature I can appreciate the gorgeous campus and friendly people they have at U. of Alabama. Going to this campus for a football game is a religious experience, Alabama fans were also super nice to me for some reason but I am a pretty easy going mild mannered guy now a days. I really like the students at U. of Alabama especially the lovely females they have. Very outgoing, bubbly and welcoming students they have here. I would recommend a visit its an awesome place to be in the Fall. T Town is almost title town for the Alabama football team they have won 4 titles in the past 7 years. I will be back to visit the campus really soon I love it.

review.author: Rick T.
review.description: This is a great state university.  I did research on many schools, and if you get admitted here you are lucky. The hard part is the cost.  UA is about 25K for in state students. Out of state is 33K. Four years here could really be a huge investment.  \nIf you are part of the Greek system, add even more.  I went to UT Austin 30 yrs. ago, and Ohio State Univ.  in the 70s.  Both schools were affordable at that time for state residents. Too many state universities today are easily 2000/month.  Unless you get grants or some assistance, you will go heavily into debt to be here.  The job mkt. may or may not be great when you finish, so factor that in also.  I don't think many students realize how long it takes to pay back loans of 20K or more.  You will have a tough load to carry long after you leave campus.  My advice is try to do your first two years at a cheaper school, become a transfer student for your final two years. Otherwise prepare for sticker shock. The student body at UA is diverse, friendly, and affluent. Over 50% of incoming freshman are from out of state. I'm 60 now, and if I could start again, UA would be a great choice once you work out the financial picture. Do that before you apply, or you might be very unhappy later. Employers don't care much about your alma mater. They care about what economic value you bring to the table. The social life here can't be beat. Sadly that won't count once you enter the job market. Don't  pay too much just to party!  Good luck!

review.author: Yelper E.
review.description:
(for my DC friends.... Al-a-ba-ma Roll Tide Roll.  you knew this was coming eventually...)

5.0 stars.  I find it shocking that no one has reviewed my undergraduate alma mater.  In fact, I am almost certain that is impossible so hopefully someone will take the good service to let me know the appropriate place for this review.  

With that said....

I'm biased.  I have gone to the University of Texas for law school and George Washington for business school.  I have taken classes at Southern Miss and South Alabama.  I have taught at Georgetown, Howard, and Maryland.  Through my legal work and propensity to watch an inordinate amount of college football, I have visited a number of other universities.  Nothing comes close to the experience that is the University of Alabama.  

(Yes, UVA people.  That includes your school.)

What is it about the University of Alabama that separates it from other schools?  First and foremost, the facilities at the business school were top notch when I was a student here eons ago.  I think any student orientation should start and end at the Culverhouse School to give prospectives a strong understanding of the modern technology that ALABAMA has invested in to make your learning experience one that actually has functionality in today's society.  Second, the university is ridiculously cheap.  To put it bluntly, Alabama's tuition is cheaper than my high school's tuition.  From an objective perspective, the Alabama degree is certainly more impressive.  Third, I had amazing career options after finishing up at Alabama.  I turned down Merrill Lynch in New York to go to law school.  I had offers from undergraudate school that put the offers I received after law school to shame (note that Texas was ranked in the top 15 by US News and World Report for law school; Alabama's undergraduate programs generally are not given such a high mark).  Indeed, one could say that I was very well positioned straight out of college for a ridiculously lucrative and rewarding career.  Isn't that the whole point of going to college?  To position yourself for future success?

Oh wait.  College football.  You wanted to hear about college football.  Yeah, we play a little bit of pigskin down south.  ALABAMA is the best college football program in the country.  National championships are bred here faster than what goes on between two happy rabbits in a sock.  With Nick Saban adding his own chapter to our glorious past, it is only a matter of time before another national championship banner finds its way to Tuscaloosa.

Other useful items:  beautiful campus, impressive Greek life, great BBQ, social students, and caring faculty.  I'm not going to engage in utter hyperbole and say that it's the greatest experience ever, but I think one would be hard pressed to find a school located in the Deep South that better prepares a young mind for success on a regional playing field at such an attractive price point.  Check out the University of Alabama.  You might be surprised by what you find.

name: The American Academy for Young Professionals Gr. 6 12
For Kids Only Learning Center & Playschool

review.author: Jakeia J.
review.description: My husband and I scheduled a tour to potentially place our son at the daycare. Our appt was at 8:30. We arrived a few minutes early. When we got there, there was no one at the front desk and we waited and after no one acknowledged us, I stepped into the common area. We were greeted (and i use that term loosley) by the someone who I later found out was the owner. She was not happy that we were there and she was not pleasant. She stated that she didn't schedule appointments, only walk ins.... so whoever answers the phone and the owner apparently didn't communicate that we were coming. Needless to say, if you have a 18 month old.... she won't have an availability  until December ( which is what I was told). She did motion for and say "just come on" but from her demeanor I was over her and we left. \nI'm not sure if she just has terrible customer service or if she was having a bad day or of she was annoyed with her worker for scheduling our appointment,  there is a way to handle people appropriately and she did not

review.author: Brooklyn A.
review.description: Just called to speak with someone about their services and the woman I talked to was extremely unpleasant. She was rude and short with me and sounded the least bit cheerful. Needless to say, this one is not a place I will be checking out for my son.

review.author: Krista g.
review.description: Where do I begin? My daughter was five months old when we left this facility and at that time in her short life she had been sick more than she was healthy. I understand that babies get sick, but she became ill with things that infants shouldn't be exposed to on a regular basis. She had several stomach viruses, pink eye (twice!), a bad ear infection due to bottle propping, and severe nasal congestion which lasted three months and resulted in two emergency trips to both the Children's hospital and the Children's outpatient center. Several times, I left her pacifier at home and found that they use daycare pacifiers (which is not sanitary whatsoever)! Even after informing them that my daughter should sleep in an inclined position on her back, I would walk in and find her asleep on her stomach in a crib. She does not normally sleep in this position and hates being on her stomach, so it made me wonder how long she screamed before she finally passed out. I rated this facility with two stars because all of the teachers really do seem to care for her and she enjoyed seeing them every day. The teachers would not ever share my requests about my daughter's care with one another. One thing that I wish they had done more of is allow my child to play. Because she was one of the littlest children in the baby room, she was often unable to play and learn new skills because the older babies would be allowed to run her over. She never received time to use the toys or exersaucers in the room because of this. If she wasn't being fed, she was in a bouncy seat or a swing. Once most of the older babies reached a certain age, both a television and a VCR were brought into the classroom. The children were placed in their chairs at the feeding table to watch movies. These are children who are under a year old, being held in a chair to watch television! During our last two days at this facility, the workers finally allowed my daughter to play with some of the toys in the room. They allowed her to play with a kick and play gym. When I told them that she would probably prefer something for a child who could sit they told me they were unaware that she could sit on her own. How can you spend 8-9 hours with my child for five days a week and not realize that she's been able to sit up on her own for about three weeks now? This facility is considered a church run facility and therefore does not have to follow the rules stated in the Minimum Standards for Daycare Facilities Regulations and Procedures for the state of Alabama. I walked in once and heard a teacher screaming at the top of her lungs at a child in the two year old classroom. I grabbed my daughter and just bolted out the door. I am not sure how the children are treated in older children's classrooms on a regular basis, but if they treat their babies (who cannot speak for themselves) this way, you should wonder about how your child may be treated.

name: First United Methodist Church Child Development

review.author: Ashley B.
review.description:
I cannot praise Kids First FMUC of Trussville enough. We LOVE the teachers and staff here, but I'll keep my review brief:

1. classrooms are big, bright, sunny, and clean.
2. New playgrounds, with separate play areas for bigs and littles.
3. shaded,  smaller play area that is just for toddlers.
4. Plenty of caretakers, and classes are always properly attended (we had an issue with this at another care provider).
5. Large, indoor gym for play during inclement weather.
6. Well-planned, developmentally appropriate lessons, lots of fun activities that my little loves. 
7. Did I mention that the staff is caring, warm, open, and communicative? 
8. School is organized and efficiently run.
9. Lunch is lunch - no organics or vegetarian options, but otherwise satisfactory, a lot like public school menus. Haven't had any complaints from my little about the food. 

For Secular moms: The curriculum is definitely Christian, and students attend a brief chapel service every morning, so expect your little to come home singing "god songs" and talking about Jesus. Religious messages are prominent in every classroom (as one would expect in a church-sponsored school).

review.author: Chris E.
review.description: My son was drug by him arm across the floor by a grown women. Then she went as far to snatch his back pack off his back and his matt out of his hand almost making him fall on his face. I watched it all. The director Amy is no better. I was checking on my son after all this happen on camera because there was two new teachers when I dropped him off and she came up to me ask me what I was doing I replied check on my son, and she went off embarrassing me in front of everybody and told me to take my son that day it wasn't working out. I would avoid this at all cost, it is really expensive and don't get nearly what u pay for, unless u want your kid drug across the floor by his arm, if that's  the case this would b a perfect place for u

name: University of Alabama School of Law

review.author: Jim B.
review.description: Our daughter is a quilter so we stopped in here for some fabric. People come to this store from Montreal to buy fabric because there are so few of these stores around. They have some beautiful fabrics and everything else you need for sewing and quilting. The owner is very nice and helpful.

name: North Troy Head Start & Early Head Start - Preschool

review.author: Joel S.
review.description: Love this school. Top notch staff and Christian foundation. The students are two grades ahead of public and none of the school drama.

review.author: A B.
review.description: My child has been a student at this school since kindergarten age 5 and is now 12 years old. This school is GREAT!! Hand down!! This is the first review that I have ever written in my life about anything. It breaks my heart from the last review I read and I cannot look away without writing something. From the school, kids, teaching staff I have NEVER had any bad experiences and the love of Christ is definitely in this place. The kids are taught to love each other as the Bible teaches us to love. The staff loves the kids and respect them as though they love their own. Besides from the administrator down to the teaches ALL of their kids goes to school there as well. So if a school was this horrible and you're on the staff, and your colleagues and the environment was this toxic, would you let your child go there? Point given!!! So regardless of personal issues and I do pray for the individual that have inner issues that are not school related, but lets be fair and give honest reviews because there are others out there that needs the honest truth in helping them make the decision of a school choice for their child the same way someone helped us. Glad I made the choice years ago. The school is GREAT!!!  This is Fact!!

review.author: Chris M.
review.description:
Bluewater Institute for Massage Therapy is an amazing school in the heart of Sheffield's revitalized historic district! The school operates as an intensive, advanced educational and training program that offers the opportunity to earn professional massage therapy certification.

The institute's Massage Therapy program is designed to prepare the student to be licensed as a massage therapist in the state of Alabama. This is a nice option for people interested in a career in growing field of massage therapy.

The location is convenient for anyone in the Muscle Shoals region. The BIMT staff is amazing and highly professional. They provide the instruction and on-hands expertise that guides students into their careers. 

If you're considering a career in massage therapy or a new vocational direction, then you might want to check them out.

review.author: Liz R.
review.description: Our kids have gone here for years (drums & piano). Some if the greatest people and teachers around are at BSOM. The staff is highly experienced and professional and our kids learn a lot!

review.author: Kelly D.
review.description: I would not recommend this music school.  The teacher was great, however there were issues with the owner's attitude when we withdrew. We withdrew due to the driving time being too much for us from Helena.  The owner was nice when our child was taking lessons but as soon as we withdrew he appeared ticked off and we ended up being charged for an extra month of lessons because he did not communicate to us, even though I asked him several times, if we were going to have to pay for two more months because I requested the withdrawal on the first of the month instead of the last day of the previous month. At first he told me that I would just be paying for the month I withdrew in, however when we saw money come out  the month after that and asked him why , we were told that it's because we didn't submit the request a month in advance.  By the time we realized the extra month of tuition had been taken our child had stopped going to lessons, because we thought he was done the month before that.  So we paid for a month that our child didn't even attend lessons in.  Be aware then, if you withdraw to get in writing the last day of lessons for your child and the last day that pymnt will be taken.\nREPLY TO OWNERS COMMENTS: when someone tells you on the first day of the month that they will not be returning next month that is 30 days notice. count the days. it's a month. You are only interested in the money and not the students. It does not say in your policies that you must cancel the last day of the month, it says a month in advance. And even if your policy was to cancel on the very last day of the month and someone cancels on the first day of the month then I would think that you would be kind enough to give them a break, otherwise your business may get the reputation of being a place that's only concerned about taking more money from their students. it was poor customer service. Oh one more thing....I did fill out a withdrawal form in person and spoke to Russ, as i mentioned in the review. He told me I would only be charged for the tuition for that month but then he charged me for two months. there was nothing at all on the form stating when the last pymnt would be and when the last lesson would be.  I just had to say that I was giving my notice that my son would not be returning to lessons the following month.

name: Calvary Baptist Church Kindergarten & Day Care

review.author: Chelsea S.
review.description:
I can't say enough wonderful thing about Lisa. From her professional perspective and insights- to providing actionable and realistic goals and objectives- she is wonderful.

At the beginning of COVID-19, almost a year ago, I met Lisa at a local coffee shop. We chatted and I knew she was the perfect person for me. She is someone who you can be open, honest and authentic with and not feel any judgment. 

The life lessons she has taught me I will carry throughout my entire life. My life has calmed, emotional and mentally, I am able to handle stress and life easier and apply my knowledge from Lisa to all situations. 

I oftentimes find myself saying, "What would Lisa do/say?" And in those moments, I find clarity and myself crushing those difficult or life moments. 

Without Lisa, I am not sure what my life would be like, and she has 100 percent change it for the better. I have continued with her for a year, and without a doubt, we have learned so much from one another. 

If you are unsure if life coaching is for you, everyone needs their person, and Lisa can be that person. You will not be disappointed. I recommend her to each and everyone who is searching for their outside person to speak to! Call her, it will be worth it!!

review.author: Lindsey F.
review.description: I sought out the help of Lisa during my college application process and could not have been happier! She helped me hone in on my strengths as an individual, what I wanted to study, and how to organize the applications I had to complete. I felt very overwhelemed and stressed and she gave me advice on how to handle the feeling of being stressed. So glad I went to her when I did and would reccomend her to anyone and everyone looking for any sort of life coaching!

review.author: Lori C.
review.description: Birmingham School of Photography is the BEST!!! Paris is the greatest teacher; she's very hands on.  The school is conveniently located and is extremely clean. The walls are adorned with gorgeous paintings. Paris have all types of snacks  available in the break room. If you desire to learn anything about photography this is definitely the place to be.

review.author: Alexandra G.
review.description: Mark and Karen are great people! Mark is a great instructor and thanks to him I passed my final. His class was fun and instructive. I am looking forward to taking my state exam and passing.

review.author: Janet A.
review.description: If you love Trump, have hatred for ex wives or like for someone to read a text book to you, Yarborough may be your man.  Otherwise I suggest you take an online course.

review.author: Vu H.
review.description: This class offered excellent lessons and informations if you really want to become a real estate agent.  The instructor is very knowledgable and know how to convey that knowledge to his students. This school setting environment sure beats any online classes.

review.author: Rashmee S.
review.description: We very much appreciate MKU. When we were looking for childcare and early education options for our son, we knew MKU was our choice school upon witnessing first hand the method, the facilities, the teachers, and the diversity of the student body. As American Muslims raised in Alabama, navigating the intersectionality of our various identities was often challenging, and upon becoming parents, we wanted to ensure our son would be cared for in an environment that embraces each individual child and their unique attributes. The staff here is highly professional and caring. The facilities are clean and uncluttered. I'm continually impressed by the activities that our now 14 month old partakes in: various fruit tastings, artwork, Spanish lessons, circle time, etc...So far, despite the expense (comparable to similar facilities in the area) we are so happy with our choice and eagerly look forward to our son's continued growth and development at this school/daycare.

name: Macon County Adult Basic Education Program

review.author: Richard N.
review.description: An historic institution of distinguished higher learning nestled within an extraordinarily beautiful campus. I finally visited the book store and was blown away at its size and availability of gear, including a few Greek options, that included gear I hadn't seen before.  I dove in on a few TU Mom, Dad, and sister shirts, as well as some Frat 'nalia, and I walked out spending ONLY $100!! \n\nI can't wait to return.

review.author: Renia L.
review.description:
One of the most beautiful historically black college campuses i've ever seen. Red bricked buildings adorned the campus.. it has that preserved look. The history that comes with its beauty is what I truly loved.

You can visit the George Washington Carver Museum, tour the home Booker T. Washington built and visit the burial site of him and his family along with other historic burial sites..all of which are located in the heart of campus. I recommend you see everything!

The university was oddly very quiet. Which left us to assume that the students were in their dorms feverishly studying. 

Make sure to visit the Tuskegee Airmen National Museum on your way into campus (crawford st.)  it's simply amazing to see and read about the young airmen. Emotional to say the least.

review.author: Blake I.
review.description:
Tuskegee was founded in 1881 and led by Dr. Booker T. Washington. The university has national prominence for its programs in Agriculture and Engineering. Many of the buildings on the historic campus were built with the assistance of students.  

Located in a small town, the campus maintains a conference center that includes lodging and restaurant facilities for visitors.  My visit to the campus was enjoyable as everyone was friendly, pleasant and welcoming. 

Some of the many interesting sites to visit on campus include the George Washington Carver Museum, the National Center for Bioethics in Research and Health Care, and the grave sites for Dr. Booker T. Washington and Dr. George Washington Carver. You should reserve time to visit the museums to learn more about the contributions this institution made to this country.

review.author: Jackie S.
review.description: This institution is so special to me because it is a HBCU university. My grandson is a freshman 2018-2019 year. An awesome and amazing, so much history abound Tuskegee University is so outstanding!!

review.author: Bunny B.
review.description: None better!  The professors are dedicated to the school and the students.  I graduated many moons ago and my affection and admiration have not diminished.  The business education that I received has served me well - through my MBA and law school.  The school offers a terrific foundation in a small town where values still prevail.

review.author: Richard N.
review.description: There is nothing in the world like an HBCU.  We dropped my first born off for his freshman year and what an experience.  Upperclassmen met us at every corner from the front gate with Pom poms and warm welcomes all the way to his dorm.  Initially I was flustered by the long route to his dorm, but that was part of the experience provided by the welcoming committee - celebration of your hard work, future, and the legacy of all who have gone this way before, that my son will add to during his tenure as student and future alumnus. SKEGEE!!!!!!!

review.author: Larry S.
review.description:
This is a review of the historical parts of the school. 
       Very nice GWC museum with a lot of his personal effects. Remember many of the buildings were built by the STUDENTS!! Very humbling. Super friendly attendant at the museum.
       The Lifting the Veil of Slavery bronze statue is arguably the best statue in the world. That sounds stupid but in a world filled with statues of military heroes and the like this really is an amazing, moving, visceral, real presence. 
     The cemetery speaks for itself.

review.author: Tiffany M.
review.description: Great university rich in heritage and tradition! I would recommend it to anyone perusing an education especially in the sciences.

review.author: Megan C.
review.description: Tuskegee University is where all of my family went to school. It's a great historic town.. It's certainly not much to do there.. I really only go for my family and any big events that's going on campus, but it's a great college for education!

review.author: Chandra H.
review.description: Great place for higher education. Beautiful architecture. The George Washington Carver museum is a must see. Friendly and helpful students and staff.

review.author: A. C.
review.description:
Mixed emotions! The faculty and staff in my college are great! Love em to death. They are great ppl that are helpful in every way. These ppl truly have your interests and goals at heart and pushes you to your full potential. However the administration is another thing. As with any institution you expect to have bumps and road blocks, but the workers in the Financial Aid and the Bursar's office are HORRIBLE! I dread having to go in either office. They are rude, they talk down to you, and they're unwiling to help you, explain, or clear up any misunderstandings. They never answer the phones (and I've seen them ignore the phone while I was waiting in line). And they just have bad attitudes. 
Paperwork is always missing and it never fails, something always comes up at the end of the semester where you end up having to pay some fee that mysteriously wasn't covered or paid at the beginning of the semester. I can go on.
But despite those few problems the university is fine. 

The things we put up with to be a Tuskegee Alum!

review.author: Gaz H.
review.description: Such a treat to see Booker T. Washington's dream made concrete and extended into the present day as Tuskegee University. As for the National Park Service historical site itself, that really comprises just the Oaks (Washington's on-campus residence) and the George Washington Carver museum. Both are interesting and worth a visit, but not enough to depict Booker T.'s impact on America and his central efforts to improve the lot of the recently emancipated populations in the South. Good effort, but there is more to be done to make the site a more impactful attraction and celebration of Washington.

review.author: ann s.
review.description: This school was started in 1881 as the Tuskegee Normal School for Colored Teachers.  It's first president was Booker T. Washington who felt that his students could best improve themselves through hard work and self-discipline.  On campus is a National Park Service visitor center which is located in the building that once held  the campus laundry. \n\nThe visitor center contains a large exhibit area as well as 2 short films covering the lifes of Booker T. Washington and George W. Carver, the institutes most popular professor.  Both of these gentlemen are also buried on the campus grounds.  Arrangements can be made at the visitor center to tour The Oaks, this was Booker T. Washington's home.
